Name: Security Technician
Description: Due to growth nationally, we are seeking Security Technicians from all levels of experience.COVID has taught us to consider what is really important. Be valued, have purpose and make a difference to your countries security. With over twenty years of experience, Secom Technical Services, designs installs and maintains complete electronic and cybersecurity requirements for the Australian market.If you are alleged to our TECH Values we want to hear from you.Trustworthy: Delivering quality work reliably to completionEffective: Solid desire to consistently achieve the best possible outcomeCollaborative: True interest in working together to drive improved business outcomesHonesty: Always show ethical integrity through your work and behaviourEmployee BenefitsCompany Vehicle or Car allowance with Novated Lease OptionsTools of the trade providedPhone or sim, and LaptopPetrol CardCar ParkExternal training paid by the business; Project Management or Cyber Security DegreeSocial Team Building EventsFamily Fun DaysMentoring ProgramLeadership Program delivered by Sydney Swans Psychological CoachWhat’s it like working at Secom you ask??‘Our team is supported to do our best every day by our leader. He does this with his enthusiasm for his role, and his availability to talk about jobs, clients, or any questions/problems that we have. He ensures we have a great team culture!’ (Senior Security Technician, NSW)‘My supervisor instantly made me feel like I was working with a friend instead of just a boss. He goes above and beyond every day for his technicians and does anything he can to provide great support, ideas and comradery.’(Security Technician ACT)About you:High standard of ethics and you are aligned with our TECH ValuesQuality trade skills and you love tinkering with electronicsCurrent or ability to obtain a ACT/NSW Security LicenceCurrent or ability to obtain an Australian Government Security ClearanceCurrent drivers’ licenceCurrent or ability to obtain a cabling licenceCurrent Construction or ability to obtain a white cardCurrent or ability to obtain Asbestos Awareness cardStrong communication and stakeholder engagement skillsStrong attention to detail/situational awarenessObtains or ability to obtain an AGSVA ClearanceDesirable:Demonstrated Site Lead/ Electrical Forman experianceCert 3 or undergoing Cert 3 qualification in electrical, security or allied industries and/or trade based experienceAbility to program security systems such as GallagherAbility to perform basic ICT networking3 or more years experienceFault identification, isolation, repair, and reporting on systems installed and managedSound skills in electronic data and documentation managementVery effective report writing both technical and non-technicalStrong ability to perform cabling, fit off (including panels), and commissioning of electronic security systemsStrong ability to create engineering documentation including Cable Schedules and For Construction DrawingsIt's time for a change; join a global organisation that supports you like family.https://www.secomts.com  https://www.linkedin.com/company/secom-technical-services-pty-ltd/posts/?feedView=all&viewAsMember=true Please call our HR Manager, Lisa Sutton to have a confidential conversation ​02 5115 0635 or simply apply now.ACT Master Security Licence # 17501793

Name: CONSULTANT, NETWORKS AND SECURITY SERVICES
Description: Position Summary   The Network and Security Consultant shall Interface with our valued clients to develop secure network solutions. Will participate in Assessments, Audits, Design, and deployment projects in Network, Security and Virtualization. These Projects will be specific to enabling a connected enterprise / IT-OT convergence / Industry 4.0 by connecting the Industrial Internet of Things. Will need good understanding and experience of networking and security concepts for the OT side.   Potential candidates should have:   Minimum Qualifications / skill sets: Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science or Information Technology or related technology driven degree with minimum 5 years of work experience. If no degree, 15+ years of experience in Manufacturing Control Systems, Network Engineering, and Industrial Security Controls.  Hands-on experience configuring IT/OT equipment (Cisco ASA, Cisco Switches, Firewalls, Virtual Server Environments, Anti-Virus Software, Continuous Threat Detection). Previous experience working as part of a large, multi-disciplinary team completing full project life-cycle implementations.  Cisco / VMWare / Cybersecurity related certifications (CCNA, CCNP, VCP, GISSP, IEC 62443) Travel Requirements - Flexibility for travel 25% - 75% is required and can include both domestic and international trips.   Job RequirementsExperience in design and deploying security controls for an Industrial Network. These can include system management hardening, device hardening, end point security, perimeter security, disaster recovery, threat detection and monitoring as examples.  Understanding of NIST 800-82, NERC-CIP, IEC-62443 Standards Solid technical skills with EtherNet/IP or other Ethernet based networks, specifically around assessment, design and implementation of complex systems.  Strong commercial skills, ability to handle multiple projects, communication skills, ability to diagnose automation problems and interact with teams, clients and vendors. Familiarity with a variety of security and/or networking concepts, practices, and procedures, to include manufacturing and enterprise network convergence, network protocols, communication optimization, application effects on system performance and human exploitation techniques on the manufacturing network.  Experience in developing and deploying solutions in a virtual environment.   Desirable: Experience in Network Architecture, PLC, Networking and SCADA design/programming including data extraction and data analysis.  Exposure to PLC programming packages (Rockwell or comparable platforms) is desirable.  Design, implement and support customer’s converged business and manufacturing/industrial systems and user needs in parallel with their overall business strategies.  Write detailed documentation that could include user needs, system specifications, observed issues with remediation recommendations or implementation requirements in order to develop or modify manufacturing infrastructure.Design, recommend, and implement system security changes.  Design customer secure manufacturing architecture and provides vision, problem anticipation, and problem solving ability to customers.

Name: ZScaler Engineer
Description: The Role:A Senior Consultant to design and configure network and systems configuration to enable customers to use the Zscaler cloud technologies. In this role, you will be a key resource, working hand-in-hand with the deployment team, sales, partners and customers, to provide professional consultancy services to ensure proper design, configuration, resiliency, and overall best practices are followed. And while experience on the company's platform is desired, even more important is having a solid foundation in networking and security technologies.   Responsibilities:    Provide deployment services including best practice design, recommendations, and configurations Progress and uphold expertise in deploying advanced Zscaler product features and functionality Travel to customer locations to assist customers in short-term professional service engagements Ensure client needs are met and deliverables produced on time according as defined in the Statement of Work Migrate customers from legacy firewall technologies to Zscaler Platforms. Assist customers with testing or troubleshooting during the deployment. Escalate to support as required Reproduce customer issues to verify problems and document steps to replicate for Support, Engineering and Operations teams Become a Zscaler cloud services expert through self-study, company training, and a desire to excel    Minimum Qualifications:  4+ years of prior work experience in similar positions (e.g. Professional Consultant, Solutions Architect, Technical Marketing Engineer or a Support Engineer). Must be ZIA/ZPA certified Minimum Education: Technical bachelor’s degree and/or equivalent work experience. Experience deploying and maintaining large scale networking, firewall or security solutions in enterprise environments is important. Experience with Zscaler is very helpful. Able to learn and support cutting-edge technologies while context-switching. Strong understanding of how to navigate technical and architectural discussions. Comfortable talking about technical topics/issues with business people and business topics/issues with technical people; Able to express complex concepts in plain language to reach broader audiences. Excellent communication and follow-up skills across internal and external organizations. Ability to travel to partner sites, conferences, and other related events as required. Professional experience architecting, and operating solutions built on (in order of preference): Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform and other leading cloud platforms. Experience with Hypervisors (in order of preference): VMware, Hyper-V, and KVM is essential. Industry certifications such as CCIE, JNCIE, PCNSE, CISSP or CCSP preferred. Effectively handle multiple projects and work calmly under pressure Working knowledge of authentication systems such as SAML, LDAP and MS Active Directory Deep understanding of IPSEC, GRE, HTTP/HTTPS, DNS protocols Experience with Proxy and SSL is essential. Understanding of cybersecurity technologies, protocols and applications. Versatile with using various operating systems including Windows, Mac, and GNU/Linux Hands-on knowledge with network troubleshooting using tools such as Wireshark, tcpdump, Traceroute, and MTR    HOW TO APPLY?Submit your interest by applying now or contact  Tom Watt – tom.watt@ampion.com.au for more information on a career with Ampion.

Name: Talent Acquisition Partner
Description: Talent Acquisition Consultant   BE PART OF OUR EVOLUTION Welcome to Ampion a Wipro company. Ampion is a technology services provider delivering a new level of specialisation at scale. As an independent subsidiary of Wipro, we deliver scalability and a breadth of capabilities, combined with the depth of global experience.   Ampion’s three areas of specialisation provide an engineering focus and strategic approach across software assurance (Assure), technology security (Secure), and digital transformation (Transform).   THE ROLE   We are searching for a passionate Talent Acquisition Consultant to join our high performing Talent team within Cybersecurity and Risk. An excellent opportunity to work in a high-profile team during an exciting transition period.   Talent Acquisition plays a pivotal role in our ongoing evolution and growth. You’ll have the ability to make a real contribution to the team, bring new ideas to the table and be involved in end-to-end recruitment. We are open to seeing individuals who have experience working within the Technology sector – ideally Cybersecurity (internal and/or agency experience).   The Talent team are all currently working remote, however the preferred candidate will be able to travel to either Sydney, Melbourne or Brisbane a couple of times per month for team meetings etc.    In this role you’ll have the opportunity to progress your amazing Talent Acquisition skills as well as adapt and learn new skills. In addition to sourcing great candidates, you will get the opportunity to work closely with our amazing administration and HR team, ensuring our candidates have a smooth and enjoyable onboarding experience and have a great start to life at Ampion.  We support all our employees learning and development. If this role sounds exciting to you; we want to hear from you!   KEY REQUIREMENTS  End-to-end technology Talent Acquisition experience (internal and/or agency) specialising in either Testing & Automation, Software Development, Digital Engineering or Project Services. Previous responsibility for the full recruitment cycle – working with hiring managers, taking job briefs, developing candidate search strategies, talent pooling, advertising / marketing jobs and other innovative sourcing methods Familiarity with job boards, databases and Applicant Tracking Systems (preferably JobAdder) Experience using professional social networks (LinkedIn is a must!) Be passionate about the candidate journey and ensure Ampion’s employer branding shines through! Ability to work with hiring managers and the wider business Excellent teamwork skills A professional and positive attitude Communication is key! Whether you are communicating with candidates, employees, hiring managers or your team – we expect someone to have excellent communication and interpersonal skills Outstanding organisation skills, this can be a fast-paced role! You’ll need to be able to manage multiple tasks at one time We do not micro-manage –you will need to be self-driven and able to set your own priorities    WHAT CAN AMPION OFFER YOU? We want to attract like-minded people to our team who are passionate about building successful teams and maintaining an employee first culture. Ampion offers rewarding careers and the opportunity to sink your teeth into whatever your passions might be.  We have a collaborative and supportive culture where everyone gets a voice. Flexible working arrangements Regular team building activities (Virtual Quiz nights, Amazing Race etc) Fortnightly awards to acknowledge the hard-working efforts of the team Opportunity to take IT certifications Plus much more  Ampion is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We believe in leveraging individual talents, to empower and support you to be the best version of you. We create teams that people want to be a part of and a culture that we are proud of.   WHAT’S NEXT? Ready to join our evolution? Submit your interest by applying now or contact our Head of Talent Acquisition - Tom Watt, tom.watt@ampion.com.au for more information on a career with Ampion. Please follow our new page on LinkedIn @Ampion to keep up to date!

Name: Security Support Engineer
Description: Founded in 2014, and listed on the ASX since 2015, Superloop’s purpose is to enable better internet for Australian homes and businesses, by enabling challenger retail brands (including our own Superloop and Exetel brands) to take a larger share of the market, leveraging Superloop’s Infrastructure-on-Demand platform. Superloop operates in three segments of the market: consumer connectivity, business network and security solutions, and wholesale connectivity, all of which leverage Superloop’s investments in physical infrastructure assets including fibre, subsea cables and fixed wireless, as well as Superloop’s software platforms. Hundreds of thousands of homes and businesses rely on Superloop and Exetel everyday for their connectivity needs.Visit www.superloop.com to learn more.Our IT Security Support Engineers are responsible for providing level 2/3 support to our customers of our cyber-safety products. The Security Support Engineer provides a hybrid of systems and networking expertise to ensure timely resolution of technical issues, implementation of our cyber-safety products, proactive consultation, and continued high quality services to our customers. CyberHound, is a Next Generation Firewall that is one of the most advanced sets of multi-layered ‘defence in depth’ security platforms to deliver reliable cybersecurity for schools. Our platform assists to secure a network as well as protect it from ransomware, malware, zero-day threats, phishing and more.This platform sets the benchmark for K12 security coupled with the extensive set of additional features that are part of our Advanced Threat Protection Suite – ensuring peace of mind for school communities.Visit www.cyberhound.com to learn more What will you do?Receive and manage customer support queries and issues, providing technical expertise and timely resolution;Update and maintain internal knowledge bases to facilitate a better understanding of recurring issues;Build, image and configure cyber-safety hardware for customers;Contribute to product documentation and identify areas to improve the customer experience;Liaise with our sales team to qualify customer requirements and product specifications, and process technical orders; Assist with software testing and quality assurance, and;Stock control and ordering. Who do we want to apply?The successful candidate will have:Strong networking knowledge, in areas such as switching and routing;Broad technical knowledge (including TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP, SMTP, POP3, IMAP, XMPP);Familiarity with wired and wireless networking, centralised authentication systems (Active Directory, eDirectory, Open Directory), operating systems (Windows client and server, OS X, iOS, Android and Linux), VMware, Hyper-V, and server hardware;General understanding of MS Office tools, G Suite, hardware, and CRMs (Salesforce);Knowledge of server authentication integration (e.g. AD and/or RADIUS);Experience with network firewalls, and;Ability to diagnose issues through troubleshooting and investigation, and provide an excellent customer experience. What can we do for you?As we grow and evolve, we want you to as well. We’re progressive. We understand that life exists outside of work which is why we have a flexible approach to the way we work. We’re innovators. Innovation is part of our identity, which is why we celebrate the uniqueness of yours. We’re easy-going. We pride ourselves on creating a fun, casual and relaxed environment. Ditch the corporate attire if you want to - embrace it if that’s your thing. What matters most is that you’re comfortable when you come to work. We welcome diversity. We encourage and seek out diversity of backgrounds and opinions, because we know differences challenge us and help us grow.We give back. In addition to annual and sick leave, we give you the opportunity to spend some paid time away from work doing something meaningful with five personal development days per year. You can use these to help out in the school tuckshop, attend training for your own personal development, or lend a hand to a meaningful charity if you would like to. We stand by our product. We’re confident we have the best connectivity product on the market so we offer our employees free connection to our home broadband service. You have an opportunity to be part of the next exciting part of our journey. What are you waiting for?

Name: Senior Information Technology Engineer - MSP
Description: GKM2 is a boutique next generation Microsoft Technology Partner and specialist Managed IT Services and Security provider based in Sydney. We were recently ranked in CRN's Fast50 Australia's biggest celebration of IT channel success; https://www.crn.com.au/fast50/presentation-2021/17-gkm2-solutions#viewThe role provides an exciting opportunity for an experienced Senior Systems Engineer to take his/her role to the next level and to lead our small team and be a key contact to our clients. This is primarily a work from home opportunity so a dedicated quiet space is essential, with all ongoing operating expenses such as Internet and Laptop paid for. You must be based in Greater Sydney to be close proximity to our clients.ResponsibilitiesProviding 3rd Level technical resolution to our clients via our ticketing system in relation to desktop, server, network and all related infrastructure issues such as software installations, configuration, maintenance and security either over the phone/remote or onsite.Assisting and taking escalations from our Level 2 Technical Staff.Managing and Training our Level 2 Technical Staff.Microsoft 365 management and support, including but not limited to; Exchange Online, SharePoint Online, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, Endpoint Manager (Intune), Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps, Windows Defender for 365 and Endpoint, Enterprise and Mobility, Microsoft 365 E5.Leading technical projects such as new client onboarding, Server Migration Projects (on prem to on prem, on prem to cloud, cloud to cloud), Microsoft 365 and Azure Migrations.Working with Email Security and Backup and Archive Technologies such as AvePoint Cloud Backup and Proofpoint Essentials.Improving our Company's technical standards and processes, including client documentation, clients checklists, and introducing automation to improve efficiencies.You will be a primary contact to all our clients.Qualifications and Experience RequiredPrevious experience in an MSP environment is essential.Minimum 10 years of experience of configuring and supporting desktops, servers and networks (firewalls, switches, routers, wireless access points)Strong working networking knowledge (switching, routing, VLAN, WLAN, WAN, VPN)Strong working knowledge of all aspects of Microsoft 365 and associated services including, Microsoft Identity Management,  Enterprise Mobility and MDM.Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Azure including migrations and new builds.Excellent knowledge of common Antivirus (EDR) and Backup Applications and SolutionsStrong working knowledge of Windows Servers and have worked with and implemented all key server technologies such as Active Directory, DHCP, DNS, File & Print Services, Group Policy, Remote Desktop Services Farm etcStrong working knowledge and understanding of Virtualisation Technologies such as VMware, Hyper-V, Azure Virtual Desktop.Strong PowerShell/VB Scripting and/other scripting languagesStrong working knowledge of Linux OS, Build, Configuration and Administration.Cybersecurity SkillsStrong Analytical and Troubleshooting SkillsHighly Desirable Experience and technical working knowledge ofSophos XG/S Firewalls (firewall rules, NAT rules, SSL, IPSEC tunnels)Sophos Advanced Endpoint SecurityTechnical Certifications MS-100/101 and/or AZ-104Working with either N-Able N-Central/RMM, Datto RMM or similarWorking with ConnectWise Ticketing or similarWorking with Meraki Firewalls, Switching and Wireless Access PointsTelephony VoIP Skills and Microsoft Teams CallingITIL understandingPersonal Attributes RequiredExcellent verbal and written communication skillsWell Presented (Neat and Tidy)Self MotivatedExcellent Customer Service Skills - You will be customer facing!Ability to Work Under PressureEnjoys working with a team and helping othersGKM2 BenefitsWorking with a small organisation that really values their employeesAn easy-going environment and culture (we all enjoy what we do)Company LaptopOngoing TrainingWork from Home / Paid InternetWork with a wide variety of technologies - never gets boring hereLead the Team and work directly with the 2 Co-FoundersPaid Certification ExamsAre you ready to join a boutique well respected MSP? Do you have what it takes to take your career to the next level working on various technologies and platforms? To apply for this role, please include a separate cover letter together with your current resume, and in this letter please include: HashTag #ILoveTechnologyYour favourite DishOne hashtag that best describes youGenuine direct applications only.

Name: ICT Cloud Engineer
Description: Company description:The Royal Children's Hospital's (RCH) vision is to be a great children's hospital - delivering Great Care, Everywhere.RCH is located within the Melbourne Biomedical Precinct, with more than 45 world-class biomedical organisations and more than 50,000 of the brightest minds working together to make the Precinct number one in the Asia Pacific region for health, education, research, and training. Within this, RCH is also a cornerstone member of the Melbourne Children's Campus, partnering with Murdoch Children's Research Institute, The University of Melbourne Department of Paediatrics and The Royal Children's Hospital Foundation. Each organisation contributes to a paediatric academic health centre which is greater than the sum of its parts.  RCH has cared for the children and young people of Victoria for more than 150 years since it was founded in 1870. A full range of paediatric and adolescent health services are provided plus tertiary and quaternary care for the most critically ill and medically complex patients in Victoria. Tasmania, southern NSW and other states around Australia and overseas. The RCH is the only provider of heart transplant services and CAR T-cell therapy for paediatrics in Australia. RCH is an effective advocate for patients and their families with a particular focus on vulnerable children and increasingly, mental health in young people. The hospital also supports many health promotion and prevention programs. The Hospital has more than 6,000 staff, a budget of $850M, 12 wards and 350 beds. Annually, the RCH has 300,000+ Specialist Clinic appointments, 90,000+ Emergency Department presentations and 20,000 elective surgeries.We work collaboratively with hospitals to deliver the right care, in the right place, at the right time. The RCH is committed to the Child Safe Standards: http://www.rch.org.au/quality/child-safety/RCH enjoys high employee engagement and is committed to staff safety and a positive culture through enactment of our Compact.Further information about RCH is available at www.rch.org.auJob description:ICT Cloud EngineerThe RCH Information Communication and Technology (ICT) Department has a pipeline of key projects, as part of a major digital transformation, to implement to drive innovation, bring in new ways of working and support the ongoing operation of the hospital.   The Cloud Engineer role is responsible for managing and maintaining key components of the RCH cloud and on premise Infrastructure platforms.  Specifically, the role focusses on: The cloud, physical and virtual compute and storage infrastructure supporting the provision of technology services to the RCH Delivery and support of the RCH cloud services migration Supporting and maintaining the delivery of critical services such as  Active Directory, File & Print, Backup & Recovery, Identity and Access Management (IDAM) and Group Policy Contributing to the delivery of RCH Cybersecurity protections, including the DHHS Cybersecurity Baseline Controls Administering and supporting the cloud based services including email, Office 365, and ensuring delivery, capacity and security meet organisational requirements Managing customer stakeholder relationships Key Selection CriteriaThe skills and experience you will need to demonstrate include: Demonstrated Windows Server experience in a 24x7 support environment. Demonstrated cloud experience, either Azure or Amazon Web Services Demonstrated experience with server virtualization technologies such as VMWare Strong understanding enterprise storage and backup needs A working knowledge of the desktop operating system (Windows 7 / Windows 10 / Apple MacOS X). Familiarity with deploying applications to remote workstations using third-party software distribution tools such as Microsoft SCCM, Microsoft Intune, thin client, or login scripts. A working knowledge of Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol (TCP/IP), Microsoft's implementation of TCP/IP, and Domain Name System (DNS). An ability to effectively prioritise tasks and successfully problem solve and trouble-shoot issues. Demonstrated strong commitment and adherence to process and change control practices. Strong customer service with the demonstrated ability to build and maintain  key working relationships across organisation and ensuring a high level of service to customers Demonstrated ability to lead others in the pursuit of team goals Excellent organisational and planning  skills Excellent  verbal communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with a variety of stakeholders Highly developed attention to detail Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion Highly developed organisational and planning skills Ability to work with initiative, autonomy and lead a team Demonstrated ability to respond flexibly to client needs with the ability to develop practical solutions to problems and provide advice in area of expertise To view the Position Description please click hereWhy work at the RCH?RCH is committed to a positive culture through enactment of our Compact. We offer the opportunity to work in world-class facilities,  surrounded by Royal Park and only a short tram trip from the heart of Melbourne city.We also offer discounted staff parking, salary packaging, and an award-winning health and wellbeing program.The RCH is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from culturally and/or linguistically diverse background,  all members of the LGBTQI community and people with disability.All applicants please be aware that it is a requirement of your employment that you be fully vaccinated against Covid-19, in compliance with any public health orders in place at the time of, and during, employment. Applicants will be required to provide their Australian Government COVID -19 vaccination Certificate, it is a requirement of the RCH to collect, record and hold vaccination information.While RCH has an obligation to consider all Australian and Permanent Resident applicants in the first instance, RCH welcomes applications from overseas healthcare professionals and may consider supporting visa applications.Currently, international and returning Australian health workers may be eligible for an allowance of $10,000 to  help fund relocation costs to Victoria. Further information can be found on the Department of Health's website: https://www.health.vic.gov.au/medical-workforce-in-victoria/international-recruitment. Are you ready to join our team?  Apply online by clicking on the "Apply" buttonApplications close 29 June 2022

Name: Presales Engineer
Description: About the RoleAs a Presales Engineer you will work closely with our clients, vendors, solution architects and sales team to perform technical presales activities such as proof of concepts and demonstrations. Whilst utilising your technical knowledge and expertise to scope and quote solutions across the full technology stack including, networking, security, collaboration, data centre and cloud. This role is an ideal opportunity to learn from our team of integration experts and accelerate your career. ResponsibilitiesWork directly with clients to design robust solutions that meet their business outcomesProvide presales technical design, quoting, scoping, and support Collaborate with the delivery team to ensure detailed handover of designs and solutionsAssist the sales team and solution architects in the preparation of tender response creation and submission including design and costing of solutions with vendorsProduce quality documentation that is concise, readable, and presentableIdentify new business opportunities products, services, and markets for continued company growth  Technical Skills and ExperienceMust be good with numbers and quoting methodologiesOne or more of the following Cisco certificationsCisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP Enterprise or CCNP Security)A tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline2+ years technical experience with the Cisco routing and switching What will make you a good fit?Desire to learn and gain additional experience and certificationsCapable of creating and maintaining high-quality documentationStrong outcomes focus – client and companyStrong sense of accountability for your performance and actionsTeam player and ability to work autonomouslyAbility to adapt to changing situationsStrong troubleshooting skills with a passion for technologyWell-developed interpersonal, communication and presentation skills About ArchiTechArchiTech Network & Communications Solutions is a fast-growing Australian owned and operated ICT solutions integrator, specialising in enterprise networking, wireless, cybersecurity, collaboration, data centre and IoT technologies. With a focus on providing exceptional value and outcomes for our clients, we use our experience and industry expertise, to map leading world class technologies to organisational needs, and deliver custom solutions to suit. We have designed and delivered integrated solutions to some of the largest healthcare providers in Australia. Our approach to client engagement is what makes us stand out from the crowd - working closely with our clients to truly understand their business requirements, resulting in better delivery of outcomes and greater satisfaction to all. www.architech.net.au Why work at ArchiTech?We believe that when staff enjoy what they do, it drives them to work at their best. To us our people are not just workers, they are part of the fabric that makes ArchiTech a great place to work.An attractive remuneration package with flexible working optionsOpportunity to get involved in a variety of interesting, challenging and rewarding ICT projectsCareer development through training, mentoring, new product learnings and cross industry exposure Diverse and inclusive workplace with a supportive culture, where you can have fun and be yourself!How to applyTo start an application, click on ‘apply’ and submit the following:an up-to-date resume detailing your relevant experience for the rolea cover letter (max 1 page) specifically addressing the above criteria and your suitability to the role advertisedArchiTech reserve the right to close off this position early as applications will be considered upon receipt.  Please note:Only shortlisted candidates will be contactedYou must have the right to work permanently in AustraliaAn offer of employment will be subject to a satisfactory National Police Clearance and Working with Children Check being provided to ArchiTechIn line with Government directions that apply to our client base, ArchiTech will require a copy of your Covid-19 Vaccination CertificateYou must have a valid Australian driver’s license and use of a personal vehicle to perform this roleFor any enquiries, please contact careers@architech.net.au

Name: Senior Systems Engineer
Description: We are an IT services and solution company that has an excellent opportunity with a large government department of 600+ staff. We are looking for a Senior Systems Engineer, with advanced technical experience and great communication skills, for a 18 month, part-time contract to assist us with the maintenance of a major government client. We require the applicant to have a minimum 2 - 3 days available to work, but this can sometimes ramp up to 5 days depending on changing client requirements. Starting at a probational contract rate of $95 inc GST per hour, this will increase to $105 inc GST per hour after 3 months and there is room to negotiate for a further increase after 12 month's exceptional performance. It would be preferable if you have a consulting background as this is a client-facing role and requires the ability to establish rapport and build strong relationships with people.  In this role you will be responsible for project work, design, installation, configuration, monitoring, day-to-day maintenance and support of IT systems including the following: Amazon Web ServicesWindows Server, Active Directory, SQLCitrix XenApp, NetscalerOffice 365IIS, web-based systemsCybersecurity practicesBackup SystemsBasic Networking SkillsAdvanced Troubleshooting SkillsAbility to handle various projects and BAU tasks concurrently Our major client is based in Newington and there is an expectation to be onsite, particularly at the start of the contract.  If you are interested in this incredible opportunity, please send applications to jobs@dotait.com.au. We are looking at conducting interviews as soon as possible.

Name: Senior Security & Network Engineer
Description: About the RoleAs Senior Security & Network Engineer you will be required to work in support and project delivery, but your primary role will be delivering security and networking projects to our clients. Naturally you will be able to work in a team with other engineers, but can also take the lead on projects, working autonomously to deliver required outcomes. Our clients are many and varied, which may mean travelling to client sites at times, so a valid driver's licence and personal car will be required. You will have sound technical knowledge and delivery experience, ensuring high quality service delivery backed by great customer service mannerisms and excellent documentation skills. Time management and a willingness to interact with the client are critical to your success in the role. ResponsibilitiesSecurity and networking design and implementationResponsible for running projects as an individual and as part of a teamWriting and peer reviewing ‘as built’ technical documentationEscalation point for security and networking customer issuesProviding leadership and guidance to junior engineersDevelopment of technical tasks and associated work estimates for input into customer proposals as required Technical Skills and ExperienceCurrent Cisco Security and/or Fortinet Certification (CCNP or CCIE, NSE 4, 5 or 7 level)Current Cisco Routing and Switching Certification (CCNP or CCIE desirable)Data Centre experience desirableNetwork/Systems integration experience Practical and autonomous project delivery skills7+ years hands on experience delivering projects5+ years design and implementation experience Relevant tertiary qualifications or equivalent experienceDemonstrated experience as a subject matter expert in security including network firewalls, Authentication, Authorisation, and Accounting (AAA) systems, IPS, web filtering and malware protectionExperience in consulting and as a project lead for your discipline (desirable)Well-developed routing/switching and security skills and a familiarity with a majority of the following platforms: Cisco ISECisco DNAC (Highly desirable but not essential)Cisco FirepowerFortinet Product Suite, including FortiManager and FortiAnalyser What will make you a good fit?Desire to learn and gain additional experience and certificationsCapable of creating and maintaining high-quality documentationStrong outcomes focus – client and companyStrong sense of accountability for your performance and actionsTeam player and ability to work autonomouslyAbility to adapt to changing situationsStrong troubleshooting skills with a passion for technology and cybersecurityWell-developed interpersonal, communication and presentation skillsAbility to communicate effectively at all levels as a subject matter expert to stakeholders About ArchiTechArchiTech Network & Communications Solutions is a fast-growing Australian owned and operated ICT solutions integrator, specialising in enterprise networking, wireless, cybersecurity, collaboration, data centre and IoT technologies. With a focus on providing exceptional value and outcomes for our clients, we use our experience and industry expertise, to map leading world class technologies to organisational needs, and deliver custom solutions to suit. We have designed and delivered integrated solutions to some of the largest healthcare providers in Australia. Our approach to client engagement is what makes us stand out from the crowd - working closely with our clients to truly understand their business requirements, resulting in better delivery of outcomes and greater satisfaction to all. www.architech.net.au Why work at ArchiTech?We believe that when staff enjoy what they do, it drives them to work at their best. To us our people are not just workers, they are part of the fabric that makes ArchiTech a great place to work.An attractive remuneration package with flexible working optionsOpportunity to get involved in a variety of interesting, challenging and rewarding ICT projectsCareer development through training, mentoring, new product learnings and cross industry exposure Diverse and inclusive workplace with a supportive culture, where you can have fun and be yourself!How to applyTo start an application, click on ‘apply’ and submit the following:an up-to-date resume detailing your relevant experience for the rolea cover letter (max 1 page) specifically addressing the above criteria and your suitability to the role advertisedArchiTech reserve the right to close off this position early as applications will be considered upon receipt.  Please note:Only shortlisted candidates will be contactedYou must have the right to work permanently in AustraliaAn offer of employment will be subject to a satisfactory National Police Clearance and Working with Children Check being provided to ArchiTechIn line with Government directions that apply to our client base, ArchiTech will require a copy of your Covid-19 Vaccination CertificateYou must have a valid Australian driver’s license and use of a personal vehicle to perform this roleFor any enquiries, please contact careers@architech.net.au

Name: Industrial Control System Engineer
Description: Who we are….At SUEZ we are passionate about environmental services and our ability to impact the world we live in.For almost 160 years, SUEZ has supported local communities and industrial companies in the management of essential services such as water, waste, and air quality. As such, SUEZ produces drinking water for 66 million people worldwide, recovers 2 million tons of secondary raw materials per year, and generates 3.1 TWh of renewable energy from waste. In our ongoing management of the ecological transition and climate change challenges, SUEZ will rely on the expertise and commitment of its 35,000 employees (particularly in France, Italy, Central Europe, Africa, Asia, and Australia) to offer high value-added and customized environmental solutions to all its customers. SUEZ’s expertise allows, for instance, its customers to avoid the emission of 4.2 million tons of CO2, thus improving their carbon footprint and their impact on climate. What will you do?In this role you will ensure the efficient operation and security of the company’s industrial information systems used on the treatment plants, including SCADA, PLC, and Plant Data historians. The position will focus on developing and embedding an Industrial Control Systems governance framework.In close coordination with our corporate IT team, as an ICS cyber-security operations counterpart, you will assist with the development of cyber-security best practices, and ongoing support.The position will also be responsible for preparing annual budget estimates and monitoring expenses against budgets on a monthly basis. You will liaise with client auditors and supervise all contractors working on Industrial IT systems of our treatment plants. The position will require you to develop and train plant staff as required. Your primary duties will includeIndustrial Control SystemsPlan the development, improvement, maintenance and operating priorities of ICS systems, in collaboration with each sites;Cultivate standards and provide technical assistance and information to users;Develop standards and documentation, ensuring all IT systems are running properly;Install software and hardware, provide a regular review of agreements in place with industrial IT suppliers and contractorsCybersecurityDevelop and lead the implementation of ICS Cybersecurity Governance frameworks.Operate, maintain, and identify enhancements to the adaptive ICS security environment and associated controls.Report on performance and audit security sites practices, and identify opportunities for improvement Client Relations Ensure good Client relationships are maintained when interacting with Client representatives and the Client’s Operations and Maintenance representatives. What you can bring to the teamFirstly you will share a strong passion for the environment and be excited by the opportunity to make an impact on the world we live in. You will have a solid background in automation and/or industrial processes and Corporate IT Management.You will have experience in SCADA and PLC systems.You will possess commitment to innovation and drive for excellence.Want to know more?You can learn more about what it's like to work at SUEZ by visiting our website and YouTube channel.If you are passionate about our values and excited by what you have read, then we want to hear from you. Apply now!

Name: Pre-Sales Engineer
Description: The Business    Our client is a well-established Technology Solutions Provider that have an enviable track record of support and delivery for over 30 years. With excellent vendor relationships across infrastructure and cloud technologies, they combine their strong technical skills and customer focussed solutions to provide a successful outcome to their clients.  Key Responsibilities    Working closely with the Business Development Managers, you will play a vital role in the sales team to scope, design and present technical solutions to new and existing corporate clients.    Duties and responsibilities will include.  Architecting and designing business technology solutions across corporate technologies including cybersecurity, wireless and related stacks Defining customer requirements to facilitate the design of appropriate solutions Building relationships with customers, defining their existing technology environments, and providing reviews and recommendations Work with BDM and delivery teams in the implementation of solutions Assist in the development and design of new tech offerings  About You    In order to be successful in this role, you will need:  A strong generalist technology focus with cybersecurity and design within your skill set, ideally having exposure to Palo Alto, HPE Aruba, Fortinet or Sentinel One amongst others The aptitude to develop the security and generalist technology solutions Work with the Sales and Marketing Director in assessing new vendor solutions Travel interstate to attend conferences and assist customers as required Proven technology professional with a strong bent for engineering and design Excellent presentation and communication skills Experience responding to tenders Ability to collaborate with internal technical teams Experience managing relationships  What’s on Offer    Being part of a well-established business, your contribution will be highly visible and measurable from day one. This company is looking for highly motivated, highly technical professionals to grow with them.      Curtis Partnership specialises in Sales, Marketing & Operations, Finance & Accounting, Technology and Property recruitment.

Name: Research Scientist & Engineer in AI & Cybersecurity - Multiple Opportunities
Description: Job description: Acknowledgement of Country  CSIRO acknowledges the Traditional Owners of the land, sea and waters, of the area that we live and work on across Australia. We acknowledge their continuing connection to their culture and pay our respects to their Elders past and present. View our vision towards reconciliation.     CSIRO's Data61 is hiring   In 2021 Data61 embarked upon an ambitious hiring campaign. At its core, we recognised a unique opportunity to grow our capacity for innovation by increasing our diversity and attracting world-class talent, great minds, skills, opinions and experiences. This has been hugely successful to date. In 2022, we are entering the 3rd stage of our campaign and seeking to attract more amazing, brilliant, and diverse professionals to our ranks.    We have a range of exciting opportunities available for Research Scientists and Engineers, People Leaders, and individuals who are passionate about science and engineering in the digital and data sciences. We also have a range of opportunities available to graduates; to be considered for our graduate program you will have completed at least an undergraduate degree with first-class Honours (H1 or HD) not less than three years ago.  How we can thrive together to solve Australia's data-driven challenges   Data61 are at the digital and data heart of Australia's national science agency - CSIRO    Working collaboratively with the largest group of digital technology researchers in Australia    A unique opportunity to seamlessly work across disciplinary boundaries and make an impact at a national scale!      In 2021 CSIRO's Data61 embarked upon an ambitious hiring campaign. At the heart of it, we recognized a unique opportunity to greatly increase our diversity, attracting talent from around the world, great minds, talents, skills, opinions, and experiences. This has been hugely successful. We are now entering the 3rd stage of our campaign and seeking to attract more amazing, brilliant, and diverse professionals to our ranks.   We have a range of exciting opportunities available for Research Scientists and Engineers, People Leaders, and individuals who are passionate about science and engineering in the digital and data sciences. We also have a range of opportunities available to undergraduates; to be considered for our undergraduate program you will have completed at least an undergraduate degree with first-class Honours (H1 or HD) not less than three years ago.    This is a fantastic opportunity if you want to actively take part in world-class research outcomes to deliver novel cyber security solutions that will educate and protect Australian communities.    Working within our cyber security domain teams offers countless opportunities to be at the forefront of Australia's research and see your contributions make a meaningful positive impact across our nation! The opportunities that we are offering We have a number of indefinite opportunities available for Research Scientists and Research Engineers within our Cyber Security portfolio at Data61. Locations available across Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Canberra or remote where requirements can be met. Apply now to register your interest to join Data61 as part of a multi-disciplinary research team that will lead world-class cyber security research.  Life at CSIRO's Data61 Data61 is at the forefront of digital science and innovation. Data61 is guiding first class novel research as well as working across disciplines and sectors to apply technologies and deliver impact.    Our cyber strategy is based around the themes of building trustworthy and resilient cyber systems, risk-based cyber approaches, shared awareness, as well as strengthening the human and social dimension of cyber security. We are seeking you to join us and be a crucial member of our cyber security division. We have a wide range of research opportunities that include:   Human centric security, AI collaboration to develop security solutions and invisible security.  Security automation to counteract advanced malicious cyber actors using Machine Learning.   Data privacy and confidentiality.      We are committed to continuously building a diverse, inclusive, and flexible working environment where all our people feel supported to do their best work and feel empowered to let their ideas flourish.  About You  We're interested in hearing from people who can demonstrate the following:  A PhD in a relevant discipline area, such as computer science, data sciences, cyber security, information technology, communications engineering, software engineering or applied mathematics.  A demonstrated high quality research publication history in peer reviewed conferences, journals and/or reports within the field of AI and cyber security, and/or data privacy.   Experience in applying research outcomes to solve industry problems, preferably in the area of human centric security, cyber security, data privacy or artificial intelligence/machine learning.  Proactive and adaptable mindset to handle or direct research initiatives (ranging from undefined to perfectly defined requirements), and an ability to navigate around that and work collaboratively with the client.   Strong oral and written communication skills to produce high calibre research papers, interact with external clients/stakeholder, and internal collaboration.       CSIRO is an Equal Opportunity employer working hard to recruit world-class talent that represents the diversity across our society.  Who is eligible to express their interest  To be considered for this role, you must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or either hold, or be able to obtain, a valid working visa (visa sponsorship may be provided to eligible candidates). The successful applicant will be required to obtain and provide a National Police Check or equivalent.  Where to from here!  If you are interested in opportunities within Data61's Cyber Security division, and meet the above candidate requirements, please apply to register your interest! If you prefer to have an informal chat before putting in your EOI (Expression of Interest), you can contact Careers.Online@csiro.au. Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander candidates, are also welcome to contact our Indigenous Talent lead at IndigenousCareers@csiro.au for more information.    Who will view my EOI: Data61 Research Directors, Group Leaders and Talent Acquisition are partnering together to review your expression of interests. We are excited to hear from you and will be in touch with you over the coming weeks where there is a potential match to an opportunity that may be your future role!    Reference: 74837

We also have a range of opportunities available to graduates; to be considered for our graduate program you will have completed at least an undergraduate degree with first-class Honours (H1 or HD) not less than three years ago.  How we can thrive together to solve Australia's data-driven challenges   Data61 are at the digital and data heart of Australia's national science agency - CSIRO    Working collaboratively with the largest group of digital technology researchers in Australia    A unique opportunity to seamlessly work across disciplinary boundaries and make an impact at a national scale!      In 2021 CSIRO's Data61 embarked upon an ambitious hiring campaign. At the heart of it, we recognized a unique opportunity to greatly increase our diversity, attracting talent from around the world, great minds, talents, skills, opinions, and experiences. This has been hugely successful. We are now entering the 3rd stage of our campaign and seeking to attract more amazing, brilliant, and diverse professionals to our ranks.   We have a range of exciting opportunities available for Research Scientists and Engineers, People Leaders, and individuals who are passionate about science and engineering in the digital and data sciences. We also have a range of opportunities available to undergraduates; to be considered for our undergraduate program you will have completed at least an undergraduate degree with first-class Honours (H1 or HD) not less than three years ago.    This is a fantastic opportunity if you want to actively take part in world-class research outcomes to deliver novel cyber security solutions that will educate and protect Australian communities.    Working within our cyber security domain teams offers countless opportunities to be at the forefront of Australia's research and see your contributions make a meaningful positive impact across our nation! The opportunities that we are offering We have a number of indefinite opportunities available for Research Scientists and Research Engineers within our Cyber Security portfolio at Data61. Locations available across Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Canberra or remote where requirements can be met. Apply now to register your interest to join Data61 as part of a multi-disciplinary research team that will lead world-class cyber security research.  Life at CSIRO's Data61 Data61 is at the forefront of digital science and innovation. Data61 is guiding first class novel research as well as working across disciplines and sectors to apply technologies and deliver impact.    Our cyber strategy is based around the themes of building trustworthy and resilient cyber systems, risk-based cyber approaches, shared awareness, as well as strengthening the human and social dimension of cyber security. We are seeking you to join us and be a crucial member of our cyber security division. We have a wide range of research opportunities that include:   Human centric security, AI collaboration to develop security solutions and invisible security.  Security automation to counteract advanced malicious cyber actors using Machine Learning.   Data privacy and confidentiality.      We are committed to continuously building a diverse, inclusive, and flexible working environment where all our people feel supported to do their best work and feel empowered to let their ideas flourish.  About You  We're interested in hearing from people who can demonstrate the following:  A PhD in a relevant discipline area, such as computer science, data sciences, cyber security, information technology, communications engineering, software engineering or applied mathematics.  A demonstrated high quality research publication history in peer reviewed conferences, journals and/or reports within the field of AI and cyber security, and/or data privacy.   Experience in applying research outcomes to solve industry problems, preferably in the area of human centric security, cyber security, data privacy or artificial intelligence/machine learning.  Proactive and adaptable mindset to handle or direct research initiatives (ranging from undefined to perfectly defined requirements), and an ability to navigate around that and work collaboratively with the client.   Strong oral and written communication skills to produce high calibre research papers, interact with external clients/stakeholder, and internal collaboration.       CSIRO is an Equal Opportunity employer working hard to recruit world-class talent that represents the diversity across our society.  Who is eligible to express their interest  To be considered for this role, you must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or either hold, or be able to obtain, a valid working visa (visa sponsorship may be provided to eligible candidates). The successful applicant will be required to obtain and provide a National Police Check or equivalent.  Where to from here!  If you are interested in opportunities within Data61's Cyber Security division, and meet the above candidate requirements, please apply to register your interest! If you prefer to have an informal chat before putting in your EOI (Expression of Interest), you can contact Careers.Online@csiro.au. Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander candidates, are also welcome to contact our Indigenous Talent lead at IndigenousCareers@csiro.au for more information.    Who will view my EOI: Data61 Research Directors, Group Leaders and Talent Acquisition are partnering together to review your expression of interests. We are excited to hear from you and will be in touch with you over the coming weeks where there is a potential match to an opportunity that may be your future role!    Reference: 74837

Name: Network Security Engineer

Name: Project Engineer - Systems & Network
Description: The Role: The Project Engineer (Systems & Network) will be based in Melbournes CBD on a permanent basis. In this role you will be a provided desktop, server, network and infrastructure resource to existing clients, able to work along.We are looking for someone to work alongside our team of dedicated professionals in our fast-paced environment, there are growth opportunities for the right candidates. Successful candidate will enjoy exposure to a wide variety of Technologies and issues and as a result will gain learning experience and ability to further enhance support skills and progress to a more senior responsibility level.Your Responsibilities:  Use and configure advanced features of Active Directory, Exchange and Supporting systems including RD Gateway, IIS Service Platforms and Database Systems. Administer, troubleshoot and maintain cloud-based systems such as Office 365. Migrate to, configure and support MS Office365 Apps/Teams /Azure AD/ AWS/ Google and other cloud services Execute, conduct and complete individual IT and cyber security audits. Application of ASD Essential Eight Maturity Model Provide IT general controls and application controls audit support to external audit. Assessing and evaluating system and process risks; Maintaining appropriate and adequate documentation for each audit to a standard required by auditing standards Configure and manage SonicWall appliances. Service awareness of all of the organisation’s key IT services for which support is being provided. Business awareness of the specific knowledge of the customer and how IT relates to their business strategy and goals. Configure support tools, techniques, and how technology is used to provide IT services.  Your Skills & Experience:  Knowledge of IT applications, processes, software, and equipment, including virtualisation, and storage. Knowledge of networking technologies including VLAN, LAG, VPN, network switching and traffic prioritisation technologies. Understanding and hands-on experience with cloud centric technologies, including SaaS, PaaS, IaaS, etc. Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills in ICT, including servers, desktops and networks. Understanding of VoIP technologies. Cybersecurity. Ability to undertake risk assessment of security posture, identification and remediation of security gaps. Ability to install, configure and troubleshoot software packages including Microsoft packages and client facing line of business packages. Extensive experience in systems support role in an SME environment. Experience in design, configuration and support of Office 365/Azure/AWS and other cloud services. Experience with operating environments including current edition of Windows Server, virtualisation technologies (Hyper-V) and server technologies such as Exchange and Active Directory. At least 5 years’ experience in systems support role.

Name: Senior Engineer – Identity Access Management
Description:
Macquarie is looking for an experienced Senior Engineer to join our Identity Access Management teams that our part of Global Identity and Cyber Security division.
Our team focuses on Identity Access Management (IAM), one of the key pillars of cybersecurity and an important service that delivers value to our entire organisation on a global scale.
Bring your top engineering experience and discipline to this role, and in return we will help you grow into a domain specialist, working on exciting technologies and challenging engineering problems.  Already working in cybersecurity or IAM?  Even better, you will fit right in!  Become part of our growing team of passionate and collaborative professionals who are ready to make a difference.
As a Senior Engineer, you will be responsible for managing and coaching a team of engineers, ensuring the team follows best engineering practices and deliver quality and scalable software.  You will be a hands-on leader, working in the trenches with your team, modelling and encouraging a collaborative working style.  You will have a keen eye for balancing design decisions over immediate customer needs as well as capitalising on future market opportunities.  The role will challenge you to work on various key development projects involving the following:  cloud migration, REST API, Integration, site reliability engineering and lastly, data analytics.
To be successful in this role, you will have the following skills:

experience in leading a team of engineers, working in an Agile and DevOps environment
strong experience working in cloud computing environments (AWS preferred)
expert knowledge and experience with API design and development (Java SpringBoot)
experience with system monitoring and logging tools (e.g. AppDynamics, Splunk, CloudWatch) desirable
experience with continuous integration and relevant tools, in particular using Atlassian products Bitbucket/Bamboo/Jira etc.
strong programming and problem-solving skills with at least one general purpose programming language, Java preferred
experience on coding with either RDMBS or NoSQL database/cache
strong sense of ownership, self-motivated and able to self-manage work
strong troubleshooting skills and creative problem-solving ability
experience in SailPoint, or similar Access Management tool desirable
experience in Ping Federate or similar product desirable.

To join this dynamic and highly innovative team, apply now or contact Nathan.king@macquarie.com [link removed] for more information.
Find out more about Macquarie careers at http://www.macquarie.com/careers [link removed]
About the Corporate Operations Group
The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Market Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Business Improvement & Strategy, and the Macquarie Group Foundation. The Corporate Operations Group’s purpose is to power the entrepreneurial enterprise. 
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion 
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.  
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

Name: IT Network Support Engineer - ANZ role - Sydney based
Description: Secure Agility represents and partners with some of the leading organizations across the globe, as an extension of their business.     Who is our client?They are a global trusted cybersecurity specialist for digital infrastructure helping to drive the transition to a trusted digital future for all people and organisations. Why them?Their unique approach to distribution gives partners more opportunity and more customer relevance, equipping them to capitalise on rapidly evolving technologies and transformative business models. Their story is a global one with a services-first ideology at its core, harnessing innovation and disruption to deliver partner value.With offices in 43 countries and the ability to service customers in over 170 countries across five continents, they are a worldwide distribution powerhouse.What is the role?This role is ideal for someone with a basic Networking/IT understanding such as Firewalls and TCP/IP who are willing to be trained and certified across a variety of Vendor products to provide reseller and internal sales support.     The responsibilities of this role include:  Provide Pre-Sales Support to the Reseller base and their End Users across the product portfolio Provide some Post-Sales Support to Vendors' partners as required Work closely with internal and Vendor Account Managers in the planning of meetings and activities Perform Evaluations and Proof of Concepts (PoCs) as required Keep up-to-date with Vendor roadmap, technology and product portfolio Assist in the Sales process by providing Pre-Sales Support, tender responses etc On-going product training and certifications will be available to enable with a growth path within the organisation Hybrid work environment with the ability to work from home or office depending on each specific role and tasks  What do you need to be considered?  Have proven skills and experience with Firewall and/or other security technologies in Support, Installation and Configuration environments Have a basic understanding to the TCP/IP suite. Previous experience and certification with Fortinet technologies or any other firewalls or network devices would be very advantageous Able to follow processes and procedures Ability to dedicate your time to vendor training and development. Good understanding of the sales process Ability to work in a team and autonomously Take ownership, be responsible, reliable and use common sense Essential criteria;   Permanent residency & work rights. Australian drivers’ licence. Available to travel (domestic & international)    If this sounds like you, or something you may be interested in, please apply now.

Name: Cybersecurity Assessor
Description:
The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini, a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services, is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organisations to realise their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company with over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2020 combined revenues of EUR 15.8 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com [link removed].
 
Let's talk about the team:
Our Cloud Infrastructure Services (CIS) practice brings together the right technology, processes and culture to deliver business agility and cost reduction to our clients. We provide cloud focused client advisory and delivery services on areas such as hybrid cloud, workplace services, security, service desk and cloud service management/delivery. 
Let's talk about the role and responsibilities: 


Working with business and technical areas to support the development of security documentation in preparation for external IRAP assessment


Working closely with Customer's team to develop Governance, Risk Management and Compliance (GRC) deliverables (Security Strategy / Frameworks / Policies / Assessments / Solutions etc.) and lead their implementation either at customer location or remotely dependent upon the customers' requirements and preferred working practices


Developing and implementing Enterprise Security Strategy, Governance Frameworks, Standards, Policies (e.g., Conversant in IRAP, ISO27001, COBIT, PCI-DSS, etc.)


Professional experience in developing a variety of technical documentation


Maintaining quality and customer satisfaction


Let's talk about your qualifications and experience:  


Prior experience with ISM controls up to PROTECTED level


Security policy and procedure writing experience as they relate to core security artefacts defined in the ISM and PSPF


Knowledge of, or performance of IRAP and system certification and accreditation


Must have security clearance - baseline minimum


Must have experience in Security Risk and Compliance Audit and its implementation


Knowledge of risk management methodologies


Good governance exposure on ISO 27001, PCI DSS, SOX, GDPR standard and other regulatory requirements 


Knowledge in Unix, Windows, Active Directory


Knowledge of networking principles including TCP/IP


Good understanding or background in information security tools such as SIEM, endpoint software, IPS, IDS products, GRC products  


Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Services, or similar


Good to have trainings / certifications (IRAP, ISO 27001:2013 LA/LI, CISA, CISM, CISSP)


 
Let's talk about what's in it for you!
Passionate people are Capgemini's Ace of Spades - join us to discover a career that will challenge, support and inspire you. Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. You will work alongside some very smart and inspiring people on exciting projects and you will also enjoy incredible benefits.  We offer flexible work practices and 40 hours of self-development every year with a huge selection of learning opportunities to choose from. 
As "Architects of Positive Futures", Capgemini actively supports the community in 3 ways:
Diversity and Inclusion - we believe diversity of thought fuels excellence and innovation, which is why we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age.  To support our commitment to diversity and inclusion, we celebrate or recognise special events and days of significance that are important to our employees such as Diwali, Bastille Day, Pride, IDAHOBIT, IWD and International day of people with Disabilities.  Our Employee Resource Groups Women@Capgemini, OutFront, Indigeneous, Parents and Careers and Sustainability Community of Practice support the grassroots passion of employees to drive our diversity agenda and effect change.  
Digital inclusion - at Capgemini we are using our skills to drive social impact initiatives focusing on helping society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution.  We also provide employees with opportunities to give back to the community through charity projects and volunteer days.
Environmental Sustainability - Capgemini joined the CDP's (Carbon Disclosure Project) prestigious "A list" for its commitment to the Net-Zero economy. As well as focusing on helping our clients transform towards more sustainable business models, Capgemini recently announced its commitment to becoming a netzero busines by 2030. 
Recognised by Ethisphere as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the last 9 years in a row, ethics and values are at the heart of Capgemini's corporate culture and business.  Embedded in our DNA, our seven values - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty - have remained the same since company inception in 1967. To see how we bring these values to life, visit www.capgemini.com/au-en/careers/ [link removed] and listen to some of our employee's stories.
Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures. 

Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.

Name: Senior Systems/Cloud Engineer - Azure
Description: The Role:  Our client is a large Education organisation on the lookout for a Senior Systems/Cloud Engineer working with Azure. $130k - $145k + Super  NFP Salary Packaging of up to $15,900 a year Sydney Based - Hybrid Working  You will be responsible for maintaining both on-premise computer server hardware/software and cloud-based workloads and providing operational management. Professionally and efficiently respond to ICT incidents and service requests via the ICT service management tool. Develop and maintain the ICT on-premises and cloud services operational support policies, processes and procedures. Project managing ICT systems, infrastructures and business solutions, ensuring they are supported and delivered within the agreed time, scope and budget. Actively pursue possibilities to enhance cybersecurity processes and procedures and develop business cases to present new solutions to management. Regularly audit, review and update all systems design and operation documentation. Proven extensive hands-on experience in development and the operational management of the following programming languages: Powershell (Essential) Python (Desirable) JSON (Desirable) Proven extensive experience in performing server administration and operations. Practical knowledge and experience in automating solutions and migrations using code scripting. Windows Server 2012/2016

Our approach to client engagement is what makes us stand out from the crowd - working closely with our clients to truly understand their business requirements, resulting in better delivery of outcomes and greater satisfaction to all. www.architech.net.au Why work at ArchiTech?We believe that when staff enjoy what they do, it drives them to work at their best. To us our people are not just workers, they are part of the fabric that makes ArchiTech a great place to work.An attractive remuneration package with flexible working optionsOpportunity to get involved in a variety of interesting, challenging and rewarding ICT projectsCareer development through training, mentoring, new product learnings and cross industry exposure Diverse and inclusive workplace with a supportive culture, where you can have fun and be yourself!How to applyTo start an application, click on ‘apply’ and submit the following:an up-to-date resume detailing your relevant experience for the rolea cover letter (max 1 page) specifically addressing the above criteria and your suitability to the role advertisedArchiTech reserve the right to close off this position early as applications will be considered upon receipt.  Please note:Only shortlisted candidates will be contactedYou must have the right to work permanently in AustraliaAn offer of employment will be subject to a satisfactory National Police Clearance and Working with Children Check being provided to ArchiTechIn line with Government directions that apply to our client base, ArchiTech will require a copy of your Covid-19 Vaccination CertificateYou must have a valid Australian driver’s license and use of a personal vehicle to perform this roleFor any enquiries, please contact careers@architech.net.au
