Name: Software Engineer - Cyber
Description:
Bring your top engineering experience and discipline to the role and we will help you grow into becoming a domain specialist, working on exciting technologies and challenging engineering problems. 
Already working in cybersecurity? Even better, you will fit right in! Become part of our growing team of passionate and collaborative professionals ready to make a difference.
As a Software Engineer, you will be part of a small team of developers that are designing, developing, and running cybersecurity systems. This will involve designing and developing REST API, integration with the frontend and data analytics. Your role will focus on developing applications in our new micro-services Platform, which collects risk data, provides analysis and reporting, and enables remediation. This is a significant initiative, providing you with the opportunity to make a huge impact.
To be successful in this role, you will have the following skills and capabilities:

strong programming and problem-solving skills with a full-stack web development. Experience with Golang, Python for the backend and ReactJS for the front end is preferred.
experience in coding with either SQL or NoSQL database/cache.
experience in Agile development processes and a DevOps culture.
experience working in cloud computing environments (AWS preferred).
knowledge and experience with API design and development.
experience with continuous integration and relevant tools, using the Atlassian product suite which include Bitbucket, Bamboo, Jira etc.
experience with system monitoring and logging tools (e.g. AppDynamics, Splunk, CloudWatch) desirable.
a strong sense of ownership, self-motivation, and the ability to self-manage.
strong troubleshooting skills and a creative problem-solving ability.
a strong learning mindset.

To join our passionate Cybersecurity team, apply online via the link.Learn more by visiting www.macquarie.com/careers [link removed]
About the Corporate Operations Group
The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Business Improvement & Strategy, and the Macquarie Group Foundation. We deliver service excellence to ensure Macquarie is open for business, deliver on transformational change, invest in our people and have deep relationships with our customers.
Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion 
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

Name: Network Engineer
Description: Do you have a passion for all things techy? Well this is IT!The Secure Parking team are looking for a Network Engineer to provide operational support and manage the company's network infrastructure. You'll need to have the ability to follow set plans and work to deadlines, with experience in designing, implementing, and configuring Cisco and Fortinet firewall technologies as well as other general network technologies. You'll also need to be a motivated individual with strong problem solving skills in a complex IT environment.SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONSDaily operational support for network infrastructure including configurations, migrations, troubleshooting, and day-to-day management of the network.Development, designing, implementing, and documenting organisation network strategies.Managing various WAN/LAN, vLAN, SD-WAN, IPsec, B2B VPN, MPLS, firewalls, switches internally and with a various MSP.Managing complex routing and switching L1, L2/L3 at our datacenters and satellite locations spanning over 300 nodes.Management and implement network security policies, and drive cybersecurity initiatives.Liaise with external suppliers and MSP when required to ensure resolution of issues.Develop and maintain professional relationships with internal teams, clients, and third-party vendors.Be the point of escalation of the network infrastructure and actively identifying opportunities for improvement to the IT Operations Manager.Participate and contribute to various project work in the organisation and represent IT Operations in a network capacity.Co-ordinate within IT Operations team and business stakeholders to implement network solutions and architecture in the project setting.Ensure that all Incident Requests are resolved within specified SLAsEnsure proper escalation procedures are followed and where required liaise with other support areas and 3rd parties to ensure problems are resolved within SLAEnsure any enhancement and project work is delivered to the agreed scope and on time and within budget (SLA)Ensure that IT Operations standards are followed and developed as requiredEnsure all relevant support documentation is accurate and regularly maintainedProactive monitoring and management of all environments to identify trends and potential problem areasImplement and maintain effective BCP solutions where requiredPerforming all other related and compatible duties as assignedEnsuring compliance and achieving appropriate standards in regulatory, internal and external auditsEnsure compliance with relevant statutory and regulatory requirements regarding employees, including relevant OH&S Legislation.Demonstrate the Secure Parking valuesEnsure compliance group Code of Conduct, all internal policies and procedures and relevant statutory and regulatory requirementsSELECTION CRITERIATertiary Education with relevant certifications in CCNA or CCNP.5+ years in Network Engineering or similar role.Hands-on experience with designing, implementing, and configuring Cisco and Fortinet firewall technologies as well as other general network technologies.Experience with working in support and project capacity. Some travelling may be required.Experience in complex routing and switching.Proven history of working in a position of trust and ability to work unsupervised.Strong written and verbal skills.Experience in "Cloud" infrastructure and SaaS (MS Azure or AWS) is desiredStrong general judgement and action orientation coupled with strong problem solving skills in a complex IT environmentDemonstrated planning skills and the ability to follow set plans, and work to deadlinesAbility to work under pressure in fast paced, dynamic work environmentAbility to work largely unsupervisedThe company promotes diversity in the workplace through our Diversity and Inclusion Program. Indigenous Australians and Torres Strait Islanders are encourage to apply for this role.

Name: Senior ICT Engineer – Smart Buildings
Description: Communities are fundamental. Whether around the corner or across the globe, they provide a foundation, a sense of place and of belonging. That's why at Stantec, we always design with community in mind.We care about the communities we serve—because they're our communities too. We're designers, engineers, scientists, and project managers, innovating together at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. Balancing these priorities results in projects that advance the quality of life in communities across the globe.Stantec are proud to be recognised as an employer of choice by WORK180Significant forward workload on challenging and exciting projectsOpportunities that come with working for a Global Consulting firmAbout the role:Our Smart Buildings section is seeking a Senior Information and Communications Technologies (ICT) Engineer to contribute to the growth and success of the Smart Buildings team. Modern and advanced, Smart building technologies are creating a safer, more sustainable, cost efficient and resilient built environment and driving enhanced user experience.Smart Buildings put people and experiences first; transforming property into a flexible live-work-play space, adaptable to the needs of its users through data-driven insights. Defined as the interface between the infrastructure, building systems and technologies deployed, a well-executed smart buildings strategy tailors the outcomes to the people, spaces and activities within a building. Our approach focuses on delivering value-based, advanced technology design. We take a pragmatic approach to ensure buildability and performance, including measuring your sustainability and wellness goals. Smart technologies in buildings can serve as the frontline of defence in cybersecurity, protecting your assets. We see Smart Buildings as the catalyst to visualise, analyse and progressively enhance the effectiveness of your business investment.Building automation, access control, video surveillance, audiovisual and many other systems must be interconnected over a robust and reliable infrastructure to enable communication and interoperability between systems. Join us in designing innovative solutions that will shape the way buildings are maintained and operated.In this role, you will be part of a dynamic multi-disciplinary team responsible for the advisory and design of advanced technologies in modern, smart and iconic projects throughout Australia. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring coordination with other disciplines and meeting client needs.Day to day tasks would involve:Provide design support in ICT for our various offices and projects across Australia for the design of local area networks (LAN), including racks, network devices, containment, cabling and physical spaces.Contribute to the design of various ICT systems, including access control, security, video surveillance, wireless coverage, audio-visual, building automation, guard calls and public calls systems.Prepare technical documents for planning, preparation of specifications and drawings, calling of tenders and providing construction service support including testing and commissioning.Maintain strong customer relationships for the execution of projects and participate in business development.Support other Project Engineer’s in completing projects in terms of program, profitability, technical risk management and overall Client satisfaction.Provide support and mentoring to Junior staff membersSupport clients and internal customers on technical queriesTo be successful for this role you'll need:Bachelor's degree in Engineering or equivalent training in networking and computer science.RCDD, CCNA or CISSP certifications are considered an asset. Experience in the design of physical infrastructure and network cabling (telecommunications rooms, server rooms, cable tray, interconnection, etc.)Experience in designing or implementing service of one of the following systems: DAS, wireless coverage, real-time location, VoIP, public call, intercom and building automation.General understanding of network protocols and concepts (IP addressing, subnet masks, VLAN, link aggregation, DHCP protocol, etc.).Strong knowledge of industry codes and standards (AS/NZ, IEC, ANSI / TIA, BICSI, IEEE, CSA, OBC, NBC).Excellent written and verbal communication skillsAble to innovate based on customer and industry requirements Positive, can-do attitudeAbility to prioritise workloads to meet deadlinesWhat we offerAlong with a competitive salary we offer many other benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing is ongoing.Genuine Flexible Working Arrangements - Including work from home opportunities, provision for school term contracts, job sharing and part time employment.Option to purchase up to 4 weeks additional leave.Learning and Talent Development Programs - Including Global programmes, online learning and on-the-job learningMentoring for your own development and the opportunity to mentor othersA friendly team environment, with dedicated and enthusiastic staff committed to producing high quality service and deliverablesProfessional MembershipsSalary Continuance Insurance (SCI) Mental Health and Wellbeing Programs Service Recognition AwardsEmployee Assistance ProgramAbout StantecThe Stantec community unites approximately 25,000 employees working in over 400 locations across six continents. We collaborate across disciplines and industries to bring buildings, energy, resources, water, environmental, transport and infrastructure projects to life.Our work from initial project concept and planning through design, construction, and commissioning begins at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships.How to applyIf this position is of interest, please apply via the link below. Please note that no agency applications will be accepted at this time.

Name: Software Engineer
Description:
Software EngineerCloud Services CompanyFlexible Working environmentMelbourne Location - Remote Working Opportunity
SXiQ is a fast paced, high energy, Cloud Services business that works across a range of industries with leading Australian organisations. Operating across a variety of technical environments, we partner with both AWS and Microsoft to provide both cloud-in-a-box and hybrid cloud solutions through intelligent cloud orchestration and interconnectivity.
We specialise and support our clients across three pillars:Multi-Cloud ServicesDigital transformationCybersecurity
Our Mission is to help our customers unleash the immense technical and business benefits of the cloud, so they can drive faster innovation, smarter insights and disrupt their industries in ways they never imagined possible.
Our mission is ultimately about helping our customers enhance their own competitive advantages and take their digital transformation further and deeper.
Our business is growing rapidly, which has created an opportunity for experienced Software Engineer to join our team in Melbourne on a permanent full-time role. The successful candidate will be responsible for presales support to our Sales team for engaging customers around the development of solutions to address business problems
Key responsibilities:Effectively gather customer requirements in a professional and consultative manner for the purpose of proposing solutions Develop high quality customer proposals for the SXiQ sales team Follow internal governance processes to ensure proposals are aligned to the customers’ requirements, capable of being efficiently delivered and are accurately costed Ensure solutions are aligned to SXiQ vendor partners and architectural patterns Prepare and present solutions to key decision makers Work with other presales staff across different technology domains to develop broader customer solutions Ability to compare different solution options for customers, against their business requirements, and provide recommendations Perform Design and Implementation activities for our CMO on specific projects as required for ongoing technical training and continuity of customer relationship management Proactively contribute to the development and maturing of SXiQ service and product offerings Engage with key SXiQ vendors as part of ongoing relationship building, training certification and specific presales activities? Complete, in a timely manner, all assigned certifications necessary for SxiQ to retain relevant partner statuses with strategic vendors Completion of reports for customers in a high quality and timely manner Proactively update internal systems to effectively track and inform status of assigned tasks 
Required Skills:
Tertiary qualifications in IT or equivalent industry experience Demonstrable background working of at least 2 years in a presales and technical architecture environment Previous experience in a team lead or leadership capacity Broad exposure to multiple vendor technologies around storage/compute virtualisation hosting platforms Strong (5+ years) knowledge of common virtualised hosting solutions for on premise and cloud ? Strong analytical and Design skills Excellent written and customer presentation skills 
Desirable:
Proven cert in areas of key technical capability is highly desirable.? (Cisco, HP, Lenovo, VMware, Microsoft) Good knowledge of any of the following: 
	
Pre-sales and Design experience in Backup solutions, such as Commvault and Veeam ?Experience with pre-sales and design of converged infrastructure virtualisation solution 

 
Benefits of working at SXiQWe live our core values: Insightful, Inquisitive and IntuitiveOpportunity for career growthFlexible working arrangementsWork with industry experienced professionalsPerformance BonusProfessional DevelopmentCompany social eventsFocus on employee health and wellbeing
Interested?
Please apply using the link below or email sxiqrecruitment@sxiq.com.au

Name: Software Engineer
Description: Job description: Acknowledgement of Country CSIRO acknowledges the Traditional Owners of the land, sea and waters, of the area that we live and work on across Australia. We acknowledge their continuing connection to their culture and pay our respects to their Elders past and present. View our vision towards reconciliation The Opportunity CSIRO's Data61 is the digital technologies and data science arm of Australia's national science agency. With around 400 staff and another 300 affiliate staff, Data61 represents one of the largest collections of R&D expertise in artificial intelligence, data science, cybersecurity, robotics, and software engineering in the world. With a focus on impact-driven science and technology, Data61 works across disciplines and industry sectors to solve some of the world's greatest challenges through digital R&D. Your role as Software Engineer in CSIRO is to collaborate in scientific and innovation activities with other research staff and students usually by assisting with detailed planning, undertaking, or assisting experience design, software development, and system evaluation. This position also includes the opportunity and encouragement to publish research results in international conferences and journals. Your duties will include: CSOF4  Under general direction, contribute to research and/or technology through the development of original and adapted experimental methods, equipment or software. Undertake a wide variety of tasks or tasks with a high degree of specialisation. Show initiative to seek new approaches to meet experimental or technological needs when encountering new problems where methods are not defined. Participate in the identification and definition of research and/or technological problems with colleagues. Participate in planning projects and accept responsibility for scheduling and completion of major parts of the project, including evaluation of options, experimental design, data collection and analysis, user and customer research, user experience and/or software design, implementation and delivery, Make significant contributions to the interpretation and communication of research or technological results and may collaborate on drafting presentations to, and/or detailed written reports for, clients and the scientific and/or technology community.     CSOF5  Design, develop and adapt experimental methods and systems, software and/or user experience, requiring high levels of initiative, ingenuity and skills (some of which are outside a single discipline).  Develop novel techniques to produce enhanced results, providing researchers with new or improved approaches to research or technological problems.  Lead teams and/or collaborate with staff from other teams in meeting their objectives as required. May initiate and maintain collaborative relationships with external researchers and experts, manage contracts and transfer technology to industry. Participate in work which is highly involved because of the unique or unusual features and complications, requiring the creation of original user experiences, the design & development of original technologies, and/or the development of original experimental or observational techniques and insightful interpretation of data.  Participate in project scoping and planning, making significant contributions to the research or technological direction, and may advise on the level and type of services that are provided. Have a significant role in communicating research or technological results in internal and external forums and, where applicable, contribute to and/or generate scientific papers.     Location: Canberra, ACT Salary: AU$87,068 - AU$106,947 plus up to 15.4% superannuation Tenure: Indefinite Reference: 85435 To be considered you will need: Essential:  Demonstrated experience with real-time 3D graphics and/or computer vision. Familiarity with Augmented Reality, Virtual Reality, and/or Web3D. Demonstrated experience building interactive software with one or more programming languages such as Javascript, C++, C#, Python, Matlab. The ability to work effectively as part of a multi-disciplinary, regionally dispersed research team, and carry out tasks autonomously. Familiarity with modern Computer Graphics Engines such as Unity or Unreal and/or familiarity with Graphics Libraries such as OpenGL, Vulkan, or DirectX.    Desirable Criteria:  Experience with Web and/or distributed systems as well as an appreciation of open web standards such as HTML 5, WebGL, WebRTC, X3D, WebVR, etc. Familiarity with:  Modern front-end web frameworks such as Angular, React, Ember, etc.  Server-side web frameworks such as Node.js/Express, Ruby on Rails, Django, etc. Human-Computer Interaction and/or Interaction Design concepts and methods Concepts of human visual perception and optics 3D Modelling Packages 3D Scanning and 3D Reconstruction technologies Multimodal User interaction (Auditory, Haptics, etc.)   Experience implementing mobile applications, implementing simulations on GPUs, and statistical methods Aptitude for 3D mathematical concepts, particularly linear algebra Establishing and growing relevant professional network    For full details about this role please view the Position Description Eligibility Applications for this position are open to Australian Citizens, New Zealand Citizens and Australian Permanent Residents only. Appointment to this role is subject to provision of a national police check and may be subject to other security/medical/character requirements. Flexible Working Arrangements We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work.  Diversity and Inclusion We are working hard to recruit people representing the diversity across our society, and ensure that all our people feel supported to do their best work and feel empowered to let their ideas flourish.  About CSIRO At CSIRO Australia's national science agency, we solve the greatest challenges through innovative science and technology. We put the safety and wellbeing of our people above all else and earn trust everywhere because we only deal in facts. We collaborate widely and generously and deliver solutions with real impact.  Join us and start creating tomorrow today! How to Apply Please apply on-line and provide a cover letter and CV that best demonstrate your motivation and ability to meet the requirements of this role. Applications Close 17th July 2022, 11:00pm AEST

Name: Graduate engineer – Electronic or Mechatronics
Description: Great opportunity for a motivated, well-organised individual to further their career at a well-established BMS and controls company. We design, program, and commission building automation systems for the HVAC industry and we are looking for a motivated young engineer to join the team in an engineering capacity.Our affiliation with Honeywell, Siemens and Schneider Controls provides us with a range of highly flexible and powerful solutions to cater for a wide variety of applications.Strong knowledge of IT fundamentals and frameworks, including; networks and configuration, wireless networks, cybersecurity (advantageous), Microsoft Windows 10 and Server knowledge. To be successful you will need:·         Programming in Python, C, C++ or Visual Basics (advantageous)·         To show enthusiasm, be self-motivated and willing to learn each day·         To maintain a pleasant and professional manner at all times·         Complex problem-solving·         Learning new skills·         To possess excellent attention to detail·         The ability to communicate with clients and staff in a professional manner·         Neat and tidy personal presentation·         Reliability with a good work ethics·         To be self-motivatedPreferred bachelor's degree in Electronic or Mechatronics Engineering (equivalent industry experience will be considered).The Company will provide Industry (HVAC control and DDC programming, covering BACnet and MODbus protocols) training and Product trainingThe company, based in Port Melbourne, has been servicing the industry for many years.  The offer includes a competitive salary and a car allowance (you will need your own vehicle).This is an exciting opportunity for someone who wants to be part of a dynamic industry.

Name: Site Reliability Engineer, Doshii, x15ventures
Description: About Doshii Doshii is an API Platform which integrates point of sale (POS) systems with ordering, payment, loyalty and reservation Apps. The Platform allows real-time data exchange between Apps and POS.   Doshii has been in development for 5+ years and has agreements and partnerships with major POS and App companies in Australia and across South East Asia and boasts a highly skilled and dedicated team primarily based out of our Melbourne office  About the Role We are looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join our technical team, reporting directly to the Head of Infrastructure.  The role will help maintain and enhance the infrastructure utilised by the Doshii platform and other associated products to enable Apps and POS to integrate seamlessly with each other.   Key Responsibilities Building and setting up new development tools and infrastructure Working on ways to automate and improve development and release processes Establishing automated tests for performance and security and analysing the results to Improve the stability of the Doshii platform Ensuring that systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats Identifying technical problems and implementing updates and 'fixes' in a timely manner Working with the software development team to ensure that development follows established processes and works as intended Utilise infrastructure-as-code principles to create and maintain robust and scalable environments for Doshii products to run Automate tasks through appropriate tools and scripting Ensure infrastructure is up-to-date with the latest patches and compliance. Maintain the service registry for all tools and services used throughout the release lifecycle Be a passionate advocate for SRE principles and practices at a Chapter level by talking at internal meetups, sharing learnings at brownbags, or publishing technical blog posts. Work on a Business Hours roster for incident monitoring and response. About You 3+ years of hands-on experience in scripting / programming using Java or Python Experience in modern Devops concepts - Infrastructure as code using Terraform Knowledge of automation tools - Jenkins CICD, Puppet, Ansible, Chef Knowledge of containerization tools - Docker, EKS, ECS Experience with monitoring tools and services, such as ELK stack Familiarity with the Atlassian dev tools suite (Confluence, JIRA, Bamboo, Bitbucket Desired Skills: Database technologies like PostgreSQL, Oracle, and DynamoDB Knowledge of API and Microservices Experience with Github AWS certification Personality attributes: Ability to work collaboratively in a fast pace, aggressive product delivery environment. Strong aptitude for self-learning, and a willingness to advance career to senior position Analytical mind with problem-solving aptitude Ability to work independently and autonomously What's in it for you? You will be working for a fast growing startup, changing the way the hospitality & retail industries connect the Point of Sale (POS) at their physical venues to the Apps around them. At scale, Doshii will become a marketplace in which venues can access to connect 3rd party technology and ensure streamlined data exchange via the Doshii Platform. This allows POS companies to focus on what they do best and for app companies to develop their product and scale by simplifying their integrations.   You'll be involved in rapidly connecting customers to a new and exciting product which is used by some of the most innovative companies in order ahead, payments, reservations, loyalty and data aggregation. As well as working out of a premium startup workspace in the CBD, we also offer flexible work-from-home and remote possibilities. Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace. One where we're driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.Here, you'll thrive. You'll be supported when faced with challenges, and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We really love working here, and we think you will too.We're determined to make a real difference for Australia's first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply. If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick [link removed] to submit a valid application. We're keen to support you with the next step in your career.

Name: ICT Electrical Engineer
Description:
Downer Rail and Transit Systems (RTS) is committed to providing the highest quality of Rollingstock & Overhaul services for both the local Queensland and wider Australian markets. We are currently seeking an ICT and Integrations Engineer to provide support to our Maryborough Service Delivery Centre (SDC) in Queensland.
About the role
The ICT and Integrations Engineer is responsible for the development of engineering specifications, engineering reports, design and testing of ICT system hardware, software components. The role is responsible for the requirements definition and development of reference designs for new ICT systems to be incorporated into a design baseline. The role also requires development of integration plans for rolling stock and assurance of new systems and operating methodologies.
The ICT and Integrations Engineer will support multiple activities across the delivery lifecycle and perform design and engineering tasks on rolling stock systems. This includes producing safe, compliant, reliable and cost-effective designs; supporting production, maintenance and test & commissioning with timely engineering advice and concessions; identification of the root cause of problems across the fleet; managing technical risks and opportunities with internal and external stakeholders.
Typical examples could be:



Communication Systems
Passenger Information System
Surveillance Systems
Set-to-shore communication Systems
Digital Train Radio Systems
Automatic Train Protection Systems
Train Management Systems
Plant Logic Control Systems
Battery Management Systems
Cybersecurity Systems
Networking System.



This is a newly created role due to an increase of engineering demand in ICT delivery scope for QLD Fleets and projects. This is a permanent full time position which will be based in the Maryborough SDC, however you may be required to travel to Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne from time to time.
Experience, highly desired

Rolling stock or Intelligent Transportation Systems
Software development as practiced in railway, military or heavy industrial environments
CCTV systems, Passenger Information Systems and or Shore Based systems
Real-time control systems, voice and digital communications, plant control logic and/or software development as practiced in transportation, military or heavy industrial environments.

Specific skills and knowledge

Ability to work with a team of engineers effectively and manage delivery timelines of projects with documentation through the systems engineering lifecycle
Strong ability to interpret technical requirements
Highly developed oral and written communication skills, including the ability to conduct detailed investigations and provide clear and decisive results and written reports to senior management
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to provide rapid and effective engineering support
Excellent computer skills with experience in the development and management of ICT systems
Knowledge of various software coding platforms and networking architecture
Ability to read and understand electronic/electrical schematics and logic.  

Education and Qualifications

Electrical, Electronic, Mechatronic, Systems Engineering degree
Achieved CPEng status or working towards it.

Culture
Downer Group believes that our employees are fundamental to the culture and success of the company. Our people enjoy working for us because we offer a challenging, diverse but rewarding work environment. Downer takes pride in being an employer of choice taking responsibility and accountability for the care and protection of peers, the business, the communities and the environment in which we operate.
What we offer

The opportunity to work within an energetic, highly skilled team
The ability to work on key rollingstock projects with an industry leader
Competitive remuneration, with on-going training and support 
Employee benefits and wellness program
An opportunity to make an impact with a growing and forward-thinking company
A strong commitment to Zero Harm environment for all our employees and visitors
An opportunity to work with an ASX Listed Company.

How to apply
To apply for this opportunity please click the APPLY NOW button.
For more information about this position please contact Kodi Gordon – Talent & Sourcing Business Partner email kodi.gordon@downergroup.com [link removed].
Please note
Applications will not be accepted via email, please apply via the link.
Employment with Downer is subject to a Pre-Employment Medical, and on-going drug and alcohol screening.
Downer Group is an equal opportunity employer with a strong commitment to diversity.
Downer does not accept any unsolicited resume referrals from Recruitment Agencies.

Name: Senior Cyber Security Engineer
Description: OSI Systems and its subsidiaries is a vertically integrated provider of specialized electronic systems and for components that meet the critical needs in the homeland security, healthcare, defense, and aerospace industries. As a global company, we are dedicated to developing solutions for our customers and the people they serve to lead the way to a safer and healthier world.The Senior Cyber Security Engineer is responsible for leading the operations of the cyber security testing lab. S/he collaborates closely with R&D and QA/RA. In addition to local security responsibilities, this position is part of a larger corporate cyber security team for OSI Systems.Responsibilities:Own the effort to assess and define the cyber security design requirements for border protection and transportation security products. Perform this work from within a standardized security framework.Analyze, report on and assist in management of security-related risks, including reporting on outcomes and proposing further security improvements.Help with the constant process of educating product design staff and organization stakeholders on cyber security and how it affects the product design and support effortsOwn the process of defining innovative solutions to secure and support networked products that are used in highly diverse settings over long install periods.Participate in and assist with development or product test protocols. These protocols should allow for efficient assessment of product vulnerabilities, and include work with engineering and provide recommendations of remediation alternatives.Work with product engineering teams to help them understand cyber security test results and identify remediation techniques that could be employed to address the findingsLead efforts to assess the vulnerability of products to new and emergent threats. Efforts must identify root cause and identify remediation strategies as needed. Work to develop communications from those assessments that will inform internal engineering, service and external customers.Proactively support use of standardized processes. Prepare and document standard operating procedures and protocols to help ensure the security of our products as they are designed, developed, supported, and used.Uphold the company’s core values of Integrity, Innovation, Accountability, and TeamworkDemonstrate behavior consistent with the company’s Code of Ethics and ConductIt is the responsibility of every employee to report to their manager or a member of senior management any quality problems or defects in order for corrective action to be implemented and to avoid recurrence of the problemDuties may be modified or assigned at any time to meet the needs of the business.Provide assistance to sales and business development.Provide assistance in relevant standards development. Provide assistance with regulatory and compliance activities.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Security, Engineering, or related fieldCybersecurity certifications such as Security+, CISSP, CCNA Security, or GIAC (GICSP) are desirable.Experience:5-10 years of work experience in information technology with a focus in security.Experience in supporting product design efforts and leading cyber security design efforts that are based on holistic industry security standardsFamiliarity with security standards and frameworks including NIST 800-53, NIST CSF, NIST 800-171, and/or ISO 27001, and/or US government ATO processes.Demonstrated experience leading efforts to define and capture the architectural and technical product design specifications at the network, as well as application, and database/data store level of the product and the business eco system it operates within.Experience performing vulnerability testing of systems and softwareExperience performing Threat, Exploit, and Vulnerability analysis of products and systemsExperience working in a highly regulated environment is desirable. Experience working with transportation security and/or international governments is a plus.Knowledge and experience with industrial systems and Internet of Things (IoT) is desirableDetailed technical knowledge of operating system and network security in physical, virtual and cloud-based (AWS) implementations is required.Experience with embedded Windows/Linux, mobile, and RTOS operating systemsHands-on experience in security systems, including endpoint security, vulnerability management, network security technologies such as firewalls and IPS/IPS, wireless network security, authentication systems, log management, and encryptionExperience with application and database security design is requiredExperience with governance and risk management for vulnerabilities identified during cyber security testing operations is expectedProven ability to lead a project from start to finish from the technical sideExperience writing engineering design specifications.Capability to clearly communicate information security concepts and risksGood verbal and written communication skills in EnglishDemonstrated ability to work as part of a teamAble to reliably complete assignments with limited supervision, and to help lead the actions of others to accomplish complex or extended work assignments.Experience performing Project Management responsibilities to plan and track execution of assigned workloadExperience or awareness with industrial control systems and/or the implementation of cyber security in operational technology (OT) environments is desirable.Experience working in a global environment across multiple time zones.May involve some international travelMust be capable of passing security background clearance investigation

Name: Cyber Security Engineer – Multiple Opportunities
Description: Company DescriptionAt Leidos, we deliver practical solutions to the Federal Government’s most complex IT engineering problems. And, as a Prime Systems Integrator, these are often on a scale and variety rarely seen by other organisations. Whether developing and supporting technology transformation projects for the Bureau of Meteorology, providing software applications for critical Defence missions, or improving the way the ATO supports its service delivery, our work has a direct impact on the lives of Australians, and will certainly impact on your career.Job DescriptionYour New RoleLeidos has been engaged by Defence to provide a leading cyber security capability for the environments that our deployed military personnel rely on. The team develops and delivers key cyber security services to directly support the Department’s mission. We are seeking highly motivated and appropriately experienced staff to help us deliver outstanding results. This role is an exciting opportunity to perform crucial high value work to support and protect our personnel in the Australian Defence Forces.This is a rare opportunity for driven and focused people to “Get Cybersecurity Right”. This engagement is still maturing and there is real scope for the right individual to put their stamp on how Cybersecurity is done within the engagement, the end goal is a leading edge Cybersecurity capability that is the envy of others and we need the right people to get there.Our cyber engineering roles include support of the security function for our customer ensuring systems are available, appropriately maintained and secured. This role allows you to utilise your broad experience in a supportive team environment.You will have the following responsibilities:Management and configuration of the security tooling our Deployed ADF personnel rely on;Perform troubleshooting in support of the ADF or our Security Operations Centre, such as why logs aren’t shipping from point A to point B;Assist with vulnerability management including config reviews and software versions;Assist with incident investigation including obtaining logs, reviewing firewall rules, etc;Assist with monitoring the network for changes that may affect cyber security;Be cross trained into supporting cyber security tools such as proxies, sandboxes, mail gateways, and end point security;Integration and functional testing; andWork with other teams to troubleshoot complex issues across multiple networks.QualificationsAbout You and What You'll BringAs a Cyber Security Engineer, you will bring your knowledge and expertise to support the team. You will be customer-focused, and enjoy working as part of a team. We have a number of open roles from mid-level through to Senior. Our list of desired technologies is lengthy, however we don't expect you to bring all of the below to the table. We offer cross training across the entire tool suite for the right candidates.You will have the following skills/knowledge:3+ years in enterprise IT system administration;Knowledge of how a typical Enterprise IT system fits togetherIntermediate to advanced troubleshooting skills in complex networksWorking knowledge in cybersecurity principles such as hardening standards and techniquesWorking knowledge of Windows operating systemsIdeally you will have experience in some of the following:Worked with SOC operational teams to support evidence gatheringWorking knowledge of operating systems such as LinuxWorking knowledge of:SplunkMcAfee ePOTenable.SCCisco ASAsBluecoat ProxySG,ForescoutElastic SIEMFortinetCarbon Black Response or similar EDR toolsCarbon Black App Control or similar whitelisting toolsFortigate firewallsFortimailFortiauthenticatorFortiNACFortisandboxForticlientFortianalyserNutanix FlowIvanti Device ControlYou will have the following attributes:Comfortable working in cross team environments;Comfortable interacting with a mixture of highly technical peers and partners as well as military staff;Willing to learn new technologies in the cyber security space;Willing to mentor other team members; andWilling to go the extra mile to ensure customer mission needs are met.Additional InformationIf you want the following as part of your next role, please get in touch today.Important and engaging workLeading edge technologyExcellent training and career developmentHappy and focused high performing teamWork with experienced peersWell-resourced operationEnhance national securitySuccessful candidates will be required to be Australian Citizens and be able to obtain and maintain an Australian Government Security Clearance. NV-2 Clearance preferred, but an NV-1 cleared candidate with strong experience and team fit will be considered. This role requires tasks to be performed onsite due to the nature of the networks used.The successful candidate may need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements applicable to this role, and your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.  At Leidos, you will be valued, included and supported. So if you are open-minded and keen to be the difference, we look forward to welcoming you.

Name: Software Programmer
Description:
Job No.: 631051
Location: Clayton campus
Employment Type: Full-time
Duration: 2-year fixed-term appointment
Remuneration: $92,589 - $101,552 pa HEW Level 07 (plus 17% employer superannuation)

Be inspired, every day
Take your career in exciting, rewarding directions
Be a part of an inclusive, collaborative community

There’s a certain feeling you get from working at Monash University. It’s the feeling that you’re a part of something special. Something significant. And that’s because you’re not just starting your career, or taking on a bigger challenge. You’re making a real contribution – surrounded by energetic, inspiring people who are driven to make a difference as well. Monash is a place where you’ll be able to develop your career in exciting, sometimes unexpected ways – putting you in the best possible position for a rewarding future.
The Opportunity
An opportunity has become available for a Software Programmer to join the Department of Software Systems and Cybersecurity within the Faculty of Information Technology at Monash University on a 2-year fixed-term basis. In this role you will be reporting directly to the Deputy Head of Department and will be asked to oversee and deliver high-quality technical services to support the operations of the Enhanced Telehealth Project team. There is also potential to work on other Faculty projects once the Enhanced Telehealth Project is finished. This role will play a critical role in supporting the delivery of user-centred and agile software engineering outcomes.
This can include:

Designing, developing, and delivering software solutions on the WebRTC framework to be integrated into our industrial partner Health Direct Australia’s telehealth platform
Contributing to project planning and operations to share knowledge and expertise in the area of technical specialisation
Providing specialist and technical advice and/or training to key stakeholders in the area of service or technical expertise
Developing and maintaining up-to-date specialist or technical knowledge of new and innovative methodology, equipment, technology, data management and analysis in the field of specialisation
Overseeing and undertaking all aspects of software engineering
Overseeing and co-ordinating the day-to-day technical operations including; software implementation, functional and user testing, data collection activities, ensuring OHS and a safe operations, maintaining equipment and materials, waste disposal and ordering of devices and supplies

This position is suited to a highly motivated individual who holds a degree qualification in a relevant field with extensive relevant experience; or extensive industrial software development experience and management expertise. The successful candidate will ideally have demonstrated experience in overseeing a successful technical service, program or facility, with a focus on operational excellence as well as demonstrated experience in working with modern web technologies. Additionally, the ideal candidate will have experience in supporting a safe operating environment and producing commercial grade software solutions in an agile framework.
This role is a full-time position; however, flexible working arrangements may be negotiated.
If you believe you can fulfil these requirements, you are strongly encouraged to apply.
At Monash University, we are committed to being a Child Safe organisation. This position at the University will require the incumbent to hold a valid Working with Children Check. 
Your application must address the selection criteria. Please refer to "How to apply for Monash Jobs".
Enquiries
Associate Professor Rashina Hoda, Deputy Head of Department, +61 3 9902 9970
Position Description
 Software Programmer
Closing Date
Sunday 17 July 2022, 11:55pm AEST
 
At Monash University, the health, safety and wellbeing of our staff, students and visitors remain our priority. In accordance with the Directions issued by Victoria’s Chief Health Officer, we require all staff, students and visitors to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or have an approved medical exemption from receiving a COVID-19 vaccine in order to attend our campuses and locations. 
For the latest information on COVID-19 at Monash, please visit our website.

Name: Graduate Front End Software Engineer - IoT, HTML Programmer
Description: SummaryGrowth business in the Smart Building and IoT spaceRapidly evolving industryFun flexible work environment Permanent position About UsAt Edge Semantics we create software that assembles unconnected building data to unlock operational efficiency and provide insightful analytics for our clients. Edge Semantics was born to fill a gap within the Smart Building industry where traditional software solutions required substantial human resourcing to deploy and maintain. Our integrated data platform, Annexx, was developed with Semantic Web Technology and is a solution that normalises disparate data and automatically builds dynamic visual displays on request.    **www.edgesemantics.com** Why Edge Semantics?We work in an environment where initiative is encouraged and excellence is rewarded. We believe that an innovative and inquiring approach is the best way to address our clients' challenges. Our team is the core of our business and it’s our objective to create one of the best places to work in Melbourne. We accomplish this by giving our team ownership and autonomy. Empowering our team to achieve their individual and collective potential is our highest priority. Our company is in a period of extreme growth, with many opportunities for career progression as our solutions continue to impress our clients and win over the market.Other perks we provide are aimed to facilitate a positive work environment, lifestyle balance and help combat burnout during these difficult times:Flexible working hoursWorking from home/office support including home office equipmentTeam events; Grand Prix, Lawn Bowls, Golf, lunches/dinners etcWe prioritise our team’s growth and learning by establishing individual personal development programs.About the RoleWe are seeking a graduate front-end software developer to work within our Melbourne-based team developing, testing, and maintaining our innovative Building Technology software products. What you will need:Strong problem-solving skillsA qualification in Software engineering, programming, computer science or equivalentProficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Nodejs, HTML5 & CSSOther desirable skills include experience with:SQLJavaJDBCGitjQueryMongoDbGraphDb / SPARQL / RDFCloud solutionsCybersecurityWhat you will bring:A positive can-do attitudeAn inquiring mind that drives you to learn and challenge yourselfPride in your workSound time and task management skillsHigh level of attention to detailAbility to collaborate effectively within a teamStrong written and verbal communication skillsIf you would like to contribute to a team delivering truly innovative solutions, work on a diverse range of projects and technologies under a positive and inclusive work environment, you should apply.

Name: Senior Systems Engineer
Description: The Role This is an excellent opportunity for a competent and highly motivated person to work alongside IT professionals in an interesting and growing industry. In this position you will be provided with in-house training for many vendors and technologies. To be considered for this role we are seeking a professional individual with proven technical ability willing to take their skills to the next level. ABOUT THE POSITION. You will be reporting to the Chief Technology Officer where you will be responsible to for the overall health of organisational systems and infrastructures. You will report on and show leadership of change management cycles for technology implementations and server deployments with an active effort to provide a seamless transition for your team members in IT and the wider business.  DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES.  Provide 3rd level technical support to the business. Deployment of technology and upgrades. Proactively create strong relationships with both technical and non-technical personnel. Actively maintain both software and hardware technology. SKILLS & EXPERIENCE.  Strong, proven experience in a previous Senior Network Engineer role. Expert understanding in Microsoft Server, Office 365, Azure AWS and Security. Cisco and Microsoft based certifications are preferred.  e.g. CCNA, CCNP, MCSE, SCCM, AWS, etc.     Previous experience in similar roles with the following knowledge and skills are required: Skills & Experience:  Extensive knowledge of Windows PC/Mac & ideally Windows/Linux Server operating systems. Working with Active Directory & Office365 Administration. Familiar with Citrix suites. Familiar with NETAPP HCI and Storage Networking experience around products from Cisco, Meraki, Ubiquiti, VMware, etc. Basic understanding of Cybersecurity concepts would be highly regarded. Capability to provide support for general desktop, laptop and mobile hardware & software  Experience troubleshooting & configuring printers, data projectors, switches, routers, WAPs & IP Phones from various environments. Defence Industry Knowledge would be highly regarded This role will offer:  Dynamic work environment. All tools provided - Laptop and Mobile. Great exposure to Windows Server / Virtualization and converged technologies. The opportunity to become a vital part of a fast growing national company. Experience remotely supporting users in many locations across Australia. If this role sounds like you, please click "Apply for this job".

Name: Network Security Engineer
Description:
Could this be one of those rare moments to do the best work of your career? At Tabcorp, our story continues to evolve every day. It’s an exciting moment in our history - a new era of Tabcorp. We’re raising the game by creating the most engaging betting and entertainment experiences, and to lead in integrity.
We’re here to create excitement everywhere – through our incredible people, unrivalled experiences and strong relationships. We're bringing industry leading products and services to our customers and breaking into new horizons.
Game to join us? 
What you’ll do 
Your role will be jointly responsible for the development of the Tabcorp network security environments, accountable for delivering Infrastructure and operational services that underpin the entire Tabcorp business. You will assist to mitigate risk and respond to threats to limit the potential of a cyberattack that could impact Tabcorp and to make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world.
You will deliver a pivotal capability across network security engineering and will assist to drive high standards for quality and performance, following best practices and assist to deliver Infrastructure and operational services that underpin the entire Tabcorp business and provide seamless services to Tabcorp’s extensive business network and collectively excel at delivering amazing products, services and experiences that exceed customer expectations.
You will be proactive in maintaining a highly available and secure network environment to maximise service availability and collaborate closely with technology teams to deliver quality infrastructure.
What you’ll bring 

Experience in large-scale complex, diverse and distributed IT operations environment with experience in a network security engineer role in a 24x7 complex business.
Extensive experience in Layer 2 and Layer 3 technologies and related protocols such as TCP/IP, DNS, FTP, HTTP/S.
Solid understanding of identify and access principles and solutions (i.e. multi-factor authentication, single sign-on, identity management or related technologies.
Expert in cybersecurity and solid experience in translating information security requirements into Cybersecurity controls and measures Experience with security practices in supporting leading IaaS Cloud technologies.
Knowledge of security protocols, authentication and authorisation.
Experience in maintaining and supporting mission critical 24*7/365 services.
Experience working with Microsoft Azure/ AWS environment.
Demonstrated experience in successful delivery of projects.
Experience working with a variety of supplier / resource models, including matrix, managed services, and multiple suppliers.
Solid understanding of the cybersecurity, risk, and compliance requirements in an ICT context.
An extensive understanding of the Information and Technology industry, as well as digital and technology trends and next best practice.

What you’ll get 
Not only will you receive an awesome candidate experience from our caring Talent team, the perks of working with us are pretty good too!
The list is extensive but here are a few:

A “say yes” approach to flexible working to meet your individual needs
A multitude of leave types such cultural leave, volunteer leave and 18 weeks’ parental leave for all new parents, regardless of gender
We’re committed to Inclusion & Diversity with a range of initiatives such as our annual Inclusion Month celebrations and our Gender Affirmation Statement of Support
We’re proud to have been named an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the federal government’s Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) for the seventh consecutive year
We offer a comprehensive (and free) health and wellbeing app called The Arena to support you and your family’s mental and physical health
We’re committed to your learning and development with a dedicated platform with helpful resources from leadership to technology to upskill and cross train

About Tabcorp 
We’re Australia’s leading gambling entertainment company. Together, we build on our 100+ year heritage by delivering Excitement with Integrity, every day. Each one of us is here to put our customers at the heart of everything we do by creating moments that engage, surprise and thrill. 
Our 3,000+ strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive homegrown world-class brands; TAB, Sky Racing and MAX. As an ASX listed company, we’re proud to shape our industry for the better. Because together, anything’s possible. 
Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au [link removed].
COVID 
Tabcorp is closely monitoring Department of Health guidelines to ensure we continue to provide a safe working environment. You may be required to present evidence of Covid vaccination in order to comply with Public Health directions and fulfil the requirements of this role.
This role can be based in Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane.

You will assist to mitigate risk and respond to threats to limit the potential of a cyberattack that could impact Tabcorp and to make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world.
You will deliver a pivotal capability across network security engineering and will assist to drive high standards for quality and performance, following best practices and assist to deliver Infrastructure and operational services that underpin the entire Tabcorp business and provide seamless services to Tabcorp’s extensive business network and collectively excel at delivering amazing products, services and experiences that exceed customer expectations.
You will be proactive in maintaining a highly available and secure network environment to maximise service availability and collaborate closely with technology teams to deliver quality infrastructure.
What you’ll bring 

Experience in large-scale complex, diverse and distributed IT operations environment with experience in a network security engineer role in a 24x7 complex business.
Extensive experience in Layer 2 and Layer 3 technologies and related protocols such as TCP/IP, DNS, FTP, HTTP/S.
Solid understanding of identify and access principles and solutions (i.e. multi-factor authentication, single sign-on, identity management or related technologies.
Expert in cybersecurity and solid experience in translating information security requirements into Cybersecurity controls and measures Experience with security practices in supporting leading IaaS Cloud technologies.
Knowledge of security protocols, authentication and authorisation.
Experience in maintaining and supporting mission critical 24*7/365 services.
Experience working with Microsoft Azure/ AWS environment.
Demonstrated experience in successful delivery of projects.
Experience working with a variety of supplier / resource models, including matrix, managed services, and multiple suppliers.
Solid understanding of the cybersecurity, risk, and compliance requirements in an ICT context.
An extensive understanding of the Information and Technology industry, as well as digital and technology trends and next best practice.

What you’ll get 
Not only will you receive an awesome candidate experience from our caring Talent team, the perks of working with us are pretty good too!
The list is extensive but here are a few:

A “say yes” approach to flexible working to meet your individual needs
A multitude of leave types such cultural leave, volunteer leave and 18 weeks’ parental leave for all new parents, regardless of gender
We’re committed to Inclusion & Diversity with a range of initiatives such as our annual Inclusion Month celebrations and our Gender Affirmation Statement of Support
We’re proud to have been named an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the federal government’s Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) for the seventh consecutive year
We offer a comprehensive (and free) health and wellbeing app called The Arena to support you and your family’s mental and physical health
We’re committed to your learning and development with a dedicated platform with helpful resources from leadership to technology to upskill and cross train

About Tabcorp 
We’re Australia’s leading gambling entertainment company. Together, we build on our 100+ year heritage by delivering Excitement with Integrity, every day. Each one of us is here to put our customers at the heart of everything we do by creating moments that engage, surprise and thrill.?
Our 3,000+ strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive homegrown world-class?brands;?TAB, Sky Racing and MAX. As an ASX listed company, we’re proud to shape our industry for the better. Because together, anything’s possible.?
Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au [link removed].
COVID 
Tabcorp is closely monitoring Department of Health guidelines to ensure we continue to provide a safe working environment. You may be required to present evidence of Covid vaccination in order to comply with Public Health directions and fulfil the requirements of this role.
This role can be based in Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane.

Name: DevSecOps Engineer
Description: Servian is an award-winning global tech consultancy with a rich heritage in Data, DevOps, Digital, Machine Learning and Cloud. We embrace innovation, change, and the positive impact it has for us and our clients. All roles at Servian involve personal and technical development pathways which aim to facilitate your career growth.Servian is looking for dynamic individuals to join our growing Cybersecurity practice. We are looking for people who want to use their strong engineering skills to solve security challenges.Governance, risk and complianceSecurity testingSecurity and Risk assessmentsImplementation of DevSecOps delivery modelsCompliance as code design and deliveryCISO-as-a-ServiceSecurity ArchitectureCloud security posture reviewsPurpose of the role:Servian is currently recruiting for DevSecOps Engineers to be a part of the growing team in Melbourne. As part of the role you will be working on-site leading the design and implementing strategies and solutions that are required by our client with a focus on Security with DevOps. You will assist teams with incorporating security automation tooling and related security standards & processes into their DevOps practices. You’ll have a passion for learning new technologies and be an advocate for our principles of 'automate everything, infrastructure as code and collaboration between teams'. The Position:Lead the implementation of cloud solutions for clients, including infrastructure, data platforms and migration strategy.Work with clients to coach and share our solutions and approaches.Provide security automation guidance and implementation to client teams.Coach junior team members.Maintain accreditations with one or more of our key partners, AWS, Microsoft, GCP, Hashicorp and SumoLogic.Deliver training workshops and labs to our clients.Pre-sales support and solution architecture. Your experience - We’re looking for people who have the right approach and a breadth of knowledge across some of the following:Development, operations or system engineering experience.Knowledge and experience with Infrastructure as Code and configuration management.Designed, implemented and operated secure code management and build pipelines.Implemented secure CI/CD pipelines with automated deployment and management.Experience with cloud services including IaaS, PasS and SaaS.A detailed understanding of the underlying technologies and platform building blocks of the cloud environment.Strong automation and scripting experience.A drive for self-improvement and a passion for learning.An holistic approach encompassing the business goals and solution architecture whilst maintaining a secure operating posture.A dynamic approach to your work enabling you to meet the needs of changing environments.Bonus points!  If you have some experience in any of the following, it would be seen as advantageous: Experience in source code security tools, e.g. Snyk, SourceClear, Black Duck, SonarQube.Experience with SAST, DAST, RAST.Experience with compliance as code (E.g. OPA, Gatekeeper).Experience building/managing continuous compliance monitoring solutions.Experience designing/maintaining SIEM solutions (E.g. Splunk ES, Exabeam, Arcsight, Elasticsearch, Apache Metron, or something you built yourself!).Experience with secret management design and implementation.Applicable security certifications, such as CISSP, SABSA, CISM etc.We hire for mindset! If you don’t possess all of the above skills we can teach you what’s missing. So if this role resonates with you then hit that apply button!Why join Servian?Our career pathways are not a one-size fits all, we help you identify your personal and professional goals through our mentorship program. Helping you put together an action plan and keep you accountable.Growth through unlimited L&D and goal-based learning - free access to Udemy, you pass we pay model for courses and certifications, internal run boot camps and communities of practice (Machine Learning, DevOps, WebDev, Agile/Scrum Guilds)Flat Structure - No silos or departments; have the opportunity to work across various tech stacks, industries and projects. We value trust and transparency, that’s why we have an open-door policy across the business.Create your own destiny -  We support our consultant’s creativity. If you have an idea, turn it into an initiative!Flexible WFH policy - We value work-life balance, accountability and autonomy.Wellbeing & Benefits:We provide employees with Life Insurance, Income Protection Insurance and access to an Employee Assistance Program.Generous Parental leave.Substantial Referral fee. We value your opinion and want our employees to contribute to the success of Servian!Wellbeing and mental health initiatives - Yoga, Meditation, Steptember, Around the Bay.We are proud to have a sociable workplace that values diversity and celebrates achievements with quarterly company-wide events, social events and more. Think VR laser tag, wine tours and cooking classes.Monthly in-person team lunches/dinners so you can connect with your colleagues outside of work!Consultant-led initiatives to get everyone excited, which include social and tech clubs (gaming, IoT, badminton, wellbeing, whisky and wine, etc.), meetups, and cloud vendor hackathons.Come to the tech side… we have cookies! APPLY NOW!
