Name: Storage Engineer
Description: About the BusinessAustralia’s largest ASX listed (ASX:TNT) cybersecurity provider, Tesserent’s Secure Cloud division is an agile, and dynamic organisation delivering private, public cloud solutions along with managed services. Over the last 10 years the group has evolved into a market leader with the help of passionate, hardworking, and determined individuals. Every employee is handpicked to fit our culture, ideals, and common goal of becoming the leading secure hybrid cloud partner in Australia.About the RoleTesserent is seeking a Storage Engineer to deliver projects and operational services to key enterprise clients in the Sydney area. Reporting to the IT Infrastructure Manager, you will be responsible for designing, delivering, and management of compute infrastructure including troubleshooting and capacity planning for our growing internal enterprise and government client base. Deep technical skills in EMC are highly desirable.The successful candidate will be responsible for:Performing daily Storage SAN/NAS operational tasks, provisioning, monitoring, troubleshooting issues and initiating corrective action.Creating and updating documentation including standard operating procedures, solutions, knowledge base articles and applicable project documentation.Performing problem management and incident correlation on re-occurring issues; suggest and document workarounds and solutions.Acting as an escalation point on all storage issues.Supporting, planning, designing and delivering storage projects from detailed technical designs through implementation and handover to client technical teams. Willingness to participate in an afterhours rotating shift. The Ideal Candidate Must have current eligibility to work in AustraliaExcellent communication skills with an ability to interface with multiple layers of client organisations.Extensive experience and certification in Dell-EMC storage platforms.Strong and proven troubleshooting ability on a large scale, fast-paced operations environment.Strong Knowledge of Network attached storage and access protocols, such as SMB and NFS.Understanding of VMware and Hyper-V and their implications for storage infrastructure.Willingness to get "hands-on" with storage implementations from design and delivery through to operational handover.Willingness to undertake training and achieve vendor certifications.Reliability and commitment to getting the job done (including after hours as required).Desirable SkillsSkills in other storage and cloud technologies will be highly regardedSkills in backup and recovery solutions Strong skills in MS Excel, MS Word, MS Project, and MS PowerPointExperience with NetApp and Nutanix platforms Experience in both operations and in the delivery of infrastructure projects for mission critical environments.Benefits and perksSalary in line with industry standardsOpportunities to undertake technical training, secure industry recognised certifications, attend industry eventsRole provides an excellent opportunity to work in a fun team that continues to have exceptional success

Name: Security Engineer
Description: Who are we? Come join our collaborative, flexible and friendly team at Standards Australia and be a part of Australia’s future! We are the peak non-government Standards body in Australia and we facilitate the creation of standards which help govern the specifications that products and services in Australia should live up to. We work closely with government, industry, consumer, and stakeholder groups and are working in exciting areas such as circular economy, artificial intelligence, renewal energy and smart tech.   We are experiencing an exciting period of growth embarking on a number of new projects, which would see our current team of 280+ employees grow substantially throughout 2022, our centenary year. About the role The Security Engineer is responsible for designing, implementing, and administering security solutions and improving security measures to meet the changing requirements of the business. The Security Engineer will be responsible for several functions associated with IT security - from ensuring the security of software, through to selecting and/or constructing and deploying broader network security systems on premise and in the cloud. They will also be responsible for completing risk assessments, identifying vulnerabilities within a network, and creating firewalls, or configuring systems to enhance existing security features. The Security Engineer will be expected to respond to, and document, any security threats, and incidents, resolve technical faults and assume responsibility in the execution of SA’s cybersecurity remediation program.What you'll do  Implementing numerous security controls as part of the cybersecurity remediation program Implement, configure and monitor security tools such as SIEM solutions Vulnerability management and threat intelligence Collaborate with internal and external security and technical roles in maintaining and uplifting SA’s security posture, managing risk Provide security / architecture expertise, direction, and assistance to other areas of the business – e.g., in reviewing proposed system and application designs Assisting the Security Architect in designing reliable, powerful, and flexible security architectures for all IT projects Help maintain security policies and procedures, particularly those where technical input is required Identifying current and emerging technology issues including security trends, vulnerabilities, and threats Sourcing and implementing new security solutions to better protect the organisation Conducting proactive research to analyse security weaknesses and recommend appropriate strategies Perform security assessments, identify gaps in existing security architecture, and recommend changes or improvements Monitor, log and investigate security events (root cause analysis, trend analysis, etc.) Training and promotion of security awareness Assist in the response process for any security-related incidents (e.g., data breaches, viruses, phishing scams) and providing input into post-event analysis once there is a resolution Updating and upgrading the organization’s security systems and infrastructure as needed Develop and update security documents such as architectural documents and tests plans  About you  3-5 years' experience of security operations activities, possibly in a SOC environment Tertiary qualification in Cyber Security, IT or Engineering, electronics/computer/communication/networking) highly regarded Industry relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, CEH, GSEC or CompTIA Security+ Experience of wider operational security in multidimensional organisations Extensive experience in technical aspects of information security and architecture, and preferably IT risk management Demonstrable understanding of information security controls and technology Experience of working with an ISO27001 ISMS or NIST Significant experience in using and implementing cloud platforms (Azure in particular) Strong knowledge of Windows operating environment and service architecture Experience in developing secure network architectures Solid understanding of security protocols, cryptography, authentication, authorisation and security Experience with the various aspects of wireless security such as routers, switches, and VLAN security Knowledge of security concepts related to DNS, including routing, authentication, VPN, proxy services, and DDOS mitigation technology Knowledge of technical security controls including Cisco firewalls & IPS, EDR solutions, web filtering, email filtering and logging and monitoring Experience implementing MFA, single sign-on, identity management or related technologies Risk assessments, manual and automated vulnerability scanning & penetration testing exposure Security documentation experience Scripting experience e.g. PowerShell, Python Strong time management and organisational skills  Working for usIntegrity, Courage, Accountability, Respect and Excellence form the basis of all we do. Our success is measured not only on the outcomes but on the path we took to get there.  Standards Australia offer a flexible and positive culture where individual and team efforts are recognised and rewarded. We celebrate our success through quarterly events such as EOY party, Family Day, Melbourne Cup, Awards and Picnic day. We also promote training through our internal L&D team and access to services like LinkedIn learning and toastmasters. What's next?If you meet the above criteria, please submit your CV and a covering letter which outlines your experience and suitability to this role. Eligible applicants must be a Permanent Resident or have legal rights to work in Australia. Shortlisted applicants will be contacted within 15 business days of their application.

Name: Graduate Cyber Security Analyst
Description: Looking for a post pandemic change?Ready to put your cyber security training to workKeen to work for a company that offers maximum flexibility.Who we're looking for…Someone friendly, enthusiastic and helpful, with excellent technical and communication skills. In addition, we need someone who loves to be organised and enjoys giving attention to detail. You will be joining a Service Desk team that is striving to provide superior technical and customer focused support. In this role you will take lead on Level 1 cyber security tasks.Why work @ Matrix Solutions?We are a growing IT company that provides cloud solutions primarily to the legal industry. In addition, we offer managed support services for on-site networks. Most of our support is offered over the phone or online.Head office is in Sydney but we look after clients Australia-wide.  From the top down we really like our clients! We are a highly motivated group who enjoy working as a team to solve IT problems even when they are stressful.We also all enjoy our lives outside of work and strive to keep a healthy work/life balance!We have been doing what we do for over 27 years now so, in our opinion, we are getting better and better at it. Since our customer base is growing rapidly it seems our clients agree. However, we need to keep improving our systems as we grow. Our goal is to be Australia's number one supplier of IT services to small and medium-sized legal and professional firms.Your Background.....Information Technology degree with an emphasis on cyber security Excellent customer service skills, phone manners and passion in assisting employees with L1 IT issuesSkills in Active Directory, O365Excellent communication skills, approachable friendly personalityTertiary qualifications, ITIL or relevant certificationsEnthusiastic and contagious can-do attitudeFlexible attitude to all work dutiesThe Role:Respond to cyber security tickets assigned as first point of contact and, if necessary escalate issues to senior team membersUndertake continuous monitoring to detect anomalous or suspicious events in Microsoft 365 Security Portal, TrendMicro Portal and Netwrix Audit reports.Perform basic vulnerability management and monitoring on key client systemsDevelop and establish Standard Operating Procedures for Cyber Security related activitiesCollaboration with senior infrastructure engineers to implement security controlsMonitor system alerts and notifications, and respond accordingly through service tickets.Communication with customers as required: keeping them informed of incident progress.Working on a rotating roster to cover 8:00 am – 6:00 pm plus a 24 X 7 mobile phone rosterWhat we can offer youCareer path to grow within the team. A full-time position providing a negotiable salary, dependent on previous experience, plus superannuation.

Name: Senior Engineer - CCTV and Security
Description:
About the role 
Ensure that the design conforms to all safety, environmental, construction, commissioning, and operating requirements;
Implement cybersecurity technologies that meet the ICS cybersecurity standards/guidelines to address different risk scenarios.
Perform safety and/or hazard analyses, security analyses, and regulatory compliance assessments by identifying key issues and risks to comply with applicable standards, policies, and regulations.
Implement cybersecurity technologies that meet the ICS cybersecurity standards/guidelines to address different risk scenarios.
Work with ICS engineers to measure impact on performance to determine acceptable performance requirement and testing parameters which include network and operational performance impacts

About you 
Tertiary degree qualification to Bachelor status in Engineering (or equivalent industry experience in the absence of a degree);
Experience with analogue and IP type CCTV cameras, CCTV Digital Video Management Systems, video analytics and associated components10 years+ experience in the industry (in technology or related market verticals);
Must have an Australian Drivers Licence
Strong communication skills (oral & written) including strong negotiation and influencing skills and the ability to establish effective working relationships with a variety of people at different levels both internally and externally.
Demonstrated ability to work independently to organise and prioritise demands, handle multiple complex tasks simultaneously, set and meet deadlines and follow-through within a fast paced environment with multiple and competing demands;

What we offer
Diverse opportunities to grow, back yourself and achieve
Flexible working arrangements
Ongoing training for career progression 
A competitive remuneration package with salary continuance insurance, employee assistance program for employees and their families, AIA Vitality wellness program and Discounts on private health insurance, vehicles, travel and more

What makes you right for UGL  
Ability to provide a safe, supportive and positive workplace
Empower a united and collaborative culture
Deliver technical excellence and create efficient, innovative solutions
Build an enviable reputation and the trust of employees, clients and other stakeholders
Genuine concern for safety

About Us
UGL is a well-known and respected for providing end-to-end engineering, construction and maintenance services within; rail and transport, communications and technology systems, oil and gas, power, renewables and resources, water and defence markets. UGL partners with some of the world’s largest blue-chip companies and government agencies, private enterprises and public institutions. We are a member of the CIMIC Group of companies
At UGL, we value diversity – in the backgrounds, ideas, work styles and perspectives of our team. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourage people with disability, Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander people, mature aged workers and people from culturally diverse backgrounds to apply.
Please note that relevant screening checks will be conducted as part of the recruitment process. These may include a national criminal history check and for you to undergo pre-employment medical assessment including drug and alcohol screen.

Name: Systems Engineer
Description: If you're a highly-skilled Systems Engineer looking to join a flexible, friendly, forward-thinking team – you're in the right place. Let's get to know each other.  Let's start with the perks:  We help people, not just computers. That starts at our core, with our people. As a family-oriented company, we're big on work-life balance. We want you to learn, grow, and enjoy your job - with the flexibility to balance other important things around it.  Here's what we bring to the table: A competitive salary package.  Work from home arrangements. Flexible start and finish times. Hands-on experience with the latest Microsoft technologies.  Paid study leave so you can grow your skills.  Modern office located centrally close to public transport.A huge breakout room designed to help you unwind and have a good time. Tasty food in the fridge and barista-quality coffee every day. Regular team social events.  PT-led workouts every Monday after work, open to everyone (partners too). A relaxed, inclusive culture fostering support and growth.   Life at Trimble:  A day in the life at Trimble's usually starts with a fresh barista-grade brew. You'll kick off your workday with a helpful, dynamic team at your side and, of course, cutting edge tech. Then, make yourself at home in our kitchen, stocked with fresh food for lunch. Need some quiet time? Head to our huge balcony overlooking the river. Keen to socialise? Come to the breakout area to eat with friends or play some pool.  Now, a bit about you: You have a genuine desire to deliver outstanding service and know that managing client expectations is vital. You're a problem solver who knows how to troubleshoot and believes in continual education. Plus, your organised and systematic approach means you can successfully juggle multiple priorities.  Your career: Where do you want to go? Your passion and input are valued. We'll do everything we can to make things happen for you.  We know our people are brimming with brilliant ideas and recognise the importance of creating opportunities for you. With an open-door policy to senior management, training, and support like paid study leave – we help you succeed in ways that matter to you.  What you'll be working on: Using the latest Microsoft technologies, you'll take care of day-to-day support for multiple clients. Plus, you'll get hands-on with security best practices, projects, and solutions design.  Solve complex problems, high-impact challenges Day-to-day remote and onsite technical support Proactive maintenance and project-related client site workEscalation and technical mentoring for peersOn-call support (roughly six weeks rotation)Maintain expert skills in alignment with industry standards What you'll bring: Ideally, you'll have at least five years of experience with:  Windows Server 2012 to 2019 Active Directory, Group Policy Microsoft 365/Azure/Intune Exchange 2013 – 2019 and Exchange Online Microsoft Hyper-V Backup, Antivirus & Endpoint protection Various network technologies DNS, DHCP, VPN, WLAN/WANCybersecurity/Firewall management ITIL understanding experience is highly advantageous You'll also have an Australian Drivers License and be willing to travel interstate on occasion.  Time for a bit about us:  Trimble Networks is an industry leader in managed IT services, prioritising security and driving digital transformation. For almost 20 years, we've been building a spectacular experience for our clients and a friendly, inclusive, and supportive workplace for our people.   Our goals: We measure our success on how well we: Take care of our staff's physical, mental, and social well-being. Keep our team's skills up to date.  Maintain high client satisfaction and procedural efficiency. Continue to develop and improve our company culture.  Grow and expand Trimble Networks across new industries.   What comes next? Our hiring process goes a little like this:   Find this ad. Get excited.  Hit the apply button or flick your CV Wait for us to review your application. We'll do this as quickly as possible. Get on the phone with us so we can discover what you're looking for. Join us for an in-person interview so we can get to know each other better. Time to meet the team for coffee – and find out what life at Trimble is really like. You join the Trimble family, and we all do a happy dance. Thanks for sticking with us until the end. Hopefully, we'll be seeing you soon.

Name: Network Engineer
Description:
Could this be one of those rare moments to do the best work of your career? At Tabcorp, our story continues to evolve every day. It’s an exciting moment in our history - a new era of Tabcorp. We’re raising the game by creating the most engaging betting and entertainment experiences, and to lead in integrity.
We’re here to create excitement everywhere – through our incredible people, unrivalled experiences and strong relationships. We're bringing industry leading products and services to our customers and breaking into new horizons.
Game to join us? 
What you’ll do
You will deliver a pivotal capability for critical infrastructure services across the network environment and be proactive in delivering quality infrastructure and maintaining a highly available and secure network and communication environment to maximise service availability.
Reporting to the Network & Communications Team Lead, you will be jointly responsible for the development of the Tabcorp network environments and accountable for delivering Infrastructure and operational services that underpin the entire Tabcorp business and provide seamless services to Tabcorp’s extensive business network and collectively excel at delivering amazing products, services and experiences that exceed customer expectations.
What you’ll bring

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or equivalent qualification.
Experience in the implementation and support of enterprise scale WAN and unified communications environments.
Extensive knowledge of IT Infrastructure, LAN and WAN Services, firewall/security, VoIP and VPN systems.
Experience in Layer 2 and Layer 3 technologies and related protocols such as TCP/IP, DNS, FTP, HTTP/S, SSH, Telnet, SNMP, VOIP protocols i.e. SIP and H323.
Experience in maintaining and supporting mission critical 24*7/365 services.
Experience with Avaya CM, SM and CMS, MS Lync/Skype4 Business, Linux, Asterisk, FrontRange IPCM 5.8, NICE Recording, Numonix Recording, Cisco VGW, CUCME, Audiocodes Gateways and Session Border Controllers, Polycom IP Phones, Skype For Business Room Systems (nice to have).
Advising on a diverse set of technical issues.
Experience working with Microsoft Azure/ AWS environment.
Experience with Queuing - Marking, queuing, shaping and policing, specific router and switch commands to analyse and troubleshoot quality of service related issues.
Experience working with a variety of supplier / resource models, including matrix, managed services, and multiple suppliers.
Understanding of the cybersecurity, risk, and compliance requirements in an ICT context.

What you’ll get
Not only will receive an awesome candidate experience from our caring Talent team, the perks of working with us are pretty good too!
The list is expensive but here are a few:

A “say yes” approach to flexible working to meet your individual needs
A multitude of leave types such as cultural leave, volunteer leave and 18 weeks’ parental leave for all new parents, regardless of gender
We’re committed to Inclusion & Diversity with a range of initiatives such as our annual Inclusion Month celebrations and our Gender Affirmation Statement of Support
We’re proud to have been named an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the federal government’s Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) for the seventh consecutive year
We offer a comprehensive (and free) health and wellbeing app called The Arena to support you and your family’s mental and physical health
We’re committed to your learning and development with a dedicated platform with helpful resources from leadership to technology to upskill and cross train

About Tabcorp
We’re Australia’s leading gambling entertainment company. Together, we build on our 100+ year heritage by delivering Excitement with Integrity, every day. Each one of us is here to put our customers at the heart of everything we do by creating moments that engage, surprise and thrill.?
Our 3,000+ strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive homegrown world-class?brands;?TAB, Sky Racing and MAX. As an ASX listed company, we’re proud to shape our industry for the better. Because together, anything’s possible.?
Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au [link removed]. 
COVID
Tabcorp is closely monitoring Department of Health guidelines to ensure we continue to provide a safe working environment. You may be required to present evidence of Covid vaccination in order to comply with Public Health directions and fulfil the requirements of this role.
This role can be based in Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane.

Name: Level 1 / Level 2 Support Engineer
Description: The RoleDue to large growth this is an excellent opportunity for competent and highly motivated people to work alongside IT professionals in an interesting and growing industry. In this position you will be provided with in-house training for many vendors and technologies.To be considered for these roles we are seeking a professional individual with proven technical ability willing to take their skills to the next level.You will need to have had experience in similar roles where you have been required to:Responsibilities:Providing Level 1 and/or Level 2 technical support to customers via phone, email, remote desktop and face to face.Working closely with technology in various customer environments that may involve workstations, printers, data projectors, switches, servers, routers and firewalls.Monitoring the performance, integrity, backups and security of internal and client systems, workstations, servers and networks.Managing customer requests, support tickets and ensuring our service is always fast, on time and well-communicated.Creating and providing documentation where required.Diagnose internet /  IT faults and escalate where required.In-house/onsite setting up workstations, notebooks, and assisting with deployment of servers and networks.Logging faults and tickets.Demonstrate a high attention to detail.Work effectively in a team.Previous experience in similar roles with the following knowledge and skills are required:Skills & Experience:• Extensive knowledge of Windows PC/Mac & ideally Windows/Linux Server operating systems.• Working with Active Directory & Office365 Administration.• Familiar with Citrix Director and Studio suites.• Networking experience around products from Cisco, Meraki, Ubiquiti, FortiNet or CheckPoint regarded.• Basic understanding of Cybersecurity concepts would be highly regarded.• Capability to provide support for general desktop, laptop and mobile hardware & software• Experience troubleshooting & configuring printers, data projectors, switches, routers, WAPs & IP Phones from various environments.This role will offer:• On the job training.• Dynamic work environment.• All tools provided - Laptop and Mobile.• Great exposure to Windows Server / Virtualization and converged technologies.• The opportunity to become a vital part of a fast growing national company.• Experience remotely supporting users in many locations across Australia.If this role sounds like you, please click "Apply for this job".

Name: IT Hardware Field Service Technician *CERTIFICATIONS FULLY SPONSORED*
Description: About UnisysAt Unisys our mission is YOU.  We are a multi-billion-dollar global IT company known for providing multi-cloud solutions including cybersecurity, digital government, core and retail banking, and travel and transportation. We transform and manage our clients’ applications, data, networks and devices. Why you’ll love working for UNISYS?As a Field Service Technician, we will sponsor you to become a fully qualified engineer providing Laptop and PC hardware support to customers on behalf of our global alliance partners Dell and Lenovo.With us you will be rewarded with great work life balance supported by a collaborative, diverse and inclusive team. We provide you with training, upskilling and opportunities to continuously develop your technical skills and career. By having a dedicated Flexible Workforce Community, we can consider full and part time hours, contract lengths short and long term, plus we have opportunities across Australia including regional areas should you like to move interstate now or in the future. We also consider you for permanent opportunities as and when they arise due to internal promotions and business growth.If you are new to the employment market or are seeking a change in career, and have a keen interest in PCs, knowledge of parts and how they work, with a strong desire to learn, we are open to discussing your options here at Unisys.Key Responsibilities:You will be providing general laptop/tablet and desktop break-fix and in warranty repairs for Dell and Lenovo customers. Being field based you will visit a range of customers to support from individuals to corporate clients and education establishments. Your role will include configuration, installation, re-installing of software and re-imaging machines by following Unisys’ Dell and Lenovo administration processes.You’ll be required to travel around surrounding regions, where you will be paid per job with great earning potential.To be considered for the role you should have:Proven strong customer service focus, a can-do attitude and ability to build rapport with clientsClear communication style, written and verbalDemonstrated attention to detail, and ability to manage/follow processesDue to the nature of this role all successful candidates must hold an Australian driver’s license and have a reliable vehicleKnowledge of MS softwareValid work rights for AustraliaWhat’s Next?Once we have reviewed your application, if successful you will be contacted by our Recruitment Partners (Hays Talent Solutions) for an initial chat to discuss this opportunity with you and answer any questions.Please note at Unisys we conduct background checks including police checks and working with children’s checks. Learn more about Unisys Careers at www.jobs.unisys.com/us/en

Name: Programme Manager
Description: We’re inventing the future, right here, right now, at Thales. We design the critical security solutions of tomorrow by combining the curiosity to explore, the intelligence to question and the vision to create. Together we solve complicated problems by combining our experience in the market with our leading research and development capabilities.We are forming a select group of seasoned programme managers to lead and direct the most complex projects across Thales’s diverse defence, security and civil sectors in Australia and abroad.About Your RoleThis full time permanent Program Manager role is part of our corporate Project Management team servicing major projects and bids across Thales Australia. Partnering with different business units, you will be using your experience and expertise to lead a variety of complex projects through their most challenging phases. Anticipating project complexity and leading organisations and customers through challenging project phases.Systematically guiding teams through the project mobilisation phase with detailed planning to ensure the critical acceptance and delivery phases have the best chance of success.Directing project remediation activities and establishing well defined get-well plans with robust transition strategies.Leadership and management of large teams of internal employees, subcontractors and partners, aligning them around shared vision and objectives, anticipating workload and future skills requirements, building capability and ensuring optimal delivery and performancePromoting “One Thales” behavioural culture, fostering teamwork and collaboration with other parts of Thales that are related or involved in the portfolio.Strategic management of stakeholders and associated communications both external and internal in order to enhance business reputation.Building and maintaining an open, collaborative and trusting relationship at a level one above the respective project managers.Supporting capture and bid management activities to ensure portfolio tender submissions are compelling and competitive.How About You?Tertiary qualified in business, engineering, project management or related field, with formal IPMA certification preferred.Extensive experience of scoping, planning, managing and delivering highly complex, large-scale projects  from mobilisation to successful completion within a customer-driven environmentProven and effective leadership skills with a high level of interpersonal and verbal communication skills as well as the ability to lead multi-disciplinary teams.A champion of change, able to drive a culture of continuous improvement and embed the adoption of best practice within the organisationDemonstrated ability to lead large multi-skilled engineering teams in an international environment in diverse cultures and unstable arena concerning one or several stakeholders.Good to KnowYou’ll get an email acknowledgement after you’ve applied, Thales strives to provide a personalised experience for all suitable applicants. As a Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain an appropriate clearance.  To learn more about clearances please visit – http://www.defence.gov.au/AGSVA/ [link removed]Prior to offer you’ll complete a pre-employment police and medical check.For more information on Thales visit us @ThalesCareers on InstagramThales is committed to promoting and maintaining a workplace culture of shared respect that enables all of us to feel valued, do our best, and remain truly passionate about the place that we work. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive, barrier-free recruitment process and supportive workplace. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and individuals from diverse backgrounds.We are also proud to be a WORK180 Endorsed Employer for Women. If you would like to know more on how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives here: https://work180.com/en-AU/for-women/employer/thales [link removed].Wellbeing matters at Thales, and where possible we encourage flexible working.

Name: Senior Sales Engineer
Description: About Trend MicroTrend Micro, a global cybersecurity leader, helps make the world safe for exchanging digital information. Fuelled by decades of security expertise, global threat research, and continuous innovation, Trend Micro's cybersecurity platform protects hundreds of thousands of organisations and millions of individuals across clouds, networks, devices, and endpoints. As a leader in cloud and enterprise cybersecurity, the platform delivers a powerful range of advanced threat defence techniques optimised for environments like AWS, Microsoft, and Google, and central visibility for better, faster detection and response. With 7,000 employees across 65 countries, Trend Micro enables organisations to simplify and secure their connected world.By joining our team of passionate industry experts, you have the opportunity to become a trailblazer and shape the cybersecurity landscape.What are we looking for?Are you passionate about DevOps? APIs and SDKs? Automation of IT and Security workflows? Do you want to automate everything?The Trend Micro Australia Sales Engineering team is looking for someone different. Someone who can understand the mindset of those who are running toward the new IT world of DevOps and automating tasks and infrastructure through code. Someone who loves IaC. Someone who wants to integrate, orchestrate and automate.Do you have a background as a DevOps Engineer, DevOps architect, Cloud Architect, Support Engineer for a SaaS or DevOps, or Linux or Windows Administration? Sales Engineering experience is welcomed, but not necessary. If you're interested in a career in "next-gen" sales engineering, then we have an amazing opportunity for you.We want you to lead the charge on driving powerful demos showcasing our security automation capabilities using our API/SDK capabilities in our market-leading hybrid cloud security offer, Trend Micro Deep Security. This offer protects the "hybrid cloud" workloads across AWS, Azure, Google, and VMWare. Our customers need to automate their security operations, as code, across the hybrid cloud, at scale. A strong passion for customer success and curious nature is critical to the role.You will be working with our customers in our rapidly growing business and need to have the ability to lead and execute with our sales teams.Some of the Job ResponsibilitiesConsult with customers, understand their issues and demonstrate and architect possible solutions.Experience with APIs, SDKs, and technologies used in CI/CD pipelineAbility to listen to customer problems, work with the sales team, and demo a solution and provide useful code samplesEnable the technical sales field through the creation of collateral (demos, videos, training, etc)Having and displaying a passion for security and DevOpsRelevant Work ExperienceA good understanding of scripting and coding, tasks where things required automationComputer Science and/or Business Degree (related field) or equivalent work experienceExperience using a Source Code Repository (ex. github)Understanding of cloud-native technologies and containerization of services (AWS, Azure, EKS, ECS, K8S, Docker)Proven experience working as a Systems Engineer supporting automated builds and continuous integrationBenefits of being a Trender!At Trend Micro, our people and culture are our power. There are no barriers - you are empowered to discover your passion and be the best part of yourself.We encourage you to challenge the status quo, break assumptions, and learn and grow every step of your career, fulfilling your potential.Helping customers succeed is our top priority. We believe in doing the right thing, solving the right problems, and maintaining business sustainability. And our efforts to make a difference go beyond the digital world.Trenders have the opportunity to be good global citizens by building houses in the Philippines, donating money to help underprivileged communities, educating kids and parents on online safety, advancing a diverse workforce (Close the Gap™ program [link removed]), and more.We take employee wellbeing seriously. At Trend, you will have access to Medical Insurance, Mental Health Support through access to EAP, Yoga and Meditation sessions, Gym reimbursements, Paid Parental Leave etc.At Trend Micro, we embrace diversity, equity and inclusion. We believe that our people are our greatest asset and we understand the importance of bringing diverse perspectives, approaches and experiences to our team. We are committed to building and supporting an inclusive workforce that truly reflects our global business and encourages people from all backgrounds to apply.

Name: Security Support Engineer
Description: Founded in 2014, and listed on the ASX since 2015, Superloop’s purpose is to enable better internet for Australian homes and businesses, by enabling challenger retail brands (including our own Superloop and Exetel brands) to take a larger share of the market, leveraging Superloop’s Infrastructure-on-Demand platform. Superloop operates in three segments of the market: consumer connectivity, business network and security solutions, and wholesale connectivity, all of which leverage Superloop’s investments in physical infrastructure assets including fibre, subsea cables and fixed wireless, as well as Superloop’s software platforms. Hundreds of thousands of homes and businesses rely on Superloop and Exetel everyday for their connectivity needs.Visit www.superloop.com to learn more.Our IT Security Support Engineers are responsible for providing level 2/3 support to our customers of our cyber-safety products. The Security Support Engineer provides a hybrid of systems and networking expertise to ensure timely resolution of technical issues, implementation of our cyber-safety products, proactive consultation, and continued high quality services to our customers. CyberHound, is a Next Generation Firewall that is one of the most advanced sets of multi-layered ‘defence in depth’ security platforms to deliver reliable cybersecurity for schools. Our platform assists to secure a network as well as protect it from ransomware, malware, zero-day threats, phishing and more.This platform sets the benchmark for K12 security coupled with the extensive set of additional features that are part of our Advanced Threat Protection Suite – ensuring peace of mind for school communities.Visit www.cyberhound.com to learn moreWhat will you do?Receive and manage customer support queries and issues, providing technical expertise and timely resolution;Update and maintain internal knowledge bases to facilitate a better understanding of recurring issues;Build, image and configure cyber-safety hardware for customers;Contribute to product documentation and identify areas to improve the customer experience;Liaise with our sales team to qualify customer requirements and product specifications, and process technical orders; Assist with software testing and quality assurance, and;Stock control and ordering. Who do we want to apply?The successful candidate will have:Strong networking knowledge, in areas such as switching and routing;Broad technical knowledge (including TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP, SMTP, POP3, IMAP, XMPP);Familiarity with wired and wireless networking, centralised authentication systems (Active Directory, eDirectory, Open Directory), operating systems (Windows client and server, OS X, iOS, Android and Linux), VMware, Hyper-V, and server hardware;General understanding of MS Office tools, G Suite, hardware, and CRMs (Salesforce);Knowledge of server authentication integration (e.g. AD and/or RADIUS);Experience with network firewalls, and;Ability to diagnose issues through troubleshooting and investigation, and provide an excellent customer experience. What can we do for you?As we grow and evolve, we want you to as well. We’re progressive. We understand that life exists outside of work which is why we have a flexible approach to the way we work. We’re innovators. Innovation is part of our identity, which is why we celebrate the uniqueness of yours. We’re easy-going. We pride ourselves on creating a fun, casual and relaxed environment. Ditch the corporate attire if you want to - embrace it if that’s your thing. What matters most is that you’re comfortable when you come to work. We welcome diversity. We encourage and seek out diversity of backgrounds and opinions, because we know differences challenge us and help us grow.We give back. In addition to annual and sick leave, we give you the opportunity to spend some paid time away from work doing something meaningful with five personal development days per year. You can use these to help out in the school tuckshop, attend training for your own personal development, or lend a hand to a meaningful charity if you would like to. We stand by our product. We’re confident we have the best connectivity product on the market so we offer our employees free connection to our home broadband service. You have an opportunity to be part of the next exciting part of our journey. What are you waiting for?

Ditch the corporate attire if you want to - embrace it if that’s your thing. What matters most is that you’re comfortable when you come to work. We welcome diversity. We encourage and seek out diversity of backgrounds and opinions, because we know differences challenge us and help us grow.We give back. In addition to annual and sick leave, we give you the opportunity to spend some paid time away from work doing something meaningful with five personal development days per year. You can use these to help out in the school tuckshop, attend training for your own personal development, or lend a hand to a meaningful charity if you would like to. We stand by our product. We’re confident we have the best connectivity product on the market so we offer our employees free connection to our home broadband service. You have an opportunity to be part of the next exciting part of our journey. Name: Cyber Security Engineer
Description: Who are GWA?Since 1886, the experts at GWA have designed innovative, high-quality products for homes and offices. We have market leading, iconic brands including Caroma, Methven, Dorf and Clark.At GWA our purpose is to make everyday water experiences extraordinary. Water scarcity affects all communities and given that our consumers enjoy experiencing our products every day, we are proud to help save millions of litres of water each year.Your new roleWe take cyber security seriously at GWA and it is pivotal to supporting our digital transformation and managing the direction of the infrastructure underpinning our digital growth.  To bring all of this to life, we are looking for a Cyber Security Engineer who is experienced in all facets of modern enterprise technologies to help us bring this transformation to life. You will proactively partner with your stakeholders and the Technology team to drive best practice cyber security leadership across our transformation projects, all whilst supporting ongoing operational security activities.At GWA we recognise that hybrid work is the new way of working, and to support this we have our Moments that Matter hybrid working framework.  To ensure you can deliver and partner with the people needed, you will have the flexibility of working at both our North Sydney and Prestons sites in Sydney. Our Prestons site has onsite parking, and our North Sydney office is a quick 5 minute walk from the train station.As our new Cyber Security Engineer, your key responsibilities will include but will not be limited to: Providing hands on engineering capability for securing cloud servicesProviding system support and supporting the team for any high priority issues. Providing technical security leadership and mentoring across the Transformation and Technology team to ensure a "secure -by-design" approach is embedded to transformational activitiesProviding thought leadership and remaining up to date with new security technologies whilst identifying any areas of improvement.About youAlong with your previous experience (2+ years) in security engineering and operations, you'll have knowledge and experience in:Public Cloud Infrastructure and of the Azure Cloud platform and supporting Microsoft TechnologiesIdentifying and responding to cyber security incidentsSecurity services such as Sentinel, Defender, Secure Hub/VWAN, Cloud App Security, AzureAD and Application Gateway.Microsoft security stack and auxiliary technologies (i.e. PIM, AzureAD, Sentinel, Defender, Cloud App Security, VWAN)Vulnerability and patch management tools (e.g. Rapid7)Secure code practices and secure code automation pipelinesThe design and delivery of cloud security architectures and patternsLogging and monitoring using cloud native SIEM architecture, development, and analysisIdentity and access management including OIDC, Conditional Access, Privileged Access Management and integrations using principles of least privilege and segregation of duties. Data protection strategies and integrations including Data Loss Prevention and Information Rights ManagementAdditional qualifications you will hold to ensure you are the best person for the role include: Cloud / or Microsoft Certifications (including AZ-500)Cybersecurity industry certifications such as CISSP, OSCP, GIAC Incident Handler are highly desirable but not essentialWhat's it like to work at GWA?Culture is key for us, and our people come from a variety of backgrounds and industries. We all share a common purpose of bringing to life all three of our cultural pillars: We are Customer Focused; We are One Team and We Care For Each Other. Our passion and dedication are evident in how we work together to ensure everyone achieves our goals and that we all play in a role in making GWA a great place to work.Our success is driven by a global team that share a passion to be the trusted and integrated solutions partner in the delivery of sustainable water solutions for bathrooms, kitchens, and laundries.GWA is on a journey from Good to Great, and we are looking for people who are excited by change and want to make a difference. We care for each other and encourage people to take the lead to deliver superior solutions for our customers and consumers.What else do we offer?Flexible and hybrid working options Competitive remuneration Great Rewards program - exclusive access to discounts and cashback rewards at your favourite stores Bathrooms & More program - great discounts on a wide range of our productsCommunity Service Leave As well as other great benefits like discounted health insurance, financial advice, annual flu vaccinations, access to a range of online fitness programs via our Wellbeing Centre...and much more! Interested?Come join us and work with great people, great brands and a business with a history of strong growth. All you need to do is hit the apply button and be part of a company that is focused on delivering great customer experiences!  For more information please contact Emily Jaajaa, Talent Acquisition Specialist at ejaajaa@gwagroup.comGWA Group does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, colour, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.You must be a citizen or permanent resident, or hold all the relevant employment visas and other approvals for the location of this position to apply for this role.Please note that we are not accepting applications from agencies at this time.

Name: Network Engineer
Description:
Could this be one of those rare moments to do the best work of your career? At Tabcorp, our story continues to evolve every day. It’s an exciting moment in our history - a new era of Tabcorp. We’re raising the game by creating the most engaging betting and entertainment experiences, and to lead in integrity.
We’re here to create excitement everywhere – through our incredible people, unrivalled experiences and strong relationships. We're bringing industry leading products and services to our customers and breaking into new horizons.
Game to join us? 
What you’ll do
You will deliver a pivotal capability for critical infrastructure services across the network environment and be proactive in delivering quality infrastructure and maintaining a highly available and secure network and communication environment to maximise service availability.
Reporting to the Network & Communications Team Lead, you will be jointly responsible for the development of the Tabcorp network environments and accountable for delivering Infrastructure and operational services that underpin the entire Tabcorp business and provide seamless services to Tabcorp’s extensive business network and collectively excel at delivering amazing products, services and experiences that exceed customer expectations.
What you’ll bring

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or equivalent qualification.
Experience in the implementation and support of enterprise scale WAN and unified communications environments.
Extensive knowledge of IT Infrastructure, LAN and WAN Services, firewall/security, VoIP and VPN systems.
Experience in Layer 2 and Layer 3 technologies and related protocols such as TCP/IP, DNS, FTP, HTTP/S, SSH, Telnet, SNMP, VOIP protocols i.e. SIP and H323.
Experience in maintaining and supporting mission critical 24*7/365 services.
Experience with Avaya CM, SM and CMS, MS Lync/Skype4 Business, Linux, Asterisk, FrontRange IPCM 5.8, NICE Recording, Numonix Recording, Cisco VGW, CUCME, Audiocodes Gateways and Session Border Controllers, Polycom IP Phones, Skype For Business Room Systems (nice to have).
Advising on a diverse set of technical issues.
Experience working with Microsoft Azure/ AWS environment.
Experience with Queuing - Marking, queuing, shaping and policing, specific router and switch commands to analyse and troubleshoot quality of service related issues.
Experience working with a variety of supplier / resource models, including matrix, managed services, and multiple suppliers.
Understanding of the cybersecurity, risk, and compliance requirements in an ICT context.

What you’ll get
Not only will receive an awesome candidate experience from our caring Talent team, the perks of working with us are pretty good too!
The list is expensive but here are a few:

A “say yes” approach to flexible working to meet your individual needs
A multitude of leave types such as cultural leave, volunteer leave and 18 weeks’ parental leave for all new parents, regardless of gender
We’re committed to Inclusion & Diversity with a range of initiatives such as our annual Inclusion Month celebrations and our Gender Affirmation Statement of Support
We’re proud to have been named an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the federal government’s Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) for the seventh consecutive year
We offer a comprehensive (and free) health and wellbeing app called The Arena to support you and your family’s mental and physical health
We’re committed to your learning and development with a dedicated platform with helpful resources from leadership to technology to upskill and cross train

About Tabcorp
We’re Australia’s leading gambling entertainment company. Together, we build on our 100+ year heritage by delivering Excitement with Integrity, every day. Each one of us is here to put our customers at the heart of everything we do by creating moments that engage, surprise and thrill.?
Our 3,000+ strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive homegrown world-class?brands;?TAB, Sky Racing and MAX. As an ASX listed company, we’re proud to shape our industry for the better. Because together, anything’s possible.?
Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au [link removed]. 
COVID
Tabcorp is closely monitoring Department of Health guidelines to ensure we continue to provide a safe working environment. You may be required to present evidence of Covid vaccination in order to comply with Public Health directions and fulfil the requirements of this role.
This role can be based in Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane.

Name: OCR Analyst & Cloud Data Engineer | Manager
Description: With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!) What will you create? You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems. Consulting bring this to life by helping clients improve the way they operate, reduce costs, manage risks, leverage talent, or fundamentally change the way they do business. Your work here will help organisations of all shapes and sizes work smarter and grow faster.  As a Manager in our Risk Analytics team you will work within small fast paced teams to design, develop and deliver innovative solutions, using data and technology within the Financial Services industry for the nations biggest Banking and Insurance clients.Your impact will be seen by:Designing and delivering solutions leveraging OCR technologies and building data pipelines using cloud platforms (Azure, AWS)Ensuring these solutions are robust and secureCreating repeatable delivery pipelines and processes that reinforce CD/CI principlesA passion to lead and mentor other team members while building out our OCR capabilityAbility to learn and use new technologies quickly and effectively, whilst keeping up to date with current trends in Big Data and Cloud data servicesDelivering complex data-driven projects using agile methodology. About youYou are an experienced OCR analyst and cloud data engineer with a proven background deploying data pipelines in the cloud. Working within a small team you will be familiar with agile software development practices. You will have practical experience in creating applications using some of the following key tools and techniques:Experience using ABBYY Flexicapture (or other OCR tools) to perform document intelligence and classification is keyExperience in data analytics languages (e.g. Python, SQL, ElasticSearch)Experience in deploying ETL data pipelines using cloud and serverless componentsExperience with Dev Ops and setting up CI/CD pipelines (e.g. using Jenkins, Bamboo, GitHub, Azure DevOps) is a bonusSetting up cloud infrastructure for developers across dev and prod environments in AWS/Azure with appropriate roles and ensuring that systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threatsExperience with infrastructure-as-code and shell scriptingExperience in integrating with API endpoints Any prior consulting, Banking or Insurance experience is welcome alongside other risk specific business domains such as Fraud, Financial Crime or Regulatory Compliance.  You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to work with a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Consulting team drive a new capability focused on helping bring a technology and data driven solution to our clients business problems. Life at PwCOur culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also why we’re consistently named as one of Australia’s best workplaces. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together. We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us. We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.  PwC is committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people, as well as visitors to our offices and events.PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff, contractors, clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices, attend client sites, undertake work-related travel, or attend work-related events, subject to limited exemptions. For more information: https://www.pwc.com.au/about-us/notices/coronavirus.html

Name: Infrastructure Support Engineer
Description: EARN $65 - $80 ph ex GST | Negotiable Based on Experience Join an Innovative Organisation Servicing a Wide Range of Clients Rolling Contract 6 Months | Dynamic & Varied Role in Sydney    About The Company    Our client is a specialist in providing cloud and infrastructure design, deployment, and managed services. They have extensive experience in delivering complex projects and supporting many different organisations across a wide range of industries.  About The Opportunity  Reporting directly to the Executive Director some of your responsibilities will include:   Accept, manage and resolve support incidents to the conclusion Lead or assist with the design, implementation, and support of Infrastructure and Cloud solutions for clients Proactive monitoring and response to automated infrastructure monitoring and vendor incident alerts Participate in rotating after-hours/weekend support, maintenance, and monthly patching exercises as required Attend training, networking, or business development events as nominated by the company   About You   The successful candidate will have:   3+ years experience in a similar role Financial Services Industry experience Strong public cloud knowledge and skills including AWS/Azure compute, network connectivity, and security Active Directory / Group Policies Wintel/Linux server and administration experience Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (AWS Workspaces, Azure WVD, Citrix) Office 365 including MS Teams (support and migration) Infrastructure Monitoring   The following are also highly regarded:   Cybersecurity operations experience Disaster recovery design and testing DevOps/Infrastructure as code experience (Cloud Formation / Terraform) Identity Access Management and Governance experience SIEM / monitoring experience (Splunk, DataDog, New Relic)   What's in it for You?   Join an Innovative Organisation Servicing a Wide Range of Clients Enjoy Working From Home on Occasions | Dynamic & Varied Role Join a Friendly Hardworking & High Performing Team  Immediate Start Available for the Right Candidate   Apply today and don't miss out on starting this opportunity as soon as possible!     The Next Step of your Application (Please Read)  You will need to submit your resume, cover letter and answer some role-specific screening questions to be considered for this role. This is an opportunity to impress the employer and set your application apart from the rest! Please do not copy and paste your resume. Your application will be reviewed and we will contact you via email if you progress to the next stage.  Please take a look at our other vacancies here: https://recruitshop.applynow.net.au/

Name: Security Engineer - Operational Technology
Description: The Opportunity We have a new and unique opportunity for an Operational Technology Engineer to join our Security team. The purpose of this role is to continually improve the security posture of Veolia OT environments by improving our defence in-depth capabilities while complying with internal and industry security and risk mitigation frameworks.  What's On Offer  Attractive remuneration Exciting newly created role with opportunity to learn and grow Exciting project work involved   You'll Be Responsible For  Participate in application and infrastructure projects in the OT environment to continuously improve Veolia's security posture Work with operations teams to advocate secure IT/OT practices in performing audits and risk assessments and delivery of security initiatives Drive the incident response readiness in the OT environment while ensuring a tight alignment with the Veolia group and local incident response plans Implement baseline security configuration standards for operating systems (e.g., OS hardening), network segmentation, and identity and access management (IAM) Ensure a complete, accurate and valid inventory of all systems, OT/IT infrastructure and applications that should be logged by the security information and event management (SIEM) or log management tool Deliver security and infrastructure projects and maintenance within operational facilities   What You'll Need To Be Successful  7+ Years of IT/OT experience working in industrial environments Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or equivalent experience Direct, hands-on experience and strong working knowledge of Operational Technology environments, including IT infrastructure, SCADA and engineering software, OT Networks, PLC's, and ICS equipment to device level to deliver operational outcomes for critical infrastructure. Direct, hands-on experience with security infrastructure — e.g., firewalls, intrusion prevention systems (IPSs), web content filtering, IAM technologies, endpoint protection, detection and vulnerability management systems, incident investigation, SIEM and log management technology. Ability to work autonomously and communicate effectively with technical and operational staff as well as other internal and external stakeholders Ability to undertake some travel to work onsite and also effectively work remotely to support sites Experience with security frameworks, regulations and risk mitigation strategies e.g. IEC62443, ISO 27001/2, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, ASD E8, Critical infrastructure guidelines. Security and Technology certifications an advantage Experience with Auditing and Risk Management an advantage  A Veolia Career Veolia anz values employees and their health and wellbeing. All of our employees are entitled to:  Employee share plan where employees have the opportunity to purchase discounted Veolia shares  Employee Assistance Program (EAP) through Assure which covers mental health, nutrition,  financial, legal, coaching and career transition support Bupa health insurance discount  You will also have access to corporate discounts, Fitness Passport, as well as eligibility to volunteer at one of Veolia's partnered volunteer organisations  At Veolia we value diversity, equality and inclusion, we are committed to providing working environments where everyone is included and treated fairly and with respect. Veterans are encouraged to visit our Veterans at Veolia webpage to discover what we can offer: https://www.veolia.com/anz/veterans-veoliaWe encourage people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent and people from diverse backgrounds to apply.Our environmental solutions help customers preserve and renew our natural resources, creating a better future for our planet. Here, you'll have the opportunity to build your career, and a more sustainable world.

Name: ITSM Support Officer
Description: Company DescriptionAt Leidos, we deliver practical solutions to the Federal Government’s most complex IT engineering problems. And, as a Prime Systems Integrator, these are often on a scale and variety rarely seen by other organisations. Whether developing and supporting technology transformation projects for the Bureau of Meteorology, providing software applications for critical Defence missions, or improving the way the ATO supports its service delivery, our work has a direct impact on the lives of Australians, and will certainly impact on your career.Job DescriptionYour New RoleLeidos has been engaged by Defence to provide a leading cyber security capability for the environments that our deployed military personnel rely on. The team develops and delivers key cyber security services to directly support the Department’s mission. We are seeking highly motivated and appropriately experienced staff to help us deliver outstanding results. This role is an exciting opportunity to perform crucial high value work to support and protect our personnel in the Australian Defence Forces.Your new role is working as part of a small team to provide ITSM support for Incident, Problem and Knowledge management reporting to the Operations Manager. A key focus of this role will be working across multiple vendors to support and achieve outcomes as part of the Cross Functional Services capability.Key activities include:Managing aspects for Incident, Problems and Knowledge Management within Service Management Systems to achieve performance measures.Liaise with internal and external stakeholders, ensuring they receive appropriate communicationMonitor and manage progress against ITSM Performance MeasuresEnsuring all Incident and Problem records are maintained including accuracy and qualify of information that enables rapid resolutionContinuous improvement of Standard Operating Procedures (SOP’s), KBA and work instructions to facilitate the day to day running of the Service Management processesComplete incident Reports and attend working level forumsUtilising Service Manage Tools such as HP Service Manager, ServciceNow or equivalentQualificationsAbout You and What You'll BringAttributesExperience working as a Incident, Problem and Knowledge areas of an large scale  service desk environment;Ability to work in a team environment as well as autonomously in a professional environment;Ability to assist in the resolution of conflict;Strong customer service focus with the ability to empathise as well as prioritise;Proven ability to deliver a quality client service, under direction; andAbility to develop and maintain productive internal and external relationships, partnerships and networks.QualificationsITIL V3 Certification is required as a minimumICT Industry qualifications (e.g. CompTia, Microsoft) highly regarded but not essentialExperience working in a large scale Service Desk EnvironmentExperience using Enterprise Service Management Tools such as HP Service Manager, ServiceNow or equivalentAdditional InformationWhat You’ll Love At Leidos, you will be valued, included and supported. So if you are open-minded and keen to be the difference, we look forward to welcoming you.The successful candidate may need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements applicable to this role, and your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.This role does require the successful applicant to be an Australian Citizen and hold an NV-2 security clearance.

Name: Partner Customer Engineer, Security Specialist, Google Cloud
Description: At Google, we have a vision of empowerment and equitable opportunity for all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and commit to building reconciliation through Google’s technology, platforms and people and we welcome Indigenous applicants. Please see our Reconciliation Action Plan for more information.Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Sydney NSW, Australia; Melbourne VIC, Australia.Minimum qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.10 years of experience in security solutions for enterprise B2B software.Experience as a pre-sales solutions architect or specialist sales engineer in a security technology company.Preferred qualifications:Experience in technical selling with the personas of a Security Partner’s Customer (e.g., Security Analyst, SOC Analyst, Incident Management Specialist, Network Security Specialist etc.).Experience in creating solutions for advanced cloud native secure software supply chain, specifically container scanning, signing, static, and dynamic code analysis.Experience in creating solutions for Advanced Cybersecurity solutions such as XDR/EDR, SIEM, and/or SOAR.Experience in creating solutions for Advanced Network Security specifically ZTNA, SASE, and CASB products.About the jobWhen leading companies choose Google Cloud it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. Once educational institutions, government agencies, and other businesses sign on to use Google Cloud products, you come in to facilitate making their work more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You listen and deliver what is most helpful for the customer. You assist fellow sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products.In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring customers benefit from partner solutions complementing Google Cloud's capabilities. In this role, you will work with Solution Architects and Sales teams as a security subject matter expert for a partner solution to make Google Cloud useful to our customers. You will help prospective customers understand the power of the partner solution in conjunction with Google Cloud, explaining technical features, helping customers design architectures, and problem-solving any potential roadblocks.Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.ResponsibilitiesHelp the Google Field Sales and Cloud Architects team understand the “Core Value Proposition” for the security partner or solution.Help the Field Sales and Solution Architects identify the right personas and segments of customers for the security partner or solution.Help our security partners create solution plays, guides for the Field Sales team and the Solution Architects to help them pitch and architect the solution. Create artifacts that tell how to handle the technical sales life cycle for solutions offered by the partner.Operate systematically and at scale, working with a program management team to identify prospective existing and new accounts in the territory, organizing them by industry segment and creating applicability criteria of a given partner solution and an execution plan.Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Name: Systems Engineers (Hunter Class Frigate Program)
Description: Rohde & Schwarz Australia has signed a contract for the early design of an integrated communications system for the Royal Australian Navy Hunter Class Frigate Program.We are doubling our team in Australia and we can offer you training, exposure and  progression opportunities like no one else.We provide our engineers the opportunity to work across projects in Navy, Air Traffic Control, Air Defence, Land & Tactical Comms and Electronic Warfare.Whether you are a young engineer looking for exposure and progression ,an experienced veteran looking for an exciting project, or a contractor looking for steady engagement, we have the right opportunity for you.32 Professionals from the Defence Industry joined us in the last 8 months.Call our Head of Talent, Sachin Satish on 0439990450 to find out how we can catapult your career in the Systems Engineering space.About the business€2.34 billion (FY 2020-21) Global technology leader in the integrated communications space.Innovating for 40 years in Australia12,300 employees, 70 countriesCurrently expanding the Australian footprint, as we prepare to support and lead delivery of high profile projectsTechnology offerings –Military communications across all domainsWireless CommunicationsRF Test and Measurement,Broadcast and Media,Air Traffic ControlCybersecurity and Network Technology.About the roleReporting to the Engineering Manager, you will be working on different flagship systems engineering projects, doing a variety of tasks such as:Providing  engineering services across the entire system engineering life cycle including conception, defining the requirements, design, realisation, integration, verification, acceptance and support;Achieving engineering and project milestones within the project scheduleConducting system engineering activities in accordance with the Rohde & Schwarz systems engineering framework based upon ISO/IEEE standardsContributing to design reviews, workshops, integration, test and site installation activitiesWorking as part of a project or bid team to submit proposals for and of delivery mission-critical capabilityDelivering systems engineering services on time, within budget and to the highest quality expected by Rohde & Schwarz and our clientsLiaising with customers, end-users, subcontractors and suppliersSkills and experienceThe successful applicant will be a qualified Systems Engineer who has:Bachelor of Engineering qualifications in Electrical/Electronics or a relevant degree in Engineering, preferably majoring in Systems, Radio Frequency, Mechatronics, Electronics, Communications, or AerospaceProven experience in delivering system engineering projectsStructured approach to delivering projects;Australian Citizenship or PR, preferably with eligibility to hold an Australian NV1 security clearance.International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable, hence your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this roleBenefits & Perks Competitive salary package with an attractive bonus structureWe don't just dangle the carrot. We pay our bonuses generously. Employees got an average of 164% of their bonuses in the last 3 yearsSalary continuance insuranceTraining and development opportunities to keep your skills up-to-dateFlexible working hoursExceptional, high performance work culture with emphasis on collaboration and continuous improvement.APPLY NOWSend us your CV or contact our Head of Talent Management , Sachin Satish for a confidential conversation on 0439 990 450.
