Name: Senior Engineer
Description: About the OpportunityYou’ll have access to professional development and technical upskilling that is all about helping you thrive. You’ll work with inspiring people, join a culture driven to make a difference and develop your skills as you help us to solve important problems. With paid study leave, flexible working and other benefits, you’ll have the freedom to create a career that grows as you do.   What will you create? Using your skills in problem-solving, critical thinking and tech, you’ll help our clients define their strategy for managing and protecting data, and assess and implement information security management solutions. Our Cybersecurity & Digital Trust team works alongside government and business to solve the most complex cyber & digital risk problems facing Australia.  As a Senior Engineer in our Skilled Service Hub, your impact will be seen by:Testing and automation of technology controls, liaising with stakeholders, reviewing and completing assessment deliverablesAssisting organisations in the assessment of their supplier network, identifyin areas of concern and providing stakeholders with appropriate levels of assuranceIdentifying and managing privacy risks and compliance requirements, working across client organisations to exceed stakeholder expectationsSupervising and coaching junior team members, to foster an environment of continued growth and development within the team About youYou have a solid background or experience in any of the following:Data advisory and are skilled in leveraging principles, framework (EU GDPR, Australian Privacy Act, Californian CCPA) and tools to improve data governance and data management practices, and hold an understanding of how to assess and improve business processes.Information Security and are skilled in the review, development and/or implementation of security standards and frameworks (PSPF, ISM, DSPF, ISO 27001/2, PCI DSS, COBIT, ISO 31000, NIST) including the development of supporting artefacts (TRA, SRMP and SSP) that support ongoing systems accreditation activitiesAssisting organisations in the assessment of their supplier network, identifying areas of concern and providing stakeholders with appropriate levels of assuranceYou have a strong grasp of technical/business style writing and have the ability to train and mentor junior members.  As a bonus, you may hold Information Security qualifications and professional certifications such as CISSP, CISM, ISO27001 Lead Auditor, CIPM, DCAM, CIPP/E. You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients andstakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with. Life at PwC Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together. We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.  Next StepsWe’ll be assessing applications immediately and progressing candidates who meet the program eligibility criteria to digital interviews.The timing of this will depend on when you apply and complete this part of the recruitment process.Please note, all applications will be reviewed. PwC is committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people, as well as visitors to our offices and events.PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff, contractors, clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices, attend client sites, undertake work-related travel, or attend work-related events, subject to limited exemptions. For more information: https://www.pwc.com.au/about-us/notices/coronavirus.html

Name: Security Operations Centre Team Lead
Description: About the Role Seeking experienced Cyber Security and Network engineers with a passion for people, who can provide guidance to colleagues, interact with senior management on daily activities and take part in driving the success of a team. You will be responsible for a small but knowledgeable team either within networks or security, while having the technical expertise and background to provide advice to the business and help with the development of those around you. Key Criteria•Tertiary Degree in Cybersecurity or Computer Science•L7 qualified•Proven leadership and management skills •Solid knowledge of Cyber Security and/or complex Networks •Solution design orientated •Australian work rights and valid WA driver's license What's on Offer?•Non-salary benefits worth up to $20,000•3 days extra leave per annum•Manage a team of 4 •Well established business in the accessible CBD locationFor more information and a confidential discussion please contact Rachel Ward on 08 6467 0678 or click Apply now'. Our Client Our client is a large organisation with a strong commitment to local transportation, safety and community engagement. About UsTitan Recruitment has been delivering complete, innovative and effective recruitment solutions across Australia for over two decades and it recognised as a leading Engineering and Technology recruitment and contracting specialist. Our service delivery is underpinned by traditional values and an innovative approach to help clients, contractors and candidates achieve their goals. Find the latest engineering jobs and technology jobs at www.titanrecruitment.com.auTitan Recruitment is an advocate for Equal Employment Opportunity, and we encourage applications from all interested applicants.

Name: IT Field Technician
Description: About UnisysAt Unisys our mission is YOU.  We are a multi-billion-dollar global IT company known for providing multi-cloud solutions including cybersecurity, digital government, core and retail banking, and travel and transportation. We transform and manage our clients’ applications, data, networks and devices. Why you’ll love working for UNISYS?As a Field Service Technician, we will sponsor you to become a fully qualified engineer providing Laptop and PC hardware support to customers on behalf of our global alliance partners Dell and Lenovo.With us you will be rewarded with great work life balance supported by a collaborative, diverse and inclusive team. We provide you with training, upskilling and opportunities to continuously develop your technical skills and career. We have a competitive salary and car allowance component as part of the package. Key Responsibilities:You will be providing general laptop/tablet and desktop break-fix and in warranty repairs for Dell and Lenovo customers. Being field based you will visit a range of customers to support from individuals to corporate clients and education establishments. Your role will include configuration, installation, re-installing of software and re-imaging machines by following Unisys’ Dell and Lenovo administration processes.To be considered for the role you should have:Proven strong customer service focus, a can-do attitude and ability to build rapport with clientsClear communication style, written and verbalDemonstrated attention to detail, and ability to manage/follow processesDue to the nature of this role all successful candidates must hold an Australian driver’s license and have a reliable vehicleKnowledge of MS softwareValid work rights for AustraliaSome of our Employee Benefits:Flexible working arrangements Corporate discounts including varied insurance programsEducation reimbursement program available for multiple courses for career advancementWhat’s Next?Once we have reviewed your application, if successful you will be contacted by our Recruitment Partners (Hays Talent Solutions) for an initial chat to discuss this opportunity with you and answer any questions.Please note at Unisys we conduct background checks including police checks and working with children’s checks. Learn more about Unisys Careers at www.jobs.unisys.com/us/en

Name: IT Hardware Field Service Technician
Description: About UnisysAt Unisys our mission is YOU.  We are a multi-billion-dollar global IT company known for providing multi-cloud solutions including cybersecurity, digital government, core and retail banking, and travel and transportation. We transform and manage our clients’ applications, data, networks and devices. Why you’ll love working for UNISYS?As a Field Service Technician, we will sponsor you to become a fully qualified engineer providing Laptop and PC hardware support to customers on behalf of our global alliance partners Dell and Lenovo.With us you will be rewarded with great work life balance supported by a collaborative, diverse and inclusive team. We provide you with training, upskilling and opportunities to continuously develop your technical skills and career. By having a dedicated Flexible Workforce Community, we can consider full and part time hours, contract lengths short and long term, plus we have opportunities across Australia including regional areas should you like to move interstate now or in the future. We also consider you for permanent opportunities as and when they arise due to internal promotions and business growth.If you are new to the employment market or are seeking a change in career, and have a keen interest in PCs, knowledge of parts and how they work, with a strong desire to learn, we are open to discussing your options here at Unisys.Key Responsibilities:You will be providing general laptop/tablet and desktop break-fix and in warranty repairs for Dell and Lenovo customers. Being field based you will visit a range of customers to support from individuals to corporate clients and education establishments. Your role will include configuration, installation, re-installing of software and re-imaging machines by following Unisys’ Dell and Lenovo administration processes.You’ll be required to travel around surrounding regions. You will be paid per job that you complete along with great earning potential. To be considered for the role you should have:Proven strong customer service focus, a can-do attitude and ability to build rapport with clientsClear communication style, written and verbalDemonstrated attention to detail, and ability to manage/follow processesDue to the nature of this role all successful candidates must hold an Australian driver’s license and have a reliable vehicleKnowledge of MS softwareValid work rights for AustraliaWhat’s Next?Once we have reviewed your application, if successful you will be contacted by our Recruitment Partners (Hays Talent Solutions) for an initial chat to discuss this opportunity with you and answer any questions.Please note at Unisys we conduct background checks including police checks and working with children’s checks. Learn more about Unisys Careers at www.jobs.unisys.com/us/en

Name: Lecturer, Senior Lecturer or Associate Professor - Embedded Systems
Description: UTS has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion, including a focus on increasing gender equity in STEMM. We are recognised widely as supporting inclusivity and valuing diversity. Cited as a WGEA Employer of Choice since the inception of the award, we are now among the first Australian institutions to receive the Athena SWAN Bronze Accreditation for our commitment to action addressing gender equity in the STEMM disciplines.  UTS Equal Futures celebrates and supports women in academia through every stage of their career.UTS has been granted an exemption under section 126 of the Anti-Discrimination Act 1997 (NSW) (ADA) to conduct a targeted recruitment program for Women. For this role, only applications from female candidates will be considered.As part of Athena SWAN, UTS has set an overarching target of 40 per cent academic women in STEMM by 2022. The School of Electrical & Data Engineering is committed to UTS's target and supporting the career development of women academics. UTS Women in Engineering & IT program fosters a network of passionate females and males who are actively involved in the development of our next generation of young engineering and IT professionals.The School of Electrical & Data Engineering is recruiting for a Lecturer, Senior Lecturer or Associate Professor to play a key role in delivering teaching in Electronic Engineering, at both undergraduate and postgraduate level, with an embedded systems focus. The position will be based at the centrally located UTS Campus in Ultimo and will report directly to Head of School, Professor Eryk Dutkiewicz.The School of Electrical & Data Engineering is deeply engaged in research of national and international standing in many areas. Key areas include: wireless communications and networking, Internet of Things (IoT), applied electro-magnetics and antennas, electrical systems and power electronics, image processing, computer vision, machine learning, cybersecurity, big data analytics and big data systems, and RF IC design. Our School hosts three IEEE Fellows and 3 ARC DECRA grant holders and we conduct research funded by government agencies and national and international industry partner.About the role• Provide academic, research and professional leadership,• Develop and lead research and industry engagement activities,• Deliver teaching at both undergraduate and postgraduate level in embedded systems engineering, electronic engineering or related fields,• Supervision of PhD students.About you• Demonstrated track record of service at the School and Faculty levels• Knowledge of recent advances courses in embedded systems engineering, electronic engineering or related fields• A PhD degree in Electrical/Electronic Engineering or closely related disciplines• Experience and track record in research with demonstrated outcomes that include research publications, grants and research supervision in embedded systems engineering, electronic engineering or related fields Preference will be given to candidates with:• Entrepreneurial experience and industry networking.• Demonstrated leadership and reputation in Electrical and Electronic Engineering• Track record in successfully securing research fundingBase Salary Range: $110,378 to $177,292 pa (Level B - D)This role attracts 17% superannuation (pension) in addition to the base salary.UTS staff also benefit from a wide range of Employee Benefits include flexible work practices, child care centres, generous parental leave and salary packaging opportunities.This position is full-time and appointment will be made on a continuing basis.Our vision is to be a leading public university of technology recognised for our global impact. We are a dynamic and innovative university, ranked by the Times Higher Education as Australia's top young university, and located centrally in one of the world's most liveable cities. With a culturally diverse campus life and extensive international exchange and research programs, UTS prepares graduates for the workplaces of today and tomorrow.How To ApplyFor the full list of the selection criteria and role responsibilities please click the apply link and download the Position Statement from the UTS website. UTS is committed to diversity and inclusion in our workforce and we encourage applicants where relevant to include a relative to opportunity or career disruption/break statement within their CV.You are required to address the selection criteria in your submission in a separate document.   Only those applications submitted via the UTS online recruitment system will be accepted.  Current UTS employees should apply through their UTS Employee Self Service function. As you will be unable to save your application once started, please have all required documents and information available prior to commencing.Please ensure that the file name for each document submitted includes IRC222638 and your name.Specific enquiries or issues with your application may be directed to Pam Price in the UTS Recruitment Team at recruitment@uts.edu.au.Please be advised that as part of the selection process that you may be requested to deliver a presentation, the audience for which may include individuals not on the Selection Panel.Closing Date:  Thursday 14th July 2022 at 11.59pm (AEST)AccessibilityUTS Recruitment cares about digital accessibility. If there is any content in our advertising that you have struggled with, please make us aware so that we can make our information accessible to all.In addition, if you have a disability that requires adjustment to the recruitment process or an alternative application pathway please contact recruitment@uts.edu.au for assistance.UTS is recognised widely as supporting inclusivity and diversity through our Wingara Indigenous Employment Strategy, Social Impact Framework, and UTS Access and Inclusion Plan.We welcome applications from women, Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those who identify as LGBTIQ, and applicants from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

Name: Information Security Consultant
Description: This role supports Vital Advisory in the delivery of consulting and advisory services to our clients. The role has scope for you to further develop your knowledge and experience to create practical solutions to meet our clients’ security, risk and governance needs. Your client-related work may include:Designing, developing, implementing, and operating Information Security Management Systems and/or Privacy Information Management SystemsAssessing and developing security capabilitiesPerforming business, threat and technical risk assessmentsDeveloping pragmatic documentation such as security and/or privacy policies, standards and other guidanceDelivering presentations, workshops, management meetings and other events Undertaking third party and other security assessments Performing controls assessment activities, such as controls self-assessments, assurance testing, and auditsIn addition to delivering services to our customers, other key requirements of this role are:Business acumen and understanding of business context and drivers for security and controlEnsuring timely and high-quality delivery of services to customersMaintaining a high level of professional ethical standardsA commitment to ongoing learning for personal and professional developmentA commitment to collaboration within the team and with our clientsAbility to coach and manage other staff, as requiredThe key knowledge areas for this role are:Knowledge of information security and related frameworks (such as ISO27001, ISO27701, NIST CSF, CPS234, PCI-DSS, SOC2/trust service criteria)Knowledge of risk and governance frameworks (such as COBIT5, ISO31000)Knowledge of Information Technology concepts, techniques, approaches, architectures, etc. Soft skills are also important in this role and include:Ability to work as part of a team as well as independently Initiative and commitment to continual improvementFlexibility with scheduling and work allocationAnalytical ability to break down problems into constituent parts to develop solutionsEffective communication skills and expertise, such as in translating technical jargon into business languageProven ability to analyse, assess and/or audit an IT environment to recommendations and improvementsQualifications and Certifications:We see qualifications and certifications as a demonstration of both your expertise and your commitment to the profession. For this role you may have:Certified Information Security Manager certification (CISM)ISO27001 Lead ImplementerISO27001 Lead AuditorCertified in Risks and Information Systems Control (CRISC)Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)Certified Data Privacy Security Engineer (CDPSE)Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)A bachelor's degree in computer science, cyber-security or a related fieldRelevant experience should include:Over five years' experience in information security, IT, privacy, audit and/or risk preferredSolid understanding of information security Sound project management and communication skillsGood knowledge of data protection and privacy regulationsUse of technology such as Confluence, JIRA, Monday.com, ClickUp, and SharepointThis role is based in Sydney. It gives you the flexibility to work from home.To apply, please send your resume to Vaishali Shah on vaishali.shah@vitaladvisory.com

Name: IT Field Technician
Description: To be eligible for this position, you must be an Australian citizen to obtain security clearance.We are a global information technology company that builds high-performance, security-centric solutions that can help change the world. Enhancing people’s lives through secure, reliable advanced technology is our vision.At Unisys, we believe in better!  Here, you have the opportunity to learn new skills, apply your expertise, and solve complex problems with cutting-edge technologies and solutions. You are part of a globally diverse team that supports you, drives change, and delivers successful results consistently.Our associates are at the forefront of everything we do, driving our clients’ successes while giving back to communities and making this world a safer and more secure place to live and work.  Our success is a direct result of the work of our people who live and breathe our Core Beliefs. Simply put, we believe in better lives.  Join us!You will Bring:Our preferred candidate must have previous experience in a similar role, with a very high-level technical proficiency with enterprise products. The candidate must have knowledge of MS software/configuration/ installation, and an understanding of raid technologies/server architecture and networking protocols.Responsibilities:Provides support for software, hardware, and networking support for desktops, laptops, and serversProvides maintenance and support on legacy productsSupports Core, server productsInstalls and maintains PCs and associated software, networks, servers, and peripheralsSupports network products from operational and maintenance perspectivesPerforms installs, moves, adds, and changes as requiredTests and certifies PCs, networks, servers, and client approved applicationsProvides follow-up on problems or escalation.Maintains a high degree of professionalism in actions, demeanor, and dress.Ensures customer satisfaction throughout the service delivery transaction.Ensures client-specific Service Level Agreements are met and incident and request tickets are updated accordingly within the ticketing systemYou will be successful in this role if you have:Strong focus on providing great customer service, with excellent verbal communication skills (essential)Problem solving abilities, an analytical mindset, and solutions focused (essential)For entry level candidates keen to develop an IT profession, you must be able to demonstrate and articulate your interest in this role and IT as an industry (essential)Troubleshooting software and hardware problems (advantageous)Ability to test and certify laptops, networks, servers, and client /Unisys approved software applications and associated peripherals (advantageous)Knowledge of client-specific internal procedures and service delivery requirements (advantageous)ABOUT UNISYSAt Unisys our mission is YOU.  We are a multi-billion-dollar global IT company known for providing multi-cloud solutions including cybersecurity, digital government, core, and retail banking, and travel and transportation. We transform and manage our clients’ applications, data, networks, and devices. We invest in training and developing candidates with a strong customer service focus and genuine interest in a career within the IT field.With us, you will be rewarded with a great work-life balance supported by a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive team. We provide you with training, upskilling, and opportunities to continuously develop your technical skills and career.Learn more about Unisys Careers at www.jobs.unisys.com/us/en

Name: Women in Engineering round - A/Prof-Snr Lecturer-Lecturer Cyber Security
Description:
Women in Engineering round at UNSW Canberra!
The School of Engineering and Information Technology (SEIT) is running a Women in Engineering round for a position in Cyber Security. SEIT is committed to building a diverse team and is passionate about hiring and supporting women in Engineering. We are committed to providing career progression and support to women in academia. UNSW Canberra currently has many women in influential positions within the Campus, in the following roles, to name just a few: 

Rector - Emma SparksEmma is a Senior Fellow of the Higher Education Academy and, in 2018, was awarded Top 50 Women in Engineering (Telegraph awards).
Deputy Faculty Executive Director
Head of School of Business
Associate Dean

This initiative was started to greater diversify SEIT and UNSW Canberra. At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.
The School of Engineering and Information Technology (SEIT) at UNSW Canberra is an innovative community of students, educators, and researchers committed to building a healthier, more sustainable future. From cybersecurity and software engineering to sustainable infrastructure and space technologies, our mission is to foster the next generation of technology decision-makers that will shape Australia’s defence and security future.
UNSW Canberra is a campus of the University of New South Wales, located at the Australian Defence Force Academy in Canberra. UNSW Canberra endeavours to offer staff a rewarding experience and offers many opportunities and attractive benefits, including:

Commitment to career progression
Strong commitment to work life and family balance
Relocation funding available
Full time 35hrs and flexible working arrangements available
Competitive salary and superannuation
Generous Leave entitlements
One of Australia’s leading research and teaching universities
Strong commitment to staff development and learning

SEIT is seeking applications for a full-time position in Cyber Security. This role will contribute to course and program delivery, development and innovation, in a team-teaching environment. It will also increase and expand the research and knowledge exchange profiles of SEIT to complement SEIT’s existing strengths. The position will work with the UNSW Cyber Institute in conducting impactful multidisciplinary research and educating the next generation of Australian leaders and scholars in this important and growing field.
The successful applicant will become a part of a community of people seeking to enhance research, teaching and engagement within the School, University and globally. The successful applicant may develop a research focused, education focused, or balanced workload.
The School offers a flexible, friendly working environment that is well-resourced. It delivers research-informed education to undergraduate and graduate students and professionals who will be Australia’s future technology decision-makers. The School’s engineering and computing education programs are accredited and globally recognised.
The engineering workplace of the future will be different from that of the past, and that future will require a broader range of people for success. The SEIT community is committed to changing the culture of engineering education by developing a more well-rounded engineer equipped with the emotional intelligence to perform in the 21st century. Creation of a new type of learning environment requires a different range of staff that can support deep technical learning, while helping to develop the whole engineer. We seek committed educators and researchers who have the knowledge, teaching skills, and empathy to strengthen that environment.
The School’s research strengths blend with its teaching disciplines to create a tightly woven environment of research-informed education. The School hosts the concentrated activities of UNSW Canberra Space, UNSW Institute for cyber, and the UNSW Capability Systems Centre which highlight the aspiration of the School and UNSW Canberra in multidisciplinary, world-leading research and teaching.
UNSW provides a range of academic workload profiles which range from education focused to research focused and includes the traditional balanced academic. The successful applicant will be expected to develop an educational profile that incorporates classroom and on-line teaching, research and research training, social engagement and global impact, and contribution to the development of the holistic environment in the School. We want our academics to choose the range of activities that support the School’s research and teaching missions and fulfil the ambitions of the academics themselves.
We strongly encourage applications from those with traditional academic backgrounds, but we equally encourage applications from those outside academia, who bring other discipline related experiences.
About the Role
Role:         Lecturer/Senior Lecturer/Associate Professor in Cyber Security
Campaign: Women in Engineering 
Salary: 

Academic Level B - $111,563 – $131,517 (pro-rata) + 17% Superannuation
Academic Level C - $135,504 – $155,460 (pro-rata) + 17% Superannuation
Academic Level D - $162,111 - $178,068 (pro-rata) + 17% Superannuation

Term:          Fixed Term Appointment 5 years
Position:     Position available between the levels of B – D
Grants available: UNSW Canberra Recruitment Research proposal information 
In your application, please upload a 2-page pitch addressing how your skills and experience in research and teaching align with the skills and experience outlined in the Position Description
Eligibility: 
The successful candidate will be required to undertake pre-employment checks prior to commencement in this role. The checks that will be undertaken are listed in the Position Description. You will not be required to provide any further documentation or information regarding the checks until directly requested by UNSW.
The position is located in Canberra, ACT. The successful candidate will be required to work from the UNSW Canberra campus. To be successful you will hold Australian Working Rights or Australian Citizenship. Visa sponsorship is not available for this appointment
This position is open to Women applicants only. UNSW is permitted to designate and recruit women to a number of STEM academic roles at UNSW Canberra as a ‘measure intended to achieve equality’ within the meaning of section 27 of the Discrimination Act 1991 (ACT).
For further information about UNSW Canberra, please visit our website: UNSW Canberra
Contact:
A/Prof Ben TurnbullE: Benjamin.Turnbull@unsw.edu.au
  Applications Close: Sunday, 3 July 2022, 11:30pm AEST
 
Find out more about working at UNSW Canberra
Find out more about living in Canberra
At UNSW Canberra, we celebrate diversity and understand the benefits that inclusion brings to the university. We aim to ensure that our culture, policies, and processes are truly inclusive. We are committed to developing and maintaining a workplace where everyone is valued and respected for who they are and supported in achieving their professional goals. We welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, Women at all levels, Culturally and Linguistically Diverse People, People with Disability, LGBTIQ+ People, people with family and caring responsibilities and people at all stages of their careers. We encourage everyone who meets the selection criteria and shares our commitment to inclusion to apply.
       Any questions about the application process - please email unswcanberra.recruitment@adfa.edu.au

The position is located in Canberra, ACT. The successful candidate will be required to work from the UNSW Canberra campus. To be successful you will hold Australian Working Rights or Australian Citizenship. Visa sponsorship is not available for this appointment
This position is open to Women applicants only. UNSW is permitted to designate and recruit women to a number of STEM academic roles at UNSW Canberra as a ‘measure intended to achieve equality’ within the meaning of section 27 of the Discrimination Act 1991 (ACT).

Name: Women in Engineering round - A/Prof-Snr Lecturer-Lecturer Cyber Security
Description:
Women in Engineering round at UNSW Canberra!
The School of Engineering and Information Technology (SEIT) is running a Women in Engineering round for a position in Cyber Security. SEIT is committed to building a diverse team and is passionate about hiring and supporting women in Engineering. We are committed to providing career progression and support to women in academia. UNSW Canberra currently has many women in influential positions within the Campus, in the following roles, to name just a few: 

Rector - Emma SparksEmma is a Senior Fellow of the Higher Education Academy and, in 2018, was awarded Top 50 Women in Engineering (Telegraph awards).
Deputy Faculty Executive Director
Head of School of Business
Associate Dean

This initiative was started to greater diversify SEIT and UNSW Canberra. At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.
The School of Engineering and Information Technology (SEIT) at UNSW Canberra is an innovative community of students, educators, and researchers committed to building a healthier, more sustainable future. From cybersecurity and software engineering to sustainable infrastructure and space technologies, our mission is to foster the next generation of technology decision-makers that will shape Australia’s defence and security future.
UNSW Canberra is a campus of the University of New South Wales, located at the Australian Defence Force Academy in Canberra. UNSW Canberra endeavours to offer staff a rewarding experience and offers many opportunities and attractive benefits, including:

Commitment to career progression
Strong commitment to work life and family balance
Relocation funding available
Full time 35hrs and flexible working arrangements available
Competitive salary and superannuation
Generous Leave entitlements
One of Australia’s leading research and teaching universities
Strong commitment to staff development and learning

SEIT is seeking applications for a full-time position in Cyber Security. This role will contribute to course and program delivery, development and innovation, in a team-teaching environment. It will also increase and expand the research and knowledge exchange profiles of SEIT to complement SEIT’s existing strengths. The position will work with the UNSW Cyber Institute in conducting impactful multidisciplinary research and educating the next generation of Australian leaders and scholars in this important and growing field.
The successful applicant will become a part of a community of people seeking to enhance research, teaching and engagement within the School, University and globally. The successful applicant may develop a research focused, education focused, or balanced workload.
The School offers a flexible, friendly working environment that is well-resourced. It delivers research-informed education to undergraduate and graduate students and professionals who will be Australia’s future technology decision-makers. The School’s engineering and computing education programs are accredited and globally recognised.
The engineering workplace of the future will be different from that of the past, and that future will require a broader range of people for success. The SEIT community is committed to changing the culture of engineering education by developing a more well-rounded engineer equipped with the emotional intelligence to perform in the 21st century. Creation of a new type of learning environment requires a different range of staff that can support deep technical learning, while helping to develop the whole engineer. We seek committed educators and researchers who have the knowledge, teaching skills, and empathy to strengthen that environment.
The School’s research strengths blend with its teaching disciplines to create a tightly woven environment of research-informed education. The School hosts the concentrated activities of UNSW Canberra Space, UNSW Institute for cyber, and the UNSW Capability Systems Centre which highlight the aspiration of the School and UNSW Canberra in multidisciplinary, world-leading research and teaching.
UNSW provides a range of academic workload profiles which range from education focused to research focused and includes the traditional balanced academic. The successful applicant will be expected to develop an educational profile that incorporates classroom and on-line teaching, research and research training, social engagement and global impact, and contribution to the development of the holistic environment in the School. We want our academics to choose the range of activities that support the School’s research and teaching missions and fulfil the ambitions of the academics themselves.
We strongly encourage applications from those with traditional academic backgrounds, but we equally encourage applications from those outside academia, who bring other discipline related experiences.
About the Role
Role:         Lecturer/Senior Lecturer/Associate Professor in Cyber Security
Campaign: Women in Engineering 
Salary: 

Academic Level B - $111,563 – $131,517 (pro-rata) + 17% Superannuation
Academic Level C - $135,504 – $155,460 (pro-rata) + 17% Superannuation
Academic Level D - $162,111 - $178,068 (pro-rata) + 17% Superannuation

Term:          Fixed Term Appointment 5 years
Position:     Position available between the levels of B – D
Grants available: UNSW Canberra Recruitment Research proposal information 
In your application, please upload a 2-page pitch addressing how your skills and experience in research and teaching align with the skills and experience outlined in the Position Description
Eligibility: 
The successful candidate will be required to undertake pre-employment checks prior to commencement in this role. The checks that will be undertaken are listed in the Position Description. You will not be required to provide any further documentation or information regarding the checks until directly requested by UNSW.
The position is located in Canberra, ACT. The successful candidate will be required to work from the UNSW Canberra campus. To be successful you will hold Australian Working Rights or Australian Citizenship. Visa sponsorship is not available for this appointment
This position is open to Women applicants only. UNSW is permitted to designate and recruit women to a number of STEM academic roles at UNSW Canberra as a ‘measure intended to achieve equality’ within the meaning of section 27 of the Discrimination Act 1991 (ACT).
For further information about UNSW Canberra, please visit our website: UNSW Canberra

Name: Agile QA Manager
Description: Trend Micro, a global cybersecurity leader, helps make the world safe for exchanging digital information. Fuelled by decades of security expertise, global threat research, and continuous innovation, Trend Micro's cybersecurity platform protects hundreds of thousands of organisations and millions of individuals across clouds, networks, devices, and endpoints. As a leader in cloud and enterprise cybersecurity, the platform delivers a powerful range of advanced threat defence techniques optimised for environments like AWS, Microsoft, and Google, and central visibility for better, faster detection and response. With 7,000 employees across 65 countries, Trend Micro enables organisations to simplify and secure their connected world.By joining our team of passionate industry experts, you have the opportunity to become a trailblazer and shape the cybersecurity landscape. For additional information, visit www.trendmicro.com. Position Overview:The Agile QA Manager is responsible for…Manage multiple workstreams and coaching the Manual QA Team (managing test tickets, deployments, hotfixes, Amazon Elastic Search updates, API testing, and testing new features such as Cloud One integration, Template Security, Cloud One custom roles, etc)Manage the Automation QA Team (automating Public API, work on operations tickets, etc).Coordinate with developers and technical leads to enable technical knowledge transfer to the QA teamInvestigate customer raised issuesLead and support the teams as they transition from waterfall to agile QAAdvise and coach teams on how to build, deploy, and test infrastructure components on AWSLead the expansion of testing as a service for agileReduce the burden of manual testing and seek to improve QA KPIs as a combined manual and automated solutionImprove quality and velocity of engineering through integrated and efficient automated testingKnow how to solve common testing problems related to AWSContribution to improving CICD processesCommitment to quality, automation, securityWork with QA, developers and test engineers to improve test and release processesRemain current with market developments and recommend new test automation technologies Basic QualificationsSkills:Have a highly analytical mind that critically evaluates problems and solutions, as well as tools and technologies to assist in delivering engineering and operational goals expediently and cost effectively.Must be comfortable working independently, within a team, and seek to foster a culture of inclusion and constructive communication.Proactive and self-directed, identifying issues and opportunities ahead of time.Most of the automated tests run on serverless infrastructure and include end-to-end, unit tests, and smoke tests. So a knowledge of this would be importantExtensive experience working with AWS InfrastructurePreferred QualificationsUniversity degree is highly regardedAgile certificationAWS certification is a plusDevelopment experience, especially with JavaScriptBenefits of being a Trender!At Trend Micro, our people and culture are our power. There are no barriers – you are empowered to discover your passion and be the best part of yourself.We encourage you to challenge the status quo, break assumptions, and learn and grow every step of your career, fulfilling your potential.Helping customers succeed is our top priority. We believe in doing the right thing, solving the right problems, and maintaining business sustainability. And our efforts to make a difference go beyond the digital world.Trenders have the opportunity to be good global citizens by building houses in the Philippines, donating money to help underprivileged communities, educating kids and parents on online safety, advancing a diverse workforce (Close the Gap™ program), and more.We take employee wellbeing seriously. At Trend, you will have access to Medical Insurance, Mental Health Support through access to EAP, Yoga and Meditation sessions, Gym reimbursements, Paid Parental Leave etc. At Trend Micro, we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion. We believe that our people are our greatest asset and we understand the importance of bringing diverse perspectives, approaches, and experiences to our team. We are committed to building and supporting an inclusive workforce that truly reflects our global business and encourages people from all backgrounds to apply. We embrace change, empower people, and encourage innovation. Join Trend Micro and Thrive with us.We embrace change, empower people, and encourage innovation. Join Trend Micro and Thrive with us.

Name: Service Solutions Specialist
Description: At Honeywell, we make a lot of incredible things. But most meaningfully, we make the future, and are looking for people to join our global team of future shapers. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our performance culture comprised of diverse leaders, thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who are changing the future. Our people are committed to each other and to the realisation of our vision through their unique job functions. Our businesses embrace the challenges of innovation so that we define the future. And our global opportunities are endless for you to grow and get recognised for your passion to perform.Honeywell Building Technologies (HBT) is a $5+ billion strategic business group of Honeywell and is a leading global manufacturer of Security, Fire, Intrusion, Access Control, HVAC and Building Automation solutions. We have a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Service Solutions Specialist for our Honeywell Building Solutions team in Abbotsford, VIC.  Your primarily purpose will be in the design, engineering, configuration, implementation, commissioning and ongoing support/maintenance and upgrades of all Operational Technology (OT), Enterprise Applications and Connected Services delivered into the service Line of Business (LOB).Key Responsibilities:Ensure adherence to the centralisation and standardisation of OT, ICT and Cybersecurity implementation and services to promote, deliver and maintain more connected, operational critical solutions to our customers, ensuring alignment and consistency with global standards and guidelines.Drive alignment and standardisation of the installation, upgrades and support maintenance of the OT, Enterprise Applications and Connected Services that regularly form part of Honeywell’s solutions.Streamline delivery by utilising digital deployment tools and centralised deployment standards. Build productive customer relationships, developing sponsors for Honeywell, and continually seek and capitalise upon opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships.Provide strategic input and guidance around growth of existing customer and identifying and securing new customer portfolios.Work cooperatively and provide technical direction in a team environment.Contribute to the development of project plans, schedules, and design/configuration documentation.Key Experience and Capabilities:Proven track record in a project engineering capacity involved in the design and delivery of technology based design and construct projects.Strong understanding of Honeywell’s OT, Enterprise Applications and Connected Services (EBI, DVM, Energy Manager, Forge, OBS, Pulse, Vector etc.).Strong understanding of industry standard communications protocols (BACnet, Modbus, OPC, SNMP, API).Knowledge of ICT/Cybersecurity fundamentals.Intermediate to Advanced computer skills.Demonstrated experience in organising and directing work activities according to priorities, and to meet deadlines involving multiple systems projects and vendors.Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics Engineering.About UsThe world is changing. And it’s a familiar story at Honeywell. Our $36 billion business was founded on a legacy of firsts spanning 130 years. We’re building a safer, smarter, and more balanced world through our technology and software across each of our 930 sites globally. Our impact is seen in every shape and size around the world. Our solutions are felt daily in aerospace, buildings and cities, retail, chemicals and materials, safety, industrial and manufacturing, safety, and supply chains.Discover MoreWe’ve been innovating for more than 100 years and now we’re creating what’s next. There’s a lot more available for you to discover. Our solutions, our case studies, our #futureshapers, and so much more. Learn more at careers.honeywell.com/us/en/careers.honeywell.com/honeywell-pacificIf you believe what happens tomorrow is determined by what we do today, you’ll love working at Honeywell!The future is what we make it. So join us and let’s do this together.Honeywell is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we support a diverse workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.Finalist 2019 AHRI awards – Best workplace diversity and inclusion programCopyright © 2020 Honeywell International Inc You may also redirect your applications to Arianne Alladin through arianne.alladin@honeywell.com

Name: QRISCloud Systems Administrator
Description: Research Computing CentreHEW 6Fixed-term position for initial 1 year termClosing date: Wednesday 20 July 2022 at 11.00pm AEST (R-13229) About This Opportunity This position will contribute to the ongoing administration, support, operations, engineering, innovation and development of solutions and research enabling technologies to facilitate Queensland Cyber Infrastructure Foundations (QCIF) mission to support its University Members' researchers in the use of research computing infrastructure and services. You will assist with automation, scripting, infrastructural support and administration.  The position will be hosted by UQ's Research Computing Centre and seconded to the Queensland Cyber Infrastructure Foundation.  Key responsibilities will include:All aspects of systems planning, deployment, development, support, performance engineering, and administration.Development may enable, support and sustain research computing, research storage and cloud operations.Mid-level project management functions for large deployments, capital works and infrastructure upgrades and migrations, where required.Automation of deployment, patching, monitoring and platform security via frameworks such as Puppet, Ansible, MASS and others.Management and administration of QRIScloud's computing and storage resources, including OpenStack federated cloud compute infrastructure and petabyte-scale volume and object-based storage systems.Assist and/or lead in deploying, monitoring, and troubleshooting cloud infrastructure and services.Writing and/or modifying system scripts as required.Deploying and optimising client virtual machine instances and applications.Administration of several UNIX/Linux based operating systems (Linux: SuSE, CentOS/RHEL, Ubuntu) and Microsoft Windows platforms (e.g., Windows Server 2019+).Plan, deploy, implement, and continually review security posture, capability and implementation to ensure applications and platforms adhere to best practices and are in line with Information Security Policy and Guidelines.This role is subject to The University's Code of Conduct.  About You  Essential:An undergraduate bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Information Technology with a major in information systems, software engineering or a related discipline is required to undertake this role with at least four (4) years of subsequent experience.Knowledge and experience in the use of cloud computing and virtualisation technologiesKnowledge and experience with the OpenStack projects, particularly Nova, Cinder, Glance, Swift, and Neutron.Knowledge and experience with KVM hypervisors.A functional understanding of networking technologies and protocols (Ethernet, TCP, software-defined networks)Good knowledge of cybersecurity fundamentals.A solid practical and functional understanding of systems administration principles ranging from Linux administration through to advanced topics such as security hardening, kernel tuning and optimisation of the operating system environment variables.Skills in project management methods, such as Agile.Practical skills in software engineering and programming languages (Python, Perl, C, Go, bash, etc.).Demonstrated experience in effective programming and scripting in a systems administration environment, including experience in automating systems administration tasks DesirableKnowledge and experience with ancillary OpenStack projects, including Barbican, Aardvark, Blazar, and CyborgExperience with GPU virtualisationUnderstanding of Windows Server administrationSome knowledge in areas such as grid computing, middleware, databases, web technologies, and client-server computingDemonstrated experience supporting academic researchExperience with Hierarchical Storage ManagementExperience with GPFS file systemsUnderstanding of computational schedulers such as PBS, SLURM, Torque etc. What We Can Offer This is a full-time, fixed-term position for 12 months at HEW Level 6. The position has the potential to be renewed and extended on an annual basis.  The full-time equivalent base salary will be in the range $82,399- $88,503 plus super of up to 17%. The total FTE package will be in the range $96,407 - $103,549 per annum.  The following flexible employment options may be available for this role: some working from home; variable start or finish times; purchased leave; flex-time.   For further information about UQ's benefits, please visit Why Work at UQ and review The University of Queensland's Enterprise Bargaining Agreement 2018 - 2021. Questions? To discuss this role please contact Stephen Bird at s.bird@uq.edu.au  For application queries, please contact recruitment@uq.edu.au stating the job reference number in the subject line.  Want to Apply? All applicants must upload the following documents in order for your application to be considered:Cover letter addressing the 'About You' sectionResumePlease note that you will be asked to add all documents into the one upload box during the application form.  About The Selection Process To satisfy pre-requisite questions and ensure your application can be considered in full, all candidates must apply via the UQ Careers portal by the job closing deadline or will not be accepted. Other Information Work Rights: You must have unrestricted work rights in Australia for the duration of this appointment to apply. Visa sponsorship is not available for this appointment.  We value diversity and inclusion, and actively encourage applications from those who bring diversity to the University. Our Diversity and Inclusion webpage contains further information if you require additional support. Accessibility requirements and/or adjustments can be directed to recruitment@uq.edu.au.  If you are a current employee of the University, or hold an unpaid or affiliate appointment with the University, please login to your staff Workday account and visit the internal careers board to apply for this opportunity. Please do NOT apply via the external job board.

Name: Associate Professor/Professor, Renewable Energy
Description: At UTS the concepts of equity and social justice are key to our core and purpose. We are recognised widely as supporting inclusivity and valuing diversity. We are among the first Australian institutions to receive the Athena SWAN Bronze Accreditation for our commitment to action addressing gender equity in the STEMM disciplines. UTS Equal Futures celebrates and supports women in academia through every stage of their career.As part of Athena SWAN, UTS has set an overarching target of 40 per cent academic women in STEMM by 2022. The School of Electrical & Data Engineering is committed to UTS's target and supporting the career development of women academics. UTS Women in Engineering & IT program fosters a network of passionate females and males who are actively involved in the development of our next generation of young engineering and IT professionals.   The School of Electrical & Data Engineering is recruiting an Associate Professor or a Professor to provide academic, research and professional leadership, and to develop and lead research and industry engagement activities, as well as deliver both UG and PG teaching in Electrical Engineering, with a renewable energy focus. The position will be based at the centrally located UTS Campus in Ultimo and will report directly to Head of Discipline, Professor Dylan Lu.The School of Electrical & Data Engineering is deeply engaged in research of national and international standing in many areas. Key areas include: wireless communications and networking, Internet of Things (IoT), applied electro-magnetics and antennas, electrical systems and power electronics, image processing, computer vision, machine learning, cybersecurity, big data analytics and big data systems, and RF IC design. Our School hosts three IEEE Fellows and 3 ARC DECRA grant holders and we conduct research funded by government agencies and national and international industry partner.About the role• Teaching-related leadership and research-based teaching practice at the program level (Level D), or discipline related (Level E), courses in Electrical Engineering.• Attract significant national competitive funding and industrial funding• Provide service and leadership at the School, Faculty and University levels• Supervision of undergraduate and postgraduate project studentsAbout you• A PhD degree in Electrical Engineering or closely related disciplines• Familiarity with relevant industry practices in Electrical Engineering courses - renewable energy, energy storage, electrified transportation, electrification or related fields• Demonstrated knowledge of recent advances in Electrical Engineering courses - renewable energy, energy storage, electrified transportation, electrification or related fields• Successful teaching and course development experience in Electrical Engineering and renewable energy• Experience and track record in research with demonstrated outcomes that include research publications, grants and research supervision in Electrical Engineering, renewable energy, energy storage, electric vehicles, smart grids, electrification or related fields.Base Salary Range: $161,730 to $201,100 pa (Level D - E)This role attracts 17% superannuation (pension) in addition to the base salary.UTS staff also benefit from a wide range of Employee Benefits include flexible work practices, child care centres, generous parental leave and salary packaging opportunities.This position is full-time and appointment will be made on a continuing basis.Our vision is to be a leading public university of technology recognised for our global impact. We are a dynamic and innovative university, ranked by the Times Higher Education as Australia's top young university, and located centrally in one of the world's most liveable cities. With a culturally diverse campus life and extensive international exchange and research programs, UTS prepares graduates for the workplaces of today and tomorrow. How To ApplyFor the full list of the selection criteria and role responsibilities please click the apply link and download the Position Statement from the UTS website. UTS is committed to diversity and inclusion in our workforce and we encourage applicants where relevant to include a relative to opportunity or career disruption/break statement within their CV.You are required to address the selection criteria in your submission in a separate document.   Only those applications submitted via the UTS online recruitment system will be accepted.  Current UTS employees should apply through their UTS Employee Self Service function.As you will be unable to save your application once started, please have all required documents and information available prior to commencing.Please ensure that the file name for each document submitted includes IRC220841 and your name.Specific enquiries or issues with your application may be directed to Pam Price in the UTS Recruitment Team at recruitment@uts.edu.au.Please be advised that as part of the selection process that you may be requested to deliver a presentation, the audience for which may include individuals not on the Selection Panel.Closing Date:  Monday 27th June 2022 at 11.59pm (AEST)AccessibilityUTS Recruitment cares about digital accessibility. If there is any content in our advertising that you have struggled with, please make us aware so that we can make our information accessible to all.In addition, if you have a disability that requires adjustment to the recruitment process or an alternative application pathway please contact recruitment@uts.edu.au for assistance.UTS is recognised widely as supporting inclusivity and diversity through our Wingara Indigenous Employment Strategy, Social Impact Framework, and UTS Access and Inclusion Plan.We welcome applications from women, Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those who identify as LGBTIQ, and applicants from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

Key areas include: wireless communications and networking, Internet of Things (IoT), applied electro-magnetics and antennas, electrical systems and power electronics, image processing, computer vision, machine learning, cybersecurity, big data analytics and big data systems, and RF IC design. Our School hosts three IEEE Fellows and 3 ARC DECRA grant holders and we conduct research funded by government agencies and national and international industry partner.About the role• Teaching-related leadership and research-based teaching practice at the program level (Level D), or discipline related (Level E), courses in Electrical Engineering.• Attract significant national competitive funding and industrial funding• Provide service and leadership at the School, Faculty and University levels• Supervision of undergraduate and postgraduate project studentsAbout you• A PhD degree in Electrical Engineering or closely related disciplines• Familiarity with relevant industry practices in Electrical Engineering courses - renewable energy, energy storage, electrified transportation, electrification or related fields• Demonstrated knowledge of recent advances in Electrical Engineering courses - renewable energy, energy storage, electrified transportation, electrification or related fields• Successful teaching and course development experience in Electrical Engineering and renewable energy• Experience and track record in research with demonstrated outcomes that include research publications, grants and research supervision in Electrical Engineering, renewable energy, energy storage, electric vehicles, smart grids, electrification or related fields.Base Salary Range: $161,730 to $201,100 pa (Level D - E)This role attracts 17% superannuation (pension) in addition to the base salary.UTS staff also benefit from a wide range of Employee Benefits include flexible work practices, child care centres, generous parental leave and salary packaging opportunities.This position is full-time and appointment will be made on a continuing basis.Our vision is to be a leading public university of technology recognised for our global impact. We are a dynamic and innovative university, ranked by the Times Higher Education as Australia's top young university, and located centrally in one of the world's most liveable cities. With a culturally diverse campus life and extensive international exchange and research programs, UTS prepares graduates for the workplaces of today and tomorrow. How To ApplyFor the full list of the selection criteria and role responsibilities please click the apply link and download the Position Statement from the UTS website. UTS is committed to diversity and inclusion in our workforce and we encourage applicants where relevant to include a relative to opportunity or career disruption/break statement within their CV.You are required to address the selection criteria in your submission in a separate document.   Only those applications submitted via the UTS online recruitment system will be accepted.  Current UTS employees should apply through their UTS Employee Self Service function.As you will be unable to save your application once started, please have all required documents and information available prior to commencing.Please ensure that the file name for each document submitted includes IRC220841 and your name.Specific enquiries or issues with your application may be directed to Pam Price in the UTS Recruitment Team at recruitment@uts.edu.au.Please be advised that as part of the selection process that you may be requested to deliver a presentation, the audience for which may include individuals not on the Selection Panel.Closing Date:  Monday 27th June 2022 at 11.59pm (AEST)AccessibilityUTS Recruitment cares about digital accessibility. If there is any content in our advertising that you have struggled with, please make us aware so that we can make our information accessible to all.In addition, if you have a disability that requires adjustment to the recruitment process or an alternative application pathway please contact recruitment@uts.edu.au for assistance.UTS is recognised widely as supporting inclusivity and diversity through our Wingara Indigenous Employment Strategy, Social Impact Framework, and UTS Access and Inclusion Plan.We welcome applications from women, Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those who identify as LGBTIQ, and applicants from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

Name: Azure Security Consultant
Description: About the companyLoop Secure is Australia's longest-standing cybersecurity firm with over 30 years of history in the region We are a leader in cybersecurity services, with 24x7 security operations, expert adversary simulation & penetration testing capabilities along with leading governance, risk and compliance consulting, As our clients' cybersecurity partner of choice, we forge long term valued relationships Loop provides the opportunity for career advancement as part of a growing team with an emphasis on career development You will receive comprehensive training and the support you need to succeed in this role Loop offers a competitive salary package with flexible work/life balance within a fun working environment. Backed by the Australian ASX listed Tesserent, become part of Australia’s largest ASX listed ‘pure play’ cybersecurity consulting and solutions provider with over 350 security professionals, located across 8 offices across Australia and New Zealand.About the roleAn exciting opportunity exists for an experienced Azure Security Consultant to join our Cyber Defence Services team in an integral role that has a direct impact on the services we supply to our clients.Loop clients view us as an extension of their team, so you will get to know the people you are working for and see the real differences our services make on their business.In this role you will:Assist with the implementation of various Azure and Office 365 technologies, including but not limited to:Azure AD Microsoft Intune Microsoft Defender for EndpointMicrosoft PurviewMicrosoft Exchange Online, SharePoint and OneDriveBe a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for Microsoft cloud technologies.About YouThe ideal candidate will bring a thorough understanding of Microsoft cloud technologies as well as strong organisational, presentation, and customer service skills.You will have:Demonstrable experience in Azure and Office 365 technologiesExperience in provisioning secure cloud environmentsThe ability to clearly communicate the reasoning behind specific configuration setsAchieved, or a vision to achieve, the following certifications:Microsoft 365 Certified: Security Administrator Associate (MS-500)Microsoft Certified: Azure Security Engineer Associate (AZ-500)Our Culture and ValuesLoop focuses heavily on our culture and values to create an enjoyable working environment that recognises the best in our Loopies:We look for client success in everything we doWe strive for continual improvement, challenging the status quo and searching out opportunities to learn, grow and lead for ourselves and the businessDependability is highly valued, when we say we are going to do something, we follow it throughHaving fun is a big focus for us, calling out and recognising Loopies bringing enjoyment and laughter to our workdayLoopies focus on teamwork, working together to achieve our goals and helping out when someone is in need. We are always looking to share our ideas, thoughts and feelings.About the CandidateFor this role we value candidates with the following behaviours:Strong listening skillsStrong analytical skillsSelf-motivatedPersistenceSelf-awarenessHow to ApplyIf you're looking for a rewarding role with a fantastic business, apply now via SEEK with your CV or apply via https://www.loopsec.com.au/about/join-us

Name: Research Associate in Networked Systems
Description:
UNSW Canberra is a campus of the University of New South Wales located at the Australian Defence Force Academy in Canberra. UNSW Canberra endeavours to offer staff a rewarding experience and offers many opportunities and attractive benefits, including:

     One of Australia’s leading research and teaching universities
     Strong commitment to staff development and learning
     Strong commitment to work life and family balance
     Generous superannuation opportunities

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.
The School of Engineering and Information Technology (SEIT) offers a flexible, friendly working environment that is well-resourced and delivers research-informed education as part of its accredited, globally recognised engineering and computing degrees to its undergraduate students. The School offers programs in electrical, mechanical, aeronautical, and civil engineering as well as in aviation, information technology and cyber security to graduates and professionals who will be Australia’s future technology decision makers.
Applicants are invited to apply for a Research Associate position within SEIT to work on a research project in wirelessly networked systems. The successful candidate will report to The Chief Investigator (CI) of the project. The position will involve research activity in multidisciplinary settings requiring skills in Computer Networks and Operating Systems, setting up networking testbeds and using programming languages. Good understanding  of wireless systems and their cybersecurity aspects will be considered a plus. The successful candidate will contribute to the development of research results and their publication in international journals, participate at a national and/or international conference/s.  Where negotiated with the project CI and Head of School, the successful candidate may undertake teaching responsibilities as appropriate.
About the Role:
Role:                       Research Associate in Networked SystemsSalary:                    Academic Level A $98,342 - $105, 185 plus 17% Superannuation            Term:                     Full time, Fixed Term appointment up to 2 years
About the Successful Applicants
To be successful in this role you will:            

Hold a PhD in a computer science, preferably with a focus on networked systems.
Have experience with open-source networking and software data packets processing frameworks, such as OpenWRT and/or SDN controllers.
Have a demonstrated ability to develop networking applications for computers and commodity hardware.
Possess excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills appropriate for interacting effectively team members, collaborators and colleagues across the faculty.
Have a demonstrated ability to work as a member of a multi-disciplinary team showing initiative and taking direction as appropriate to the situation.
Have a demonstrated ability to complete tasks within agreed time frames, with suitable supervision.

In your application you should systematically address the Selection Criteria outlined in the Position Description. 
In order to view the Position Description – please ensure that you allow pop-ups for Jobs@UNSW Portal.
The successful candidate will be required to undertake pre-employment checks prior to commencement in this role. The checks that will be undertaken are listed in the Position Description. You will not be required to provide any further documentation or information regarding the checks until directly requested by UNSW.
The position is located in Canberra, ACT. The successful candidate will be required to work from the UNSW Canberra campus. To be successful you will hold Australian Working Rights or Australian Citizenship. Visa sponsorship is not available for this appointment.
For further information about UNSW Canberra, please visit our website: UNSW Canberra
Contact:Dr Faycal BouhafsE-mail:  F.Bouhafs@unsw.edu.au Tel (VOIP): 02 5114 5124 
Applications Close:
Friday 8 July 2022 11:30pm AEST
Find out more about working at UNSW Canberra
At UNSW Canberra, we celebrate diversity and understand the benefits that inclusion brings to the university. We aim to ensure that our culture, policies, and processes are truly inclusive. We are committed to developing and maintaining a workplace where everyone is valued and respected for who they are and supported in achieving their professional goals. We welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, Women at all levels, Culturally and Linguistically Diverse People, People with Disability, LGBTIQ+ People, people with family and caring responsibilities and people at all stages of their careers. We encourage everyone who meets the selection criteria and shares our commitment to inclusion to apply.
       Any questions about the application process - please email unswcanberra.recruitment@adfa.edu.au
