Name: Cyber Security Analyst - OT
Description: This large Government Agency is currently embarking on a magor security up lift, and requires an experienced Analyst (Operational Technology) This will be an initial 6 month contract with hybrid working arrangementsKey accountabilitiesProvide cybersecurity IT and OT (Operational Technology) engineering subject matters analysis and adviceDesign, implement and coordinate appropriate security controls to ensure transparency and active management of cyber security riskEnsure assigned project delivery complies with applicable cybersecurity standards, processes, and regulationsDeliver cybersecurity artefacts at delivery assurance gates, and actively throughout delivery as directed across the portfolioMaintain effective records, and meet reporting requirements for IT and OT cybersecurity activity across the DivisionKey challengesEnsuring assigned IT and OT delivery and operational projects meet security requirements and milestones without compromising on safety, securityEngage successfully into project stakeholders with a broad range of cyber security literacyEssential requirementsTertiary qualifications in an Engineering discipline, or equivalent experienceProfessional Certification such as CISA, CISM, CISSP, ISO27001 LA or similar preferredGood working knowledge of IEC 62443 would be an advantagePlease reach out for a confidental chat today mjpollock@quayappointments.com.au

Name: Senior Manager - Cloud Engineering & Operations
Description:
Could this be one of those rare moments to do the best work of your career? At Tabcorp, our story continues to evolve every day. It’s an exciting moment in our history - a new era of Tabcorp. We’re raising the game by creating the most engaging betting and entertainment experiences, and to lead in integrity.
We’re here to create excitement everywhere – through our incredible people, unrivalled experiences and strong relationships. We're bringing industry leading products and services to our customers and breaking into new horizons.
Game to join us? 
 
What you’ll do
The Cloud Governance and Optimisation Manager is responsible for providing knowledge and guidance to application and data teams on their cloud consumption, on Tabcorp’s Public Cloud footprint.
In your new role you will facilitate and bridge a number of core teams, vendors, and internal support groups which look after critical systems and processes in order to meet the various SLA’s and Optimisation KPI’s that have been set for our Services and Engineering platforms. A high level of technical knowledge of cloud capabilities, as well as integration and API billing consumption data ingest, analytics & interpretation are essential skills for this role.
Furthermore, a high level of skill and capability is required in building interfaces and data ingest scripts for automation, database design and build to support central data capture and data analytics tasks. There are several application platforms managed by this role, alongside all the dashboards, while building, maintaining, and updating functionality to the Infrastructure & Cloud Operations KPI scorecard, AWS cost optimisation shutdown schedule tool, asset portal database and web presentation.
You will work hand in hand with your program counterparts to assist and aid in DevOps transformation and/or assist with best practise migrations of enterprise workloads to the AWS cloud platform. You will have firsthand experience at assessing Cloud and DevOps maturity, identify gaps and making improvements. You will create a unified strategy for cloud transformation governance, optimisation, automation, security, implementation and operations. Day-to-day you will be expected to lead your engineering peers through the technical and organisational challenges of Cloud and DevOps transformation and be responsible and accountable for ensuring a smooth and agile Cloud migration and DevOps transformation.
What you’ll bring

Significant experience in technology and experience leading cloud services across a complex enterprise with 24/7 services, and servicing multiple customer facing platforms.
Demonstrated capability managing and operating AWS deployments.
Demonstrated experience with DevOps practices and agile ways of working.
Experience with configuration management and tools such as Cloud Formation, Terraform, Chef, Puppet or Ansible.
Experience with IT infrastructure lifecycle planning and management across various technologies.
Experience working with Microsoft Azure/ AWS environment and private/public cloud adoption.
Experience in delivery of remediation across infrastructure services.
Collaborating with Solution and Enterprise Architects to aggregate input into future state roadmaps/operational plans.
Astute at developing business aligned IT strategies, frameworks, and roadmaps (and communicating these).
Experienced in agile, lean, DevOps, and other best (and next) practice.
Extensive vendor management experience, working with a variety of supplier / resource models, including matrix, managed services, and multiple suppliers
Proven track record in managing a highly effective team.
An extensive understanding of the Information and Technology industry, as well as technology trends and next practice.
Proven experience in developing and maintaining strong relationships across business and technology teams.
An understanding of IT governance, cybersecurity, risk, and compliance requirements in an ICT context.
Working experience of market-based tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Advanced Excel, SQL, Cloud Formation, CloudHealth, Cloud Bolt, Cloudability or Komulous etc. (Desirable).

What you’ll get
Not only will receive an awesome candidate experience from our caring Talent team, the perks of working with us are pretty good too!
The list is expensive but here are a few:

A “say yes” approach to flexible working to meet your individual needs
A multitude of leave types such as cultural leave, volunteer leave and 18 weeks’ parental leave for all new parents, regardless of gender
We’re committed to Inclusion & Diversity with a range of initiatives such as our annual Inclusion Month celebrations and our Gender Affirmation Statement of Support
We’re proud to have been named an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the federal government’s Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) for the seventh consecutive year
We offer a comprehensive (and free) health and wellbeing app called The Arena to support you and your family’s mental and physical health
We’re committed to your learning and development with a dedicated platform with helpful resources from leadership to technology to upskill and cross train

About Tabcorp
We’re Australia’s leading gambling entertainment company. Together, we build on our 100+ year heritage by delivering Excitement with Integrity, every day. Each one of us is here to put our customers at the heart of everything we do by creating moments that engage, surprise and thrill. 
Our 3,000+ strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive homegrown world-class brands; TAB, Sky Racing and MAX. As an ASX listed company, we’re proud to shape our industry for the better. Because together, anything’s possible. 
Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au [link removed].
COVID
Tabcorp is closely monitoring Department of Health guidelines to ensure we continue to provide a safe working environment. You may be required to present evidence of Covid vaccination in order to comply with Public Health directions and fulfil the requirements of this role.
This role can be based in Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane.

Name: Security Technician
Description: Due to growth nationally, we are seeking Security Technicians from all levels of experience.COVID has taught us to consider what is really important. Be valued, have purpose and make a difference to your countries security. With over twenty years of experience, Secom Technical Services, designs installs and maintains complete electronic and cybersecurity requirements for the Australian market.If you are alleged to our TECH Values we want to hear from you.Trustworthy: Delivering quality work reliably to completionEffective: Solid desire to consistently achieve the best possible outcomeCollaborative: True interest in working together to drive improved business outcomesHonesty: Always show ethical integrity through your work and behaviourEmployee BenefitsCompany Vehicle or Car allowance with Novated Lease OptionsTools of the trade providedPhone or sim, and LaptopPetrol CardCar ParkExternal training paid by the business; Project Management or Cyber Security DegreeSocial Team Building EventsFamily Fun DaysMentoring ProgramLeadership Program delivered by Sydney Swans Psychological CoachWhat’s it like working at Secom you ask??‘Our team is supported to do our best every day by our leader. He does this with his enthusiasm for his role, and his availability to talk about jobs, clients, or any questions/problems that we have. He ensures we have a great team culture!’ (Senior Security Technician, NSW)‘My supervisor instantly made me feel like I was working with a friend instead of just a boss. He goes above and beyond every day for his technicians and does anything he can to provide great support, ideas and comradery.’(Security Technician ACT)About you:High standard of ethics and you are aligned with our TECH ValuesQuality trade skills and you love tinkering with electronicsCurrent or ability to obtain a ACT/NSW Security LicenceCurrent or ability to obtain an Australian Government Security ClearanceCurrent drivers’ licenceCurrent or ability to obtain a cabling licenceCurrent Construction or ability to obtain a white cardCurrent or ability to obtain Asbestos Awareness cardStrong communication and stakeholder engagement skillsStrong attention to detail/situational awarenessObtains or ability to obtain an AGSVA ClearanceDesirable:Demonstrated Site Lead/ Electrical Forman experianceCert 3 or undergoing Cert 3 qualification in electrical, security or allied industries and/or trade based experienceAbility to program security systems such as GallagherAbility to perform basic ICT networking3 or more years experienceFault identification, isolation, repair, and reporting on systems installed and managedSound skills in electronic data and documentation managementVery effective report writing both technical and non-technicalStrong ability to perform cabling, fit off (including panels), and commissioning of electronic security systemsStrong ability to create engineering documentation including Cable Schedules and For Construction DrawingsIt's time for a change; join a global organisation that supports you like family.https://www.secomts.com  https://www.linkedin.com/company/secom-technical-services-pty-ltd/posts/?feedView=all&viewAsMember=true Please call our HR Manager, Lisa Sutton to have a confidential conversation ​02 5115 0635 or simply apply now.ACT Master Security Licence # 17501793

Name: Service Solutions Specialist
Description: At Honeywell, we make a lot of incredible things. But most importantly, we make the future, and are looking for people to join our team global team of future shapers. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our performance culture comprised of diverse leaders, thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who are changing the future. Our people are committed to each other and to the realisation of our vision through their unique job functions. Our businesses embrace the challenges of innovation so that we define the future. And our global opportunities are endless for you to grow and get recognised for your passion to perform. About the Role​We have a fantastic opportunity for a Service Solutions Specialist for our Honeywell Building Technologies/Solutions team in Perth, WA. We are looking for candidates having experience in Building management systems and HVAC domain.As the Service Solutions Specialist, you will be responsible for the design, engineering, configuration, implementation, commissioning and ongoing support/maintenance and upgrades of all Operational Technology (OT), Enterprise Applications and Connected Services delivered into the service Line of Business (LOB). This will also include ensuring to adhere to the centralisation and standardisation of OT, ICT and Cybersecurity implementation and services to promote, deliver and maintain more connected, operational critical solutions to our customers, ensuring alignment and consistency with global standards and guidelines.The role will be required to drive alignment and standardisation of the installation, upgrades and support maintenance of the OT, Enterprise Applications and Connected Services that regularly form part of Honeywell’s solutions to ensure we can execute effectively for our customers, reduce our risk, cycle times, variation, and cost to deliver/service. This will also include working with peers to identify areas where we can streamline delivery by utilising digital deployment tools and centralised deployment standards.The Service Solutions Specialist team will also be responsible for working in collaboration with the Regional and Pole ICT Engineering teams to ensure correct implementation of ICT and Cybersecurity products and services in line with the HBS Buildings global ICT and cybersecurity offering portfolio.​Key Responsibilities:Contribute to the design, engineering, configuration, implementation, commissioning, support/maintenance and upgrades of Honeywell’s OT, Connected Services and Enterprise Software Applications (EBI, DVM, EM, OBS, Forge, Pulse, Vector etc.) in the service LOB.Possess a strong understanding of ICT and Cybersecurity principles and design and how these systems and services work in tandem with Honeywell’s OT, Connected Services and Enterprise Software Applications.Posses a strong understanding and knowledge of all industry standards and protocols (BACnet, Modbus, OPC, SNMP, APIs etc) and how these protocols are used to ingest and share data from Honeywell and 3rd party technologies/applications with Honeywell’s OT/ Enterprise Applications and Connected Services.Take ownership of site issues and work in collaboration with TAC to ensure any issues with OT, Enterprise Applications or Connected Services are identified and rectified promptly.Work with customers to understand their requirements to ensure proposed solution meets their needs and requirements, providing alternatives if needed/required.Sales Assistance/Design, involving innovative use of latest technology in establishing system design, and providing project estimatesPrepare submittals per engineering standards, ensuring commitment dates are met. Review submittals with sales and delivery teams and lead team to obtain submittal approvalDevelop detailed system designs/architectures, implementation procedures and documentation required for the successful delivery of the implementation/upgrades of all OT, Enterprise Applications and Connected Services.Provide technical direction, training and support to local field service specialists for operation, maintenance and troubleshooting of all OT, Enterprise Applications and Connected Services. Key Experience & Capabilities:Minimum 2 Years’ Experience in a design, implementation, maintenance, Enterprise Applications and Connected Services role.Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics Engineering (desired)Previous experience with Buildings Management systems is mandatory and if Honeywell will be an advantagePrevious experience in HVAC, energy management systems, energy efficiencies, Modbus & BACnetIntermediate skills in field troubleshootingAbility to work collaboratively both in person, and remotelyExperience with cloud platforms will be beneficialHaving software related works experience with SCADA (Supervisory control and data acquisition) will be an advantageThe role provides an excellent opportunity for you, as an engineer, to be at the forefront of transformation and enjoy working in a fast paced, changing and evolving environment while also contributing and helping to Honeywell growing OT, Enterprise Application and Connected Service product portfolio and capabilities. About UsThe world is changing. And it’s a familiar story at Honeywell. Our $36 billion business was founded on a legacy of firsts spanning 130 years. We’re building a safer, smarter, and more sustainable world through our technology and software across each of our 930 sites globally. Our impact is seen in every shape and size around the world. Our solutions are felt daily in aerospace, buildings and cities, retail, chemicals and materials, safety, industrial and manufacturing, safety, and supply chains.Discover MoreWe’ve been innovating for more than 100 years and now we’re creating what’s next. There’s a lot more available for you to discover. Our solutions, our case studies, our #futureshapers, and so much more. Learn more at careers.honeywell.com/us/en/If you believe what happens tomorrow is determined by what we do today, you’ll love working at Honeywell.The future is what we make it. So join us and let’s do this together.

Name: Security Architect
Description: Company DescriptionAbout UsThe first thing you learn at Leidos Australia is to leave current thinking at the door. Our aim is to make the world a safer, healthier and more efficient place, but we won’t get far using existing ideas. We need incisive minds like yours to weave together information technology, engineering and science skills into practical solutions for the most complex and high risk challenges.Job DescriptionAbout your new role Are you an experienced security architect? Or, looking to transition from an engineering role? Do you believe that systems should be designed securely from the outset and not just validated at conclusion?Working with a team of solution architects and engineers, you will be become a trusted security advisor to a Federal Government customer. You will collaboratively design secure systems that meet our customer’s needs. You will present new security and technology solutions to meet requirements whilst being part of a supportive and integrated team with peers in Pre-Sales, Project Management, Architecture, Engineering, and Security Architecture. You will be capable of building strong relationships working closely with customer stakeholders, Architecture and Security teams.In a typical day, you will: Support security architecture services across project life cycles from concept, requirements, design, build, test verification and ongoing maintenance and support;Documenting how the design follows the Australian Information Security Manual (ISM) for accreditation;Providing design input into security functions in the design;Preforming security risk assessments on the design;Derive, review, interpret and respond to customer security requirements to ensure alignment between customer expectations and current and future road map technologies;Work on security focused project activities to ensure requirements are captured and solutions align with the customer and Leidos strategic directionAuthor and contribute to the design and definition of the security solution components contributing to High Level Designs (HLDs) and Detailed Level Designs (DLDs)Engage with the Engineering team and CTO on solutions and alignment to existing and pipeline security solutions;Work collaboratively with Engineering, Architecture and Security team to support security design compliance and governance activities with projects.QualificationsAbout you and what you'll bring:You have demonstrated experience in:Knowledge of applying defence frameworks such as ISM, DSPF and PSPF;Experience in preparing security accreditation documentation;Experience with working in a Defence in Depth environment;Knowledge of OWASP and Essential Eight Maturity Model;(Desirable) A Cybersecurity qualification, such as CISSP, CISM, CISA, CRISC, SSCP, CompTIA Security+, GIAC or equivalent background knowledge;(Desirable) Worked with System Hardening (CIS benchmarks and ASD guidelines) and Vulnerability Assessments; andExperience across the breadth of on-premise and cloud (Azure and M365) Microsoft technologies are also highly desirable.This role does require the successful applicant to be an Australian Citizen, undergo an Australian Police Check and hold an active Baseline,  NV1 or NV2 clearance.Additional InformationWhat You'll LoveThis is a fast growing business currently implementing a range of business improvement initiatives, so you’ll have the chance to see some market leading technologies implemented across the function along with contributing to building further on the progressive work currently being developed. We offer a flexible working environment where it’s possible to design your ideal work week.You’ll be joining a fun and friendly team who support each other closely and love to celebrate together.Applicants may also need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements. In certain circumstances this can place limitations on persons who hold dual nationality, permanent residency or are former nationals of certain countries as per ITAR 126.1.

Name: .Net Developer
Description: Job Role: .Net DeveloperWork Location: Sydney or Melbourne or BrisbaneAbout the CompanyTech Mahindra offers innovative and customer-centric digital experiences, enabling enterprises, associates and the society to Rise. We are focused on leveraging next-generation technologies including 5G, Blockchain, Cybersecurity, Artificial Intelligence, and more, to enable end-to-end digital transformation for global customers. Tech Mahindra is one of the fastest growing brands and amongst the top 15 IT service providers globallyRequirement:5+ years of relevant experience in software development.Proficient in C#.NetExperience with HTML, JavaScript and web development frameworks (AngularJS, Bootstrap, jQuery)Proven experience with software design and OOD methodologiesFamiliarity with Relational Databases and MS SQLExperience with Web services development (SOAP, REST)Strong in Object Oriented Programming, MVC, Design patterns and SOLID principlesKey Responsibilities:Design, development and testing of new features in the applicationsResponsible for regular communication with others involved in the development processImplement, test, and bug-fix functionalityResponsibility for design and implementation of software projects using C#Participate as a team member in fully agile Scrum deliveriesProvide support to end usersDesign, build, and maintain efficient and reliable C# code For further information please contact Manpreet Kaur at MK00842023@TechMahindra.com.

Name: Solution Technologist Architect
Description: The Company: My client is a world-leading investment bank specializing in wealth management, global fixed income, and commodities trading, located in Sydney, New York, London, and Hong Kong    Role My client is looking for a Solution Architect that has a strong technology background and is able to influence stakeholders on technical decisions. You will be responsible for working on a large transformation program including risk and data platform migration into AWS, strong stakeholder and vendor management skills are essential    Responsibilities:   You will be responsible for coming up with and driving strategy within the architecture team for Capital Markets Provide technical input and ensure adherence to company security and best practices Engage with various stakeholders within the business to ensure they line up their architecture direction with our strategy  Working closely with the business and the engineering team  Experience in the following:  Strong data platforms and tools experience Concepts of cybersecurity or architecture Knowledge of network topology and associated technologies Experience working on end-to-end solution applications Engineering background Background working with AWS, API Gateway Platforms, Data Hub, and Database Platforms Able to work in a fast-paced and agile environment Excellent communication skills are essential     What’s in it for you: Work for a highly reputed, successful, global bank located in one of the most prestigious buildings in Sydney CBD. Extremely good opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment where you will be facing off the business   If this role has caught your attention and sounds like something you would like to explore further, please reach out to me: Becca on 0404 144 565 or email me at becca@clarrow.com.au.

Name: Research Associate in Networked Systems
Description:
UNSW Canberra is a campus of the University of New South Wales located at the Australian Defence Force Academy in Canberra. UNSW Canberra endeavours to offer staff a rewarding experience and offers many opportunities and attractive benefits, including:

     One of Australia’s leading research and teaching universities
     Strong commitment to staff development and learning
     Strong commitment to work life and family balance
     Generous superannuation opportunities

At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.
The School of Engineering and Information Technology (SEIT) offers a flexible, friendly working environment that is well-resourced and delivers research-informed education as part of its accredited, globally recognised engineering and computing degrees to its undergraduate students. The School offers programs in electrical, mechanical, aeronautical, and civil engineering as well as in aviation, information technology and cyber security to graduates and professionals who will be Australia’s future technology decision makers.
Applicants are invited to apply for a Research Associate position within SEIT to work on a research project in wirelessly networked systems. The successful candidate will report to The Chief Investigator (CI) of the project. The position will involve research activity in multidisciplinary settings requiring skills in Computer Networks and Operating Systems, setting up networking testbeds and using programming. Languages. Good understanding  of wireless systems and their cybersecurity aspects will be considered a plus. The successful candidate will contribute to the development of research results and their publication in international journals, participate at a national and/or international conference/s.  Where negotiated with the project CI and Head of School, the successful candidate may undertake teaching responsibilities as appropriate
About the Role:
Role:                       Research Associate in Networked SystemsSalary:                    Academic Level A $98,342 - $105, 185 plus 17% Superannuation            Term:                     Full time, Fixed Term appointment up to 2 years
About the Successful Applicants
To be successful in this role you will:               

Hold a PhD in a computer science, preferably with a focus on networked systems.
Have experience with open-source networking and software data packets processing frameworks, such as OpenWRT and/or SDN controllers.
Have a demonstrated ability to develop networking applications for computers and commodity hardware.
Possess excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills appropriate for interacting effectively team members, collaborators and colleagues across the faculty.
Have a demonstrated ability to work as a member of a multi-disciplinary team showing initiative and taking direction as appropriate to the situation.
Have a demonstrated ability to complete tasks within agreed time frames, with suitable supervision.

In your application you should systematically address the Selection Criteria outlined in the Position Description. 
In order to view the Position Description – please ensure that you allow pop-ups for Jobs@UNSW Portal.
The successful candidate will be required to undertake pre-employment checks prior to commencement in this role. The checks that will be undertaken are listed in the Position Description. You will not be required to provide any further documentation or information regarding the checks until directly requested by UNSW.
The position is located in Canberra, ACT. The successful candidate will be required to work from the UNSW Canberra campus. To be successful you will hold Australian Working Rights or Australian Citizenship. Visa sponsorship is not available for this appointment.
For further information about UNSW Canberra, please visit our website: UNSW Canberra
Contact:Dr Faycal BouhafsE-mail:  F.Bouhafs@unsw.edu.au Tel (VOIP): 02 5114 5124 
Applications Close: 30th June 2022 11:30PM
 
Find out more about working at UNSW Canberra
At UNSW Canberra, we celebrate diversity and understand the benefits that inclusion brings to the university. We aim to ensure that our culture, policies, and processes are truly inclusive. We are committed to developing and maintaining a workplace where everyone is valued and respected for who they are and supported in achieving their professional goals. We welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, Women at all levels, Culturally and Linguistically Diverse People, People with Disability, LGBTIQ+ People, people with family and caring responsibilities and people at all stages of their careers. We encourage everyone who meets the selection criteria and shares our commitment to inclusion to apply.
       Any questions about the application process - please email unswcanberra.recruitment@adfa.edu.au

Name: CONSULTANT, NETWORKS AND SECURITY SERVICES
Description: Position Summary   The Network and Security Consultant shall Interface with our valued clients to develop secure network solutions. Will participate in Assessments, Audits, Design, and deployment projects in Network, Security and Virtualization. These Projects will be specific to enabling a connected enterprise / IT-OT convergence / Industry 4.0 by connecting the Industrial Internet of Things. Will need good understanding and experience of networking and security concepts for the OT side.   Potential candidates should have:   Minimum Qualifications / skill sets: Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science or Information Technology or related technology driven degree with minimum 5 years of work experience. If no degree, 15+ years of experience in Manufacturing Control Systems, Network Engineering, and Industrial Security Controls.  Hands-on experience configuring IT/OT equipment (Cisco ASA, Cisco Switches, Firewalls, Virtual Server Environments, Anti-Virus Software, Continuous Threat Detection). Previous experience working as part of a large, multi-disciplinary team completing full project life-cycle implementations.  Cisco / VMWare / Cybersecurity related certifications (CCNA, CCNP, VCP, GISSP, IEC 62443) Travel Requirements - Flexibility for travel 25% - 75% is required and can include both domestic and international trips.   Job RequirementsExperience in design and deploying security controls for an Industrial Network. These can include system management hardening, device hardening, end point security, perimeter security, disaster recovery, threat detection and monitoring as examples.  Understanding of NIST 800-82, NERC-CIP, IEC-62443 Standards Solid technical skills with EtherNet/IP or other Ethernet based networks, specifically around assessment, design and implementation of complex systems.  Strong commercial skills, ability to handle multiple projects, communication skills, ability to diagnose automation problems and interact with teams, clients and vendors. Familiarity with a variety of security and/or networking concepts, practices, and procedures, to include manufacturing and enterprise network convergence, network protocols, communication optimization, application effects on system performance and human exploitation techniques on the manufacturing network.  Experience in developing and deploying solutions in a virtual environment.   Desirable: Experience in Network Architecture, PLC, Networking and SCADA design/programming including data extraction and data analysis.  Exposure to PLC programming packages (Rockwell or comparable platforms) is desirable.  Design, implement and support customer’s converged business and manufacturing/industrial systems and user needs in parallel with their overall business strategies.  Write detailed documentation that could include user needs, system specifications, observed issues with remediation recommendations or implementation requirements in order to develop or modify manufacturing infrastructure.Design, recommend, and implement system security changes.  Design customer secure manufacturing architecture and provides vision, problem anticipation, and problem solving ability to customers.

Name: Technical Delivery Manager
Description: Company description:Metro moves you around Melbourne.As the city's metropolitan rail service, Metro operates 226 six carriage trains across 998 kilometres of track, transporting 450,000 customers each day. We aim to encourage the Melbourne community's vibrant and ever evolving lifestyles, by providing a seamless transport solution to keep individuals connected.With 15 lines, 222 stations and services seven days a week, Metro can take you wherever you're headed across the city, whenever you want to go.Job description:   Why work for Metro?    Influence large rail infrastructure projects to integrate new technology into major infrastructure projects Have a significant impact on programs that will directly improve Melbourne's suburban rail network whilst ensuring these developments do not come at a cost to our safe and cost-effective delivery of services. All Metro Employees receive a free Myki pass for free Public Transport in Victoria.      Jargon Buster    OCMS - Operational Control Management Systems - Metro's Technology Team MTM - Metro Trains Melbourne MTP - Metro Tunnel Project MAR - Melbourne Airport Rail      About the Role   The Technical Delivery Manager is responsible for the design review, test verification and quality of technology solutions including High Capacity Signalling and Communications Based Train Control delivered to OCMS by contracted delivery partners as part of the Victorian State Government Big Build projects program.     Responsibilities    Reporting to the Head of Technology Integration - Metro Tunnel  and Melbourne Airport Rail , this role will: Build a solid and collaborative working relationship with technical subject matter experts from delivery partners and MTM functional team leads and architects responsible for the delivery of MTP and MAR technology solution components Ensure the right stakeholders are engaged and consulted to ensure successful technical review and delivery of technology solutions Lead a cross-functional technical team comprised of functions including control systems engineering, train control and signalling, enterprise architecture and cybersecurity      About You    Proven experience in successfully delivering multiple technology solutions  for large projects in a matrix model organisation Good understanding of testing regimes and experience in using them to deliver quality technology solution outcomes in large projects with critical interfacing and performance requirements Experience in ensuring technology solutions proposed and delivered meet industry/government-based security compliance standards (e.g. VPDSS, ISM, COBIT, ISO/IEC 27002, NIST) Rail experience or aligned industry such as road transport, aviation or telecommunications would be highly valued

Name: System Verification and Validation Lead
Advertiser: Hitachi Rail STS Australia Pty Ltd
Description: Hitachi Rail is a fully integrated, global provider of turnkey rail solutions across rolling stock, signalling, operation, service and maintenance, digital technology and turnkey with a presence in 38 countries, across 11 manufacturing sites on three continents and over 12,000 employees. Hitachi Rail is headquartered in London, UK and is ultimately wholly owned by Hitachi Ltd.  Our engineering heritage and culture is rooted in Japan, where our first steam and electric locomotives were built in the early 1920s. We continue to deliver the most current Shinkansen for Japan’s railways, and have successfully exported our technology and expertise to multiple rolling stock projects across the globe - from high speed, tram and metro, to driverless technologies for passengers and freight. In recent times, our global footprint outside of Japan has been established primarily on organic expansion in the UK. Recent acquisitions in Italy and beyond have cemented our digital growth, which has diversified revenue and added capability in signalling and turnkey in particular. We are ambitious and continue to seek to expand into new key geographies and to deliver new solutions. Drawing on the wider Hitachi Group’s market-leading technology capabilities and R&D, we strive for industry leading innovations able to deliver value for customers and help build sustainable railway systems which benefit wider society. About the role:Hitachi Rail is seeking an experienced System Verification and Validation Lead to join the team based in Brisbane. Reporting to the System Assurance Manager, you will be accountable for the planning and reporting on System Validation from the development lifecycle through to the target operational configuration state. Additionally, you will be responsible for the Verification and Validation planning, coordination and completion of reporting for the system and subsystems. The V&V Lead will have a team of subsystem verification and validation leads, as well as the independent validator for the safety functions in compliance with EN50126 and EN50128. This will support successful execution of the system V&V management.Work within a passionate, supportive and inclusive team environment. Play an integral role within the Cross River Rail Project. If you looking for a role that truly makes a positive impact, now is your chance to join the Hitachi Rail team on this exciting journey.  Responsibilities of the Role:Maintain sub-system, Speciality Engineering, test facilities verification and validation planning and reporting requirements to enable the integration schedule to progress.Successfully verify and validate ETCS System requirements.Review methods for the verification and validation of each system and interface requirement through the lifecycle.Define verification requirements and ensure compliance with the allocated method, for tracing to the verification specifications.Define validation requirements and ensure compliance with the allocated method, for the ETCS System for tracing to the validation specifications.Verify and validate ETCS System interface requirements.Maintain comprehensive allocation of the verification and validation requirements to work packages.Manage the independent validation test activities.Identification of all verification and validation deliverables to enable the integration schedule.Monitor and report verification and validation activities.Maintain continuous improvement of verification and validation activities. Desired Knowledge/ Experience:Previous experience in a similar role and industry.Knowledge of system engineering, specialising in system verification and validation. Awareness of IEC 15288 Systems and software engineering — System life cycle processes and IEC 29148 Systems and software engineering — Life cycle processes — Requirements engineering. Understanding of development and implementation of Railway Signalling Command and Control Systems, ideally European Train Control Systems.Understanding of system interface and integration constraints derived from speciality engineering areas including - Safety, Reliability, Availability, Maintainability (RAM), Cybersecurity and Human Factors.Outstanding communication skills - written and verbal. Capability to liaise with all levels of management. Excellent negotiation, conflict resolution and planning skills.Experience working on projects that are regulated by the Office or National Rail Safety Regulator (ONRSR) or similar regulatory environment. Education and Training:Australian Honours Degree in engineering or equivalent at Washington accord level.Registered Professional Engineer Queensland (RPEQ) or able to achieve within 3 months of appointment.

Name: Customer Technology Support
Description: Join us during an exciting time of expansion! Are you an energetic, motivated, technically minded individual with Security experience? This is a fantastic opportunity to join Carrier Fire & Security in our growing Notting Hill Technical Support team. Not only do we have a fantastic team culture, but you will benefit from employment stability, progression opportunities as well a range of additional benefits that come with working with a market leader.The roleReporting to the Customer Delivery Manager, this permanent full-time position is for a Customer Technical Support Officer. The focus of the role is to provide the first response of manufacturer level technical support to our partners in the field, who are our Distributors, Value Added Resellers (VARs), and high-profile large-scale end users of our security technology.  We are looking for a quick-thinking individual capable of dealing with at times complex cases, with a customer first mentality.Key responsibilities:Coordinate with Services & Technology Functions to address Customer & Sales team needs.Answering helpline calls from our partner distributors, VARS and end users, ensuring customer support tickets are logged and followed up, ultimately resolved within agreed timeframes.Continually update customer with progress of ticket.Identifying and troubleshooting technical issues using our in-house guides and database.Talk clients through series of actions to resolve technical issues.Compiling knowledge that will help solve future customer issues.Regular cross function meetings with Product Managers, Engineering and Sales to discuss and resolve Commercial issues / ticket.You will need the followingA strong track record in a fast paced, call center type environment – ideally as a Technical Support Engineer, Desktop support technician or similar.Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills.Excellent interpersonal skills with a customer focused mentality.Knowledge of help desk ticketing applications such as Zendesk.An understanding of phone systems and call metrics.Additionally, the following would be highly regardedExperience with Security Software/Hardware and bus protocols.Familiar with other Database and/or related applications.Knowledge on Microsoft SQL, Query, troubleshooting etc.Certification in Microsoft, Linux, Cisco or similar technologies.Hands-on experience with Windows / Microsoft / Virtual environments.Working with Cloud solution like Azure, AWS (Optional).Understanding of Cybersecurity knowledge (Optional).BenefitsYou will be provided with a competitive base salary and strong career progression opportunities within our global organization. Apply now to find out how you can grow your career with Carrier!Carrier is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

Name: Head of Cyber Security
Description: Nano is a Fintech company focused on delivering outstanding digital home loans. Innovation, fairness and clarity are at the heart of everything we do. Nano is blazing a trail in data, digital and design and we are looking for a Head of Cyber Security to join us as we continue our remarkable growth trajectory. Nano is a tech-driven, customer-obsessed business with one clear mission – to revolutionise the home-loan industry by reshaping the financial services industry of the past with technology of the future. Our customers are at the centre of everything we do and we aim to delight by providing innovation, simplicity, transparency and clarity in products that our customers love.Apart from the fact it is hugely rewarding disrupting an old and backwards industry with new technology and forward-thinking ideas – it is our people, our culture and our leaders that make Nano such a great place to work. At Nano, we strive to be the place where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, and stay, and do their best work. We offer the opportunity to be part of a cohesive team getting involved in innovative, customer-focused projects, getting exposed to a broader range of tasks at a deeper level, and having a voice in decision making with access to senior leaders. What we are looking for in youA passion for teamwork and collaborationA willingness to challenge the status quo with a customer lensHave a ‘whatever it takes to get the job done right’ attitudeTo thrive and grow in a fast-paced Agile environmentA hands-on approach. This is not a Visio/PowerPoint® style role.  The successful candidate will be equally adept at both architecture/design but also personally implementing and maintaining Nano’s cyber security environment.In this role you will join our Cyber Security team.  You will be driving outcomes for Nano’s security posture across the cloud, networks systems and applications. You will be reporting to the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) and will have opportunities in supporting the security of all of Nano’s systems as well as deploying and managing new systems. You will be exposed to work with Fortinet, Azure, AWS, Salesforce, Heroku, O365 and many other leading cloud, end-user and SAAS products. You will be supported and mentored by the CTO to help you grow in your career.Some of your day-to-day tasks will include the following:Plan, design, develop, organise, document, and edit detailed operational procedures and other nominated IT Security and system support materials.Build a culture of cyber security awareness and responsibility across the organisation.Develop and maintain a written cyber security and systems knowledgebase, to ensure the continuity, accuracy and completeness of organisational policies, procedures and information.Develop and maintain incident response playbooks for use in the event of cybersecurity related breaches and internal cybersecurity simulationsEnsure adherence to all regulatory requirements and coordinate and manage attainment of SOC2 type II certification and ISO27001 recertification.Perform intelligence research on vulnerabilities, and implement security controls to counteract and remediate them across the organization Supporting staff and systems where their access and security needs interact with our management and security systems.Assist with regular security and control plans and auditsImplement and maintain cyber security service management, change and incident workflows, procedures and policies in the security and systems spacesDesigning, deploying, supporting and managing AWS environment, end user SIEM and Vulnerability monitoring systems, network and security systems as well as access management systems. Advise the CTO on changes in security technology and drive change within the organization to provide better experiences and servicesWorking with vendor support teams to drive rapid and effective outcomesPresent goals and recommendations on improving the organisation's security posture to senior/executive managementManage, mentor and support the career growth of the Cyber Security team.Your skills/experience must include:8+ years of specific Cyber Security experience in an engineering/architecture/management role.Familiarity with financial services regulation and a good knowledge of the various cyber security frameworks and certifications including ISO27001, SOC2 and NIST.Expert knowledge of cyber security threats and defence strategies across many layers from perimeter to application security.A strong knowledge of Cloud (AWS/Azure) and the design and implementation of VPCStrong networking skills (HTTP, TCP/IP, DNS, Routing and Switching, Load Balancing, VPC, Route 53 etc)Proven experience working directly with customers and strong communication and written documentation skills.Proven ability to work autonomously and in a teamDesirable skills/experience:Knowledge of Fortinet technology and the implementation of ZTNAA relevant cyber security role in a Financial Services organisationExperience with Heroku, Salesforce, AWS cyber securityKnowledge of Python & JavaScriptGood knowledge of network security configuration and technologies (SSL/TLS, Web Application Firewalls, Intrusion Detection)Good knowledge in managing domains, certificates, DNS and associated security (DNSSEC and DNS Filtering)Good knowledge of Windows & LinuxIt’s an exciting time to be part of our talented team, as we continue an incredible velocity of innovation and growth. Enjoy the benefits of being part of a cohesive and passionate team with modern offices in Sydney, close to Wynyard, who love to celebrate success. If this is the opportunity you’ve been looking for, then we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and cover letter to apply.

Name: Network Security Specialist
Description: Location: preferably Adelaide (open for Melbourne based resource as well)Customer: Elders Job description: Technical Environment  Palo Alto   RSA Netwitness Zscaler   Cisco ISE Citrix NetScalar  Symantec, Windows Defender Endpoint security  Qualys Guard VM  CyberArk PKI or MS CA infra  Cisco ISR 4k Routers and 9k, 3k and 2k switches  Responsibilities  Next Generation Firewalls (Cisco ASA, Palo Alto, etc.) – Essential  Log analysis / SIEM (RSA Netwitness, Splunk, etc.) - Essential  Network Access Control (Cisco ISE, etc.) - Experience required  Load Balancer/ADC (NetScaler, Etc.) - Good understanding /experience  Routing and Switching (Cisco) - Understanding  End point security (Symantec, Windows Defender etc.) Understanding  Privilege access management (CyberArk, etc.) Good to have  Microsoft's security technologies (Defender ATP, MCAS. Etc.) Experience required  Citrix NetScaler- Good understanding  Experience in Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) and/or Microsoft Certificate Authority desired Relevant Certifications (CCIE Security or Routing and Switching, CCNP Security or CompTIA Security+, CEH etc.)  Not all but one or more certifications is desired  Bachelors/Master's Degree in IT/Security/etc.  7 or more years of experience with conducting security audit, assessments, remediation measures  Through understanding of vulnerability management. Lifecycle - Qualys Guard VM Platform  Understanding of phishing and social engineering campaigns.  Staying updated on Cybersecurity trends whilst adhering to ACSC’s essential eight polices to keep client environment secure   Good vendor management skills  Awareness and adherence to ITIL processes

Name: Research Postdoctoral Fellow Cyber Security (CRC)
Description: Establish research in cyber security in AustraliaWork with leading companies and government agencies within CSCRCEnjoy the benefits of working in a large organisation in a regional locationThe RoleFixed Term (up to 12 months), Full Time$100,476 to $119,121 pa (plus 17% superannuation)Bathurst or Wagga WaggaFunded by the Cyber Security Cooperative Research Centre (CSCRC) you will work closely with the CSCRC to develop and engage in high-quality, impactful research projects that contribute to cyber security in Australia and are supported by the CSCRC.  The focus will be to apply software engineering, machine learning and/or cyber security expertise in real-life scenarios including cyber security for agriculture through various relevant tasks such as agriculture asset management, data collection and visualisation, virtual CISO development, malware detection, ransomware detection, vulnerability detection, intrusion detection, threat hunting, authentication, cryptography, cyber security disaster recovery, data trustworthiness, privacy-preserving data sharing/flow, and privacy-preserving federated learning.  To be successful you will have:A PhD relevant to the computing discipline, computer science, information technology or related areas in cybersecurity, machine learning or software engineering with strong programming expertise.Excellent research track record in cyber security, machine learning and/or software development as demonstrated by publications in top-tier journals and conferences.Demonstrated capabilities to conduct research in the area of cyber security, machine learning, software engineering or related technical areas and implementation of such research and/or a record of research capacity to make an autonomous contribution.A demonstrated ability to effectively liaise with academic colleagues and administrative staff, and work as a member of a team.Application Requirements  Applicants are expected to apply online and address the selection criteria in the position description. If you experience difficulties applying online or for further information on completing the application process please visit our how to apply page or contact us.  Evidence of having received a full course of a COVID-19 vaccination approved by the Therapeutic Goods Administration is required as a condition of entry onto Charles Sturt University campuses. Accordingly, evidence of vaccination or a valid exemption is a condition of employment at Charles Sturt University.  About Us  Charles Sturt University is a young and growing university committed to developing far-sighted people who help their communities grow and flourish. We make a significant contribution to the prosperity and vibrancy of our rural and regional communities, with a reach and impact across Australia and internationally. We work together with industry, communities and students to create new thinking, inspire each other and make a positive and progressive contribution to the world.  The Faculty of Business, Justice and Behavioural Sciences covers a diverse range of disciplines and is comprised of 6 Schools, 2 Centres and CSU Engineering - the School of Management and Marketing, School of Accounting and Finance, School of Computing and Mathematics, School of Policing Studies, Australian Graduate School of Policing and Security, School of Psychology, Centre for Law and Justice, Centre for Customs and Excise Studies and CSU Engineering.  Our Faculty are leaders in their fields of teaching and research and combine significant professional experience with academic expertise. Our schools continue to grow through close collaboration and consultation with private industry, regulators, professional bodies, community engagement, partnerships and global networks.  Charles Sturt University (Charles Sturt) is member of the consortium which has been successful in establishing $140M Cyber Security Cooperative Research Centre (CSCRC). The Cyber Security CRC consists of 23 participants including leading companies such as Optus, CISCO, TSS Cyber and Tata Consulting and crucial government agencies such as the Australian Signals Directorate and the Australian Federal Police. State governments including from NSW to WA are also members of this industry led consortia.  Charles Sturt University offers a great work-life balance, professional development opportunities and generous financial benefits.  Charles Sturt University is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. This is demonstrated through our Workplace Gender Equality Agency Employer of Choice Citation and our Athena SWAN Bronze Institutional Award. Charles Sturt is also a participating member in the Australian Workplace Equality Index. Applications are encouraged from Indigenous Australians; people with a disability; women (particularly for senior and non-traditional roles); people who identify as LGBTIQA+; and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.  Further Information  Additional information is available in the Position Description or by contacting:  Zahid Islam | Professor of Computer Science | zislam@csu.edu.au | Ph: 02 6338 4214  Closing Date: 11 pm, 21 July 2022

Charles Sturt University is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. This is demonstrated through our Workplace Gender Equality Agency Employer of Choice Citation and our Athena SWAN Bronze Institutional Award. Charles Sturt is also a participating member in the Australian Workplace Equality Index. Applications are encouraged from Indigenous Australians; people with a disability; women (particularly for senior and non-traditional roles); people who identify as LGBTIQA+; and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.  Further Information  Additional information is available in the Position Description or by contacting:  Zahid Islam | Professor of Computer Science | zislam@csu.edu.au | Ph: 02 6338 4214  Closing Date: 11 pm, 21 July 2022

Name: Customer Technology Support
Description: Join us during an exciting time of expansion! Are you an energetic, motivated, technically minded individual with Security experience? This is a fantastic opportunity to join Carrier Fire & Security in our growing Notting Hill Technical Support team. Not only do we have a fantastic team culture, but you will benefit from employment stability, progression opportunities as well a range of additional benefits that come with working with a market leader.The roleReporting to the Customer Delivery Manager, this permanent full-time position is for a Customer Technical Support Officer. The focus of the role is to provide the first response of manufacturer level technical support to our partners in the field, who are our Distributors, Value Added Resellers (VARs), and high-profile large-scale end users of our security technology.  We are looking for a quick-thinking individual capable of dealing with at times complex cases, with a customer first mentality.Key responsibilities:Coordinate with Services & Technology Functions to address Customer & Sales team needs.Answering helpline calls from our partner distributors, VARS and end users, ensuring customer support tickets are logged and followed up, ultimately resolved within agreed timeframes.Continually update customer with progress of ticket.Identifying and troubleshooting technical issues using our in-house guides and database.Talk clients through series of actions to resolve technical issues.Compiling knowledge that will help solve future customer issues.Regular cross function meetings with Product Managers, Engineering and Sales to discuss and resolve Commercial issues / ticket.You will need the followingA strong track record in a fast paced, call center type environment – ideally as a Technical Support Engineer, Desktop support technician or similar.Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills.Excellent interpersonal skills with a customer focused mentality.Knowledge of help desk ticketing applications such as Zendesk.An understanding of phone systems and call metrics.Additionally, the following would be highly regardedExperience with Security Software/Hardware and bus protocols.Familiar with other Database and/or related applications.Knowledge on Microsoft SQL, Query, troubleshooting etc.Certification in Microsoft, Linux, Cisco or similar technologies.Hands-on experience with Windows / Microsoft / Virtual environments.Working with Cloud solution like Azure, AWS (Optional).Understanding of Cybersecurity knowledge (Optional).BenefitsYou will be provided with a competitive base salary and strong career progression opportunities within our global organization. Apply now to find out how you can grow your career with Carrier!Carrier is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: The Division The Customer Strategy and Technology team within Transport leads the development of long-term, multi-modal strategies, plans and policies across NSW. We leverage data and insights, implement new technologies, drive innovation and build partnerships to provide customer-centred solutions. About IT at TFNSW TfNSW's IT group provides the tools, information and services that enable 30,000 employees to deliver a smart and efficient transport network. We bring the future to our people by delivering innovative solutions and minimising business disruptions, building an engaged and connected workforce through tech-enablement. This is an exciting time to join the team, with a committed annual investment of $700m for progressive technology projects including bots, apps, AI solutions, autonomous 3D mapping drones, cybersecurity and transforming cameras across our network. The Opportunity  Right now, we have a permanent full time opportunity for a Senior Business Analyst to join Customer Strategy and Technology team based in Macquarie Park office with flexible working arrangements. If successful, you will provide analysis, advice and support the translation of business requirements to data modelling and/or business intelligence/analysis solutions to ensure the correct solution design and implementation. The role is also responsible for conducting analysis, evaluation of functional and non-functional requirements and documentation of technical specifications. What you will be involved in:  Lead the translation of business requirements into technical specification including data models and functionality of end user applications. Identify gaps in current availability of data to delivery solution and propose recommendations to address these including new definitions, metrics, dimensions or metadata. Work with the Manager and team to prioritise future data needs to deliver target state data layers or models required. Interpret and translate analysis results into quality technical specifications and or user stories that are insightful, clear and succinct. Develop a deep understanding of system functionality and design as well as target state outcomes to ensure that technical specifications are aligned, feasible, sustainable and scalable  About you  Minimum 8+ years' experience as Business Analyst delivering complex ICT projects Experience in working on significant Integration platform project or reporting and analytics platform as a Service or a similarly complex platform as Service projects. Expertise in writing business cases, running workshops with project groups for requirement gathering, compiling clear requirements, Tractility matrix, End User testing and Go-live support Any experience with Procurement activities of project is a bonus Strong working knowledge of data modelling principles. Experience in developing functional and non-functional requirements for business solutions. Experience coordinating with other teams for planning, design, governance, engineering and release management of processes and to ensure timely and accurate delivery of data and analytics services.  Want to know more?  Please click here to view a copy of the role description.  Interested?  Right now is an exciting time to join our team as we deliver an iconic $72.2 billion investment into future transport infrastructure and services over 40 years. Be a part of something big. Apply today to register your interest! Find out more about Transport for NSW at https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/about-us.   Our Commitment to Diversity  Great people come from all walks of life. At Transport for NSW, we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community and the customers we serve. We actively promote gender diversity in our workplaces, the employment of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and the employment of people with a disability. We welcome and encourage applications from all people regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, cultural background, or sexual orientation. If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call/text or email the contact person for this role. Salary and Benefits  The salary for this position is TfNSW Grade 8 ($120,423 - $134,872) per annum plus superannuation and leave loading. For more information on Employee Benefits at TfNSW please click here.  How to apply  To apply for this position, please submit a resume and address the questions within the application. Need help?  For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click here.   Close date: 11:59 pm on 3rd July 22
