Name: Project Manager
Description: About the RoleAs part of a growing projects team, you will be required to manage multiple projects at any one time. You will be able to work in a team with other project managers, engineers, and admin alike, but can also work autonomously to deliver required outcomes. Our clients are many and varied, which may mean travelling to client sites at times, so a valid driver's licence and personal car will be required. You will have a client focus, good commercial acumen, ensuring high quality service delivery backed by great customer service and excellent documentation skills. Time management and a willingness to interact with clients are critical to your success in the role.  ResponsibilitiesProviding effective day to day management of medium to large sized projects - budget, schedule, resource management, client engagement and satisfactionWorking with Pre-Sales teams to establish a strong project baseline through to kick off with the clientLeading project initiation activities including development of project schedules, procurement and engagement management for clients and sub-contractors.Maintaining risk, action, issue, and dependency registersCoordinating change management and project variationsDriving and monitoring project progress to the satisfaction of clients, while meeting company objectives Project administration as requiredRegular reporting on various metrics and progress measures Key Selection CriteriaStrong planning, coordinating and time management skillsWell-developed interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbalSolid understanding of the Project Management LifecycleDemonstrated skills in project management software toolsAbility to create and maintain high quality documentationProven ability to manage projects autonomously Skills and ExperienceProject delivery in ICT environments2+ years experience in project management related roles (PM or PM Support role)Good working knowledge with the MS Office Suite (including MS Project)Project Management qualifications/certifications (highly regarded)  What will make you a good fit?Ability to adapt to changing situationsDesire to learn and gain additional experienceStrong outcomes focus – client and companyStrong sense of accountability for your performance and actionsTeam player, willing to contribute and share ideas as part of our continuous improvement goals About ArchiTechArchiTech Network & Communications Solutions is a fast-growing Australian owned and operated ICT solutions integrator, specialising in enterprise networking, wireless, cybersecurity, collaboration, data centre and IoT technologies. With a focus on providing exceptional value and outcomes for our clients, we use our experience and industry expertise, to map leading world class technologies to organisational needs, and deliver custom solutions to suit. We have designed and delivered integrated solutions to some of the largest healthcare providers in Australia. Our approach to client engagement is what makes us stand out from the crowd - working closely with our clients to truly understand their business requirements, resulting in better delivery of outcomes and greater satisfaction to all. www.architech.net.au Why work at ArchiTech?We believe that when staff enjoy what they do, it drives them to work at their best. To us our people are not just workers, they are part of the fabric that makes ArchiTech a great place to work.An attractive remuneration package with flexible working optionsOpportunity to get involved in a variety of interesting, challenging and rewarding ICT projectsCareer development through training, mentoring, new product learnings and cross industry exposure Diverse and inclusive workplace with a supportive culture, where you can have fun and be yourself!How to applyTo start an application, click on ‘apply’ and submit the following:an up-to-date resume detailing your relevant experience for the rolea cover letter (max 1 page) specifically addressing the above criteria and your suitability to the role advertisedArchiTech reserve the right to close off this position early as applications will be considered upon receipt.  Please note:Only shortlisted candidates will be contactedYou must have the right to work permanently in AustraliaAn offer of employment will be subject to a satisfactory National Police Clearance and Working with Children Check being provided to ArchiTechIn line with Government directions that apply to our client base, ArchiTech will require a copy of your Covid-19 Vaccination CertificateYou must have a valid Australian driver’s license and use of a personal vehicle to perform this roleFor any enquiries, please contact careers@architech.net.au

Name: MS Operations Team Lead
Description:
Data Centre & Cloud Solutions Architect - NTT
Is innovation part of your DNA? Do you want to enable a connected future for people, organizations, and society?
Join our growing global NTT team and you’ll be part of the world’s largest ICT company (by revenue). We’ve combined the capabilities of 28 remarkable companies to become one, leading technology services provider. Together, we help our people, clients, and communities do great things with technology to create a more secure and connected future. We employ 40,000 people across 57 countries. By bringing together the world’s best technology companies and emerging innovators, we work together to deliver sustainable outcomes to businesses and the world. Innovation is part of our DNA. We believe it’s key to what makes us different. So, we strive to move forward, challenge the status quo, and drive excellence through the technologies we integrate and the services we deliver around the world. The result is connected cities, connected factories, connected healthcare, connected agriculture, connected conservation, connected mobility, and connected sport. Together we enable the connected future.
Want to be part of the team?
NTT is a Global Technology and Business Solutions Provider. Services include digital business consulting, technology and managed services for cybersecurity, applications, workplace, cloud, data centre and networks.
Managed Services supports day-to-day operations, across multivendor hybrid IT environments. Engineers ensure client IT infrastructure, systems and solutions remain operational through proactively identifying, investigating, and resolving technical issues, restoring service, and facilitating the automated management and control of these systems.
The Managed Services Digital Workplace team within the Managed Services Delivery group provides services to clients across many industry sectors. They support and manage server platforms including Windows, Linux, Solaris and AIX, Messaging platforms, Citrix ADC and CVAD environments and related systems and applications.
Team Leads are primarily responsible for managing a team of engineers that ensure managed service is provided to all clients, to ensure that their IT infrastructure and systems remain operational and that contracted Managed Services outcomes are delivered to the client.
 
Responsibilities:

Monitors the work queues and provide support to client where the ticket is highly technical or sophisticated in nature
Works independently, with general direction from the client, stakeholders, team lead or senior manager, to perform operational tasks to resolve all escalated incidents / requests in a timely manner within agreed SLA
Provide support to escalated incidents
Use operational and diagnostic procedures to resolve escalated tickers in unique and complex client environments
Timely escalation of all tickets to management with ensuing updates, where applicable
Act as emergency support contact as needed, for critical client and business impacting issues
Provide operational support and continuous service improvement post client handover from TS (or other) teams
Constantly measure and analyse team’s delivery capabilities to Support, maintain and manage the technical aspects of a managed solution.
Implement training and development initiatives for direct reports
Lead talent acquisition / recruitment activities for vacant positions in direct team
Set goals and manage performance for direct reports

 
Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, systems analysis or a related study, or equivalent experience
Experience spanning at least two IT disciplines, including technical architecture, network management, application development, middleware, database management or operations
High level of experience in management of people, process and technology
High level of experience in coaching and mentoring teams on a daily basis
Demonstrated experience in implementation of continual service improvement in previous roles (through automation, process enhancements, etc)
Demonstrated experience in organisational change management (transformational experience)
ITIL Foundation certification v3 / v4

 
Technical Stack

Server Infrastructure: DellEMC, HP, Cisco UCS
Hyperconverged Infrastructure: Cisco Hyperflex, VxRail
Storage: NetApp, DellEMC, vSANs, HDS, Pure, HP
Backup: Commvault, DellEMC, Veritas, Veeam, Rubrik
Hypervisor: Vmware, HyperV, OVM
Operating System: Windows Server, Linux, UNIX
Messaging Applications: Exchange, Skype, Teams, O365, Email Hygiene and Archiving
Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktops, Citrix Netscalers
Hyperscale Cloud Tenancies: Azure, AWS

 Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.
For more information about this or other opportunities, please contact Raid Ahmad. Please quote our job reference number 568695.About usNTT Ltd. is a leading global technology services company. Working with organizations around the world, we achieve business outcomes through intelligent technology solutions. For us, intelligent means data driven, connected, digital and secure. As a global ICT provider, we employ more than 40,000 people in a diverse and dynamic workplace that spans 57 countries, trading in 73 countries and delivering services in over 200 countries and regionsNTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category.

Name: Systems Administrator
Description: Systems Administrator   About VICSEG New Futures VICSEG New Futures is a not for profit community organisation offering various services to recently settled migrant and refugee families for almost 40 years. VICSEG New Futures' registered training organisation, New Futures Training, was established in 2002 and provides vocational training and pathways to employment in the human services and care sectors.    About the role We are looking to employ a full time Systems Administrator.  You will be responsible for analysing, installing, troubleshooting, and maintaining all areas of the VICSEG network, including client/server systems, client/server applications, systems communications, user account management, software deployment, and endpoint protection.  You will also be responsible for proactive maintenance tasks such as checking backup systems and ensuring they are running, as well carrying out various preventative and reactive maintenance measures. This position would suit a person with 3-5 years’ experience in a similar role along with direct experience working within a Non for Profit organisation.     You will be responsible for  Configure, implement and administer servers and related applications to provide a responsive and consistent computing environment with optimum securityIdentifies computing requirements and confers on system needsInstall, configures and maintains multiplatform systems hardware, software and componentsResponsible for all network, hardware and systems infrastructure; managing and maintaining routers, switches, firewalls, and wireless networks; maintaining and testing backupsBuild new systems and deploy application softwareInstall new software releases and system upgradesCreate, update, audit, and modify Data Centre documentation as requiredTroubleshoots components of systems relying on proven techniques for IT data centre analysis and evaluation.Partners with Engineers to ensure successful implementation of new technologies and assures SOP’s are accurate.  Skills and experience Essential  Must hold a current Degree Qualification in Computer Science or Information Technology or Information      Systems  A minimum 3 years’ experience working as a Systems AdministratorKnowledge of Windows Server technologies, Active Directory, storage, and backup devices, VMWare and other solutions as necessary to fulfil job responsibilities.Analytical/problem-solving skillsProficiency in server, storage, and virtualization standards, techniques, and toolsStrong understanding of networks and network equipment, antivirus software and cybersecurity platforms and excellent Scripting skillsClear and concise verbal and written communication to all levels of the organizationWorking with Children Check and National Police Check High level of organizational, administrative, and planning skills Demonstrated ability to work efficiently, and respond to management request with urgency                             Desirable   Experience of working in a multicultural environment with understanding and empathy regarding issues faced by migrants, refugees and others from non-English speaking backgrounds. Direct experience working within the NFP space   Benefits and perks You will be joining a culturally diverse, community based organisation with a supportive culture and management    team. This position offers a great work/life balance with, with family-friendly hours. As a Not-For-Profit organisation, we also provide the opportunity for Salary Packaging. $73,000 - $83,000 per annum + 10.5% superannuation     How to Apply Please follow the prompts and 'apply' now by submitting a Resume and Cover Letter outlining your suitability for the role. Please outline your experience with the essential experience listed above.   Closing date for applications is 17/7/2022 We wish you all the best, and look forward to meeting you.

Name: Manager Network and Communication Services
Description: Frankston HospitalPermanent Full Time•	Ideal opportunity to develop your career•	Mornington Peninsula Location•	Salary Packaging Benefits Who We Are and What We Stand ForPeninsula Health is the major metropolitan health service caring for a community of 300,000 people. Our Vision is to provide exceptional health and community care. To realise this vision we need people who strive for a sense of achievement, take an interest in their individual growth, enjoy innovation and looking for ways to improve and have a passion for communicating and connecting with others. In representing Peninsula Health, we expect all employees and volunteers to reflect our values: Be the Best, Be a Role Model, Be Open and Honest, Be Compassionate and Respectful and Be Collaborative. We are One Peninsula Health.What You Will Be Doing Be responsible for managing the technical operational support, delivery, maintenance and integration activities for the business Network and Communications Services.Define technical Network and Communications architectures to meet strategic objectives and priorities while simultaneously managing the team of engineers responsible for its support and maintenance.Lead multiple projects and manage the technical team responsible for the implementation and maintenance of Network and Communications technologies and architectures within the organisation, whilst assuring security and high availability.This is a technical role with a focus on business engagement and delivery. This position works closely with vendors and stakeholders to ensure that service levels for performance, availability and support are achieved. A well organised, client focused approach to excellent service delivery is critical to the success in this role.What You NeedWe anticipate you will have:•	Extensive experience with vendor management, managed services and liaising and negotiating for Network and Communication services•	Extensive knowledge and experience managing Cybersecurity practices within Network and Communication services•	Extensive experience with design, development and implementation of Network and Communication technologies•	Expert knowledge and experience with Cisco Network Technologies (Cisco Technology Stack), Cisco Voice, and collaboration, technologies•	Expert knowledge and experience managing Firewalls, Hybrid Cloud/On-premises environments, and related technologies•	Demonstrated experience in similar network and communication leadership roles (desirable)What NextIf this sounds like you, this is a fantastic opportunity for the right person to make your mark within Peninsula Health.If you experience any issues signing in or registering, please feel welcome to contact us - the People, Experience & Performance Team on (03) 9784 2700. Additional RequirementsPeninsula Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We encourage applications from individuals from all cultural backgrounds including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. We also provide a safe and supportive workplace for people with disabilities.   To find out more about our recruitment processes, compliance obligations and to prepare your application to join our team please visit:  https://www.peninsulahealth.org.au/careers/working-preparing-employment/  This role must be fully vaccinated for Covid-19 and meet the requirements of the Peninsula Health immunisation policy.Join Peninsula Health and help us to deliver safe, personal, effective & connected care to every person, every time.  Enquiries: Daniel TophamPh: 0397847816Applications Close: 06/07/2022To view the position description or submit your application please click the 'Apply Now' button below.

Name: Technical Officer (HEO 4)
Description:
About the Role This position undertakes a range of technical duties to support the Unit’s commercial testing activities and projects.  About UniSAThe University of South Australia is Australia’s University of Enterprise. Our culture of innovation is anchored around global and national links to academic, research and industry partners. Our graduates are the new urban professionals, global citizens at ease with the world and ready to create and respond to change. Our research is inventive and adventurous and we create new knowledge that is central to global economic and social prosperity.UniSA STEM links engineering, mathematics, science, defence and cybersecurity, environmental science, aviation, information technology, construction and project management, harnessing the connections across disciplines to bring big ideas to fruition. Our researchers are solution focused and collaborative to deliver technical expertise and advice to industry, government and community groups to make commercially viable and sustainable impacts. We integrate research into our teaching, with students working alongside researchers in first-class facilities, what’s discovered one day is taught the next. Our graduates are entrepreneurs and trailblazers, who design and build the world they want to live in. UniSA STEM also incorporates leading edge research organisations; the Future Industries Institute, the Australian Research Centre for Interactive and Virtual Environments and the Centre for Industrial Artificial Intelligence (AI). Core Responsibilities 

Under broad supervision, conduct water meter tests and calibration as per National Association of Testing Authorities (NATA) requirements for pattern approval and for industry accreditation for manufacturers, government agencies such as SA Water etc 
Follow defined test procedures and/or Standard Operating Procedures to undertake various technical tests
Interpret test results within scope and complete all required testing documentation accurately
Plan, design, adapt and/or fabricate specialised equipment and components required for use in commercial projects and ensure that they are fit for purpose 
Ensure testing apparatus are always in calibration, and in good working order. Perform troubleshooting exercises on minor equipment issues

Essential Skills and Experience 

Minimum Certificate III in Engineering (Mechanical) and relevant work history, or an equivalent level of knowledge gained through any other combination of education, training and/or experience and relevant work history
Demonstrated experience operating and maintaining specialised workshop and mechanical equipment (e.g. sheet metal/fabrication work, hydraulics and pneumatics)
Demonstrated conceptual, analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to evaluate and critically analyse issues and explain technical requirements
High-level organisational skills with the demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities, work to tight deadlines, use initiative, and anticipate future requirements
Strong customer service skills underpinned by the ability to communicate, build relationships, and work effectively, with a diverse range of stakeholders and cultures

Benefits Getting a great job working with the best is just the start. UniSA rewards its staff with a wide variety of benefits such as: 

Access to great personal development opportunities 
Generous superannuation contributions of 17% 
Employee assistance and development programs 
Staff study support 
Various on-site services available at our campuses which may include on-site gym membership 

Culture As a University of Enterprise, we offer a dynamic and agile workplace culture, one that embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Our staff are creative and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm. We embrace diversity and inclusion in a vibrant, engaging environment. Our people are authentic, resilient, and influential, and we deliver results. How to ApplyFor a copy of the position description and to apply, please visit Working at UniSA. The online application form will list the specific selection criteria that you need to address.  Please address your cover letter to Emma Kelvin, Recruitment Consultant. For further information about the position or the recruitment process, please contact UniSA Recruitment Central on +61 8 8302 0482 or via email at recruitment@unisa.edu.au using job reference number 4220. Applications close: 11.30pm Sunday 3 July 2022Applications welcomed from Australian or NZ citizens, Australian permanent residents and those who have the legal right to work in Australia for the term of appointment. #LI-DNI

Name: Senior Cyber Security Lead
Description: ABX has Modernised, Globalised & Integrated the precious metal markets by redefining the way physical bullion is traded. ABX connects all major global liquidity centres and break down the barriers to entry to the global wholesale market. Allocated Bullion Exchange founded and partnered with Kinesis who are a leading global fintech that is delivering a new global monetary system that leverages emerging cryptocurrency technologies backed 1:1 by the allocation of physical gold and silver. Robert Walters have partnered with Allocated Bullion Exchange. We are looking for a passionate Cyber Security Leader to establish and further the ABX Cyber Security Practices.  In this role, you will be responsible for leading our cyber defense and IT risk portfolio across our exchanges and crypto trading applications. This role will work closely with our clients operations and development teams to ensure their software is fully tested and is highly secure. You will be responsible for driving a small globally distributed team working alongside our Architects, Project Managers and delivery partners to deliver highly secure solutions and infrastructure. You will also be responsible for maintaining our PCI-DSS standards, completing the SAQ's, training internal teams, securing our infrastructure and improving our security posture.  ResponsibilitiesProtects our systems by defining access privileges, control structures, and resources.Recognises problems by identifying abnormalities, reporting violations.Implements security improvements by assessing current situation; evaluating trends; anticipating requirements.Determines security violations and inefficiencies by conducting periodic audits.Upgrades system by implementing and maintaining appropriate security controls.Keeps the business informed by preparing performance reports, communicating system status.Maintains quality service by following and improving our organisational standards.Maintains technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing publications.Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.To be recognised as our expert in cloud-based computing and operation of multiple web-based applications and services.Matches the technical security requirements with the need to be compliant and meet our privacy obligations.Researching, designing, and implementing IT security solutions for company systems that comply with applicable security policies and standards.Monitor all security operations and infrastructure.Work across all functions to reduce our technical risk.Implement new ideas and technology.Audit policies and controls on an ongoing basis.Champion cybersecurity for and to ABX / Kinesis. Skills5+ years of experience in security engineering and design.Experience in fintech and / or crypto-currencies.Expertise in complex web environment.Experience in securing API transactions including authentication.Practical experience with database security, content filtering, vulnerability management, and anti-malware, Data Loss Prevention, Identity Management, encryption, mobile device security, penetration testing, incident response, Security Event Management.Assessing and managing security tools in the market and making recommendations.Knowledge of regulatory compliance and information security management frameworks.Knowledge of common vulnerabilities and exploitation techniques.Analysing potential impact of new threats and communicating risks to the business.Experience working in a fast-paced environment.Ability to work collaborate within teams and across functions.Excellent attention to detail.Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.Adept at communicating the technical to non-technical stakeholders.Committed to ongoing learning and development.Strong organisational / time management / multi-tasking skills and the ability to manage changing deadlines and work autonomously.Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply. To apply please click apply or call Chris Butcher on 08 9266 0946 for a confidential discussion.

Name: Senior Problem & Capacity Manager
Description:
Could this be one of those rare moments to do the best work of your career? At Tabcorp, our story continues to evolve every day. It’s an exciting moment in our history - a new era of Tabcorp. We’re raising the game by creating the most engaging betting and entertainment experiences, and to lead in integrity. 
We’re here to create excitement everywhere – through our incredible people, unrivalled experiences and strong relationships. We're bringing industry leading products and services to our customers and breaking into new horizons.
Game to join us? 
 
What you’ll do
Your role will lead complex problem & capacity management and will resolve problem, and capacity issues and manage the process to restore normal service operation for highly available platforms, products and services that are accessible and performing effectively to Tabcorp’s Business.
You will obsess about customer happiness (Tabcorp Users) and provide a significant amount of user interaction and a highly effective resolution of service and end user issues to provide Tabcorp with a secure and robust service for all major services, 24/7/365 across all geographic locations.
You are accountable problem and capacity management within the Technology environment and focus on improving operational efficiency by building strong business relationships through delivery excellence, client focus and commercial insight.
What you’ll bring 

Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or applied science or a related field of study, or equivalent experience.
ITIL Certified.
Experience in technology with experience in problem management working in a complex enterprise with 24/7/365 services, including servicing customer facing platforms.
Extensive operational support experience in supporting large and complex IT and business environments.
Advanced knowledge of IT Service Management concepts and processes.
Secure understanding of service levels from a commercial perspective.
Experience in delivery of technology uplift and remediation/simplification across infrastructure, cloud adoption, core software, digital engineering/DevOps.
Astute at developing business aligned IT strategies, frameworks, and roadmaps (and communicating these).
Experienced in agile, lean, DevOps, and other best (and next) practice.
Experience working with a variety of supplier / resource models, including matrix, managed services, and multiple suppliers.
ISO 27001 & 9001 knowledge.
Proven experience in developing and maintaining strong relationships across business and technology teams.
An understanding of IT governance, cybersecurity, risk, and compliance requirements in an ICT context.

What you’ll get 
Not only will you receive an awesome candidate experience from our caring Talent team, the perks of working with us are pretty good too!
The list is extensive but here are a few:

A “say yes” approach to flexible working to meet your individual needs
A multitude of leave types such as cultural leave, volunteer leave and 18 weeks’ parental leave for all new parents, regardless of gender
We’re committed to Inclusion & Diversity with a range of initiatives such as our annual Inclusion Month celebrations and our Gender Affirmation Statement of Support
We’re proud to have been named an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the federal government’s Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) for the seventh consecutive year
We offer a comprehensive (and free) health and wellbeing app called The Arena to support you and your family’s mental and physical health
We’re committed to your learning and development with a dedicated platform with helpful resources from leadership to technology to upskill and cross train

About Tabcorp? 
We’re Australia’s leading gambling entertainment company. Together, we build on our 100+ year heritage by delivering Excitement with Integrity, every day. Each one of us is here to put our customers at the heart of everything we do by creating moments that engage, surprise and thrill.?
Our 3,000+ strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive homegrown world-class?brands;?TAB, Sky Racing and MAX. As an ASX listed company, we’re proud to shape our industry for the better. Because together, anything’s possible.?
Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au [link removed].
COVID 
Tabcorp is closely monitoring Department of Health guidelines to ensure we continue to provide a safe working environment. You may be required to present evidence of Covid vaccination in order to comply with Public Health directions and fulfil the requirements of this role.
This role can be based in Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane.

Name: Major Incident, Problem & Capacity Manager
Description:
Major Incident, Problem & Capacity Manager - Melbourne, or Sydney
Could this be one of those rare moments to do the best work of your career? At Tabcorp, our story continues to evolve every day. It’s an exciting moment in our history - a new era of Tabcorp. Game to join us?

You will lead the Major Incident, Problem & Capacity Management team and have ownership to drive the efficiency and effectiveness of the major incident, problem, and capacity management process to manage the process to restore normal service operation for highly available platforms, products and services that are accessible and performing effectively to Tabcorp’s Business.

ITIL Certified.

Experience in delivery of technology uplift and remediation/simplification across infrastructure, cloud adoption, core software, digital engineering/DevOps.

An understanding of IT governance, cybersecurity, risk, and compliance requirements in an ICT context.

Name: Development Manager (work from home)
Description: About UsAt RedShield, we’re on a mission to improve the resiliency of our customers’ applications and APIs. We're re-defining the concept of WAFs, and secure application publishing. We deliver state of the art defences for websites and web applications. We ensure application compatibility, provide DDoS and common web vulnerability protection, and target 100% vulnerability mitigation through our unique advanced shields, which modify application behaviour without needing to change a single line of code.About the RoleWe're looking for a Development Manager responsible for the day to day people and technical leadership of our Application Security Development and Product Development Teams. Ensuring the delivery of our product roadmap across all products and systems, as well as the development of our shielding platform, and our library of innovative and reusable advanced security shields.This is both a management, and hands-on technical role, which will suit an experienced engineering professional who is looking for variety and challenge, both technical and professional.Key FunctionsAlongside CTO, Product Manager, and Principal Product Architect; develop and execute on future technology strategy.Lead the Application Security Development team in delivering on the development and deployment of the web application shielding platform and shield library.Overseeing our Lead Developer and developer team, ensure that the Product Development team works closely with product management, and is well equipped to deliver the product roadmap through development of high quality code in multiple languages, across multiple platforms.Lead and motivate your teams, communicate and engage in RedShield strategy and team objectives.Empower team members to innovate and contribute to the continuous improvement of products and shields.Lead by example through your own application security development, and direct interactions with customers.About YouYou have 7+ years industry experience plus working knowledge of and experience in:Motivating and leading development teams.IT security industry with an understanding of current trends and how these impact organisations.Product roadmap implementation with strong project management skills.Penetration testing, particularly in the web application space.OWASP top ten and common web vulnerabilities at a deep technical level.FullStack development / scripting experience (python, ruby, react, elixir preferred, but not required).Serverless and containerised application development in AWSNetworking and web security scanner tools.Why RedShieldRedShield is a fun place to work, we pay well and we include stock options for our employees as we grow our footprint globally.Working flexibly is part of our DNA, and we're a supportive bunch with a passion for sharing our knowledge and developing our people.We exist at the intersection of innovation and practicality. We utilise modern and emerging technologies in the ever changing and important field of cyber security.If you’re an experienced cybersecurity developer looking for the opportunity to lead and develop high performing and talented developers, apply online today.Job Type: Full-time

Name: Network Operations Team Lead
Description: Great opportunity to join a ASX Listed company on the rise and at the for front of new network technologies.   At Field Solutions Group we are looking for an experienced Network Operations Team Lead who is a critical thinker with a passion for mentoring people.Exciting opportunity for a motivated team leader to make an impact in a growing team.  We're after a Network Operations Team Lead with carrier experience to support our team and manage the “business as usual” operations of our diverse FSG network.   This role is available in either Hobart or Brisbane.  Field Solutions Group are an ASX listed company supplying IT and Mobile telecommunication solutions to rural, regional, and metro Australia. Central to our solutions is our ability to combine and connect technologies across our network to ensure the business solution we deliver is robust, reliable and delivers true broadband.  FSG operate a Juniper and Arista environment with a mix of MPLS, eVPN and VXLAN to provide client overlays.  Recent acquisitions have introduced Cisco and Mikrotik into the mix.  Access technologies include the usual range of NBN products along with dark fibre, radio and LTE networks operated by FSG. FSG has recently acquired a telecommunications and managed services organisation (TasmaNet) and their managed services product suite is being integrated into FSG’s existing national presence.  Your responsibilities will include:Management of incidents escalated from the first and second line support teams.Leadership of major incidents in conjunction with the General Manager of Network Operations.Engaging with third line support teams in client organisations and the resolution of any associated incident.Organise the team to ensure continuous management of incidents around the clock using a mix of in-office and on-call resources.Working with vendor support teams to manage any hardware and software issues that may arise.Network capacity management.Release management regarding the software version deployed across the technology suite.Assisting with network automation initiatives.Assisting with network engineering projects as the operational workload permits. To be successful in this position you will need to demonstrate:Contribute to the organisation’s change management processes,Ensure that documentation is current and available to other staff,Ensure that the network monitoring and alerting functions are always fit for purpose,Contribute positively to the organisation’s cybersecurity posture in all activities,Participate in an on-call roster,Perform work after hours as required,Knowledge of Cisco or Juniper MPLS core, layer 2 and layer 3 technologies, Desirable knowledge of Arista, f5, Mikrotik, Cambium, Ceragon, Fortinet, VMware & HP hardware, Travel to other offices and client locations as required,Hold a valid Australian driver’s license. This role will offer a constant stream of diverse challenges that will require you to be innovative & adaptable. Strong communication skills are required as you will deal with complex scenarios to management, clients, and your team.If you are interested in a career that will challenge and motivate you, then please get in touch.

Name: Postdoctoral Research Associate/Fellow - Privacy Preserving Technologies
Description: At UTS the concepts of equity and social justice are key to our core and purpose. We are recognised widely as supporting inclusivity and valuing diversity. We are among the first Australian institutions to receive the Athena SWAN Bronze Accreditation for our commitment to action addressing gender equity in the STEMM disciplines. UTS Equal Futures celebrates and supports women in academia through every stage of their career.As part of Athena SWAN, UTS has set an overarching target of 40 per cent academic women in STEMM by 2022. The School of Electrical & Data Engineering is committed to UTS's target and supporting the career development of women academics. UTS Women in Engineering & IT program fosters a network of passionate females and males who are actively involved in the development of our next generation of young engineering and IT professionals.  The School of Electrical & Data Engineering is recruiting for two Postdoctoral Research Associates or Postdoctoral Research Fellows to join a multi-disciplinary collaborative research team comprising industry (Bosch) and UTS academics, postdocs and PhD students working on Privacy Preserving Technologies. The position will be based at the centrally located UTS Campus in Ultimo and will report directly to the Director RF Communications Technologies Lab, Associate Professor Justin Lipman, and either Professor Massimo Piccardi or Dr Daniel Franklin.The School of Electrical & Data Engineering is deeply engaged in research of national and international standing in many areas. Key areas include: wireless communications and networking, Internet of Things (IoT), applied electro-magnetics and antennas, electrical systems and power electronics, image processing, computer vision, machine learning, cybersecurity, big data analytics and big data systems, and RF IC design. Our School hosts three IEEE Fellows and 3 ARC DECRA grant holders and we conduct research funded by government agencies and national and international industry partner.About the roleConduct research in 1) Computing on encrypted data technologies in the context of privacy-preserving Federated Learning in particular secure multi-party computation and homomorphic encryption 2) Design and development of trustworthy digital cleanrooms/marketplaces using privacy-preserving computing technologiesAbout you• Computer Science or Engineering PhD in cryptographic communication protocols or secure multi-party computation or federated learning.• Thorough knowledge of the mathematical and statistical foundations of cryptographic systems.• Proficient in one or more of the following: Rust, Go, C++, C, Python, Java.• Write impeccable scientific papers for top-ranked conferences and journals.• Sustained record of presentations for conferences, workshops and industry audiences.• Demonstrated track record in research in cryptographic communication protocols or secure multi-party computation.Base Salary Range: $94,151 to $130,639 pa (Level A.3 - Level B)This role attracts 17% superannuation (pension) in addition to the base salary.UTS staff also benefit from a wide range of Employee Benefits include flexible work practices, child care centres, generous parental leave and salary packaging opportunities.This position is full-time and appointment will be made on a fixed term basis for 18 months.Our vision is to be a leading public university of technology recognised for our global impact. We are a dynamic and innovative university, ranked by the Times Higher Education as Australia's top young university, and located centrally in one of the world's most liveable cities. With a culturally diverse campus life and extensive international exchange and research programs, UTS prepares graduates for the workplaces of today and tomorrow. How To ApplyFor the full list of the selection criteria and role responsibilities please click the apply link and download the Position Statement from the UTS website. UTS is committed to diversity and inclusion in our workforce and we encourage applicants where relevant to include a relative to opportunity or career disruption/break statement within their CV.You are required to address the selection criteria in your submission in a separate document.   Only those applications submitted via the UTS online recruitment system will be accepted.  Current UTS employees should apply through their UTS Employee Self Service function. As you will be unable to save your application once started, please have all required documents and information available prior to commencing.Please ensure that the file name for each document submitted includes IRC218402 and your name.Specific enquiries or issues with your application may be directed to Pam Price in the UTS Recruitment Team at recruitment@uts.edu.au.Please be advised that as part of the selection process that you may be requested to deliver a presentation, the audience for which may include individuals not on the Selection Panel.Amended Closing Date:  Thursday 7th July 2022 at 11.59pm (AEST)We encourage applications from international candidates who don't currently hold work rights.AccessibilityUTS Recruitment cares about digital accessibility. If there is any content in our advertising that you have struggled with, please make us aware so that we can make our information accessible to all.In addition, if you have a disability that requires adjustment to the recruitment process or an alternative application pathway please contact recruitment@uts.edu.au for assistance.UTS is recognised widely as supporting inclusivity and diversity through our Wingara Indigenous Employment Strategy, Social Impact Framework, and UTS Access and Inclusion Plan.We welcome applications from women, Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those who identify as LGBTIQ, and applicants from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

Name: Major Incident Manager (Sydney or Melbourne)
Description: We are looking for an experienced Major Incident Manager to join our growing team in Sydney or Melbourne on a 6-month contract.Orro has a supportive team-based culture in which team members are expected to be proactive, self-sufficient and hands on. You will be part of a highly motivated team of over-achievers, responsible for the end-to-end ownership & management of critical service-impacting incidents.Who is Orro?Orro is an Australian technology success story. A platform-enabled, secure network and digital infrastructure provider trusted by some of Australia’s biggest brands to deliver them the future now, meeting the ever-changing needs of their markets, and our world.We are the combination of 5 companies with over 20 years of experience, who each bring subject matter expertise and depth of knowledge to any conversation and solution. We lead the industry in designing, building and operating digital infrastructure – providing greater efficiency, performance, agility and resilience. Our end-to-end, platform-enabled solutions, including cloud, collaboration, cyber and data services, take the stress out of tech for more than 400 businesses and over 20 million Australians every day.However, we never forget our job is to connect people, not machines. Therefore, we take the time to get to know our clients and learn how they like to work. It means we understand not just what they need now, but what they’ll need next.What is the role?The Major Incident Manager (MIM) is responsible for the end-to-end ownership & management of critical service-impacting incidents. This role will drive restoration, recovery and review of major incidents based on an ITIL based incident management process, resulting in better service-related outcomes and optimised availability for customers.The scope of customer services covered by this role is all operational services to customers post- initial installation.Key responsibilities for this role includes and is not limited to:Overseeing the major incident management process and matrix-management of team members involved in the prompt resolution of major incidents.Responding to a reported critical service incident and initiating the Major incident management process.Leading, driving, facilitating and chairing all Major Incident investigation activities, meetings, and conference calls with customers and resolver groups.Prioritising Major incidents according to their urgency and impact on customers and the Comscentre business.Producing documents that outline Major incident procedures, such as how & when to escalate, communication plans, handling of cybersecurity threats or how to correct server failures.Collaborating with the incident and problem management teams to ensure that all processes are diligently followed. Ensuring all administration and reports are maintained and up-to-date, including contact information, technical diagrams, Post Incident Reviews (PIRs), and raising incident, problem and change records for Major Incident resolution.Being accountable for resolving major incidents via a workaround or permanent fix, as well as following-up on any resulting permanent resolution of Problems or documented Known Errors.Guiding and adjusting the incident management process as required to ensure its effectiveness and efficiency in the swift resolution of major incidents and problems.Escalating to the Executive Team any major incident that has a critical business impact either for Comscentre or Customers.Fulfil other duties as required by management and other department personnel as requested/required. Skills, Knowledge and Experience:At least three years’ experience working in IT service management, or a similar role.Minimum - ITIL Foundation Certification (V3, 2011 or V4)Strong knowledge of IT service management software.Excellent managerial skills and ability to collaborate with team members.Ability to analyse a high volume of technical data and work in a fast-paced environment.Strong problem solving, analytical, and time management skills. Experience in applying fault-isolation and problem-solving techniques to complex issues (e.g. Kepner-Fourie, Ishikawa, Stepwise refinement) highly desirable.Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in information technology, engineering, or a related field.Industry related certifications (desirable) e.g. ITIL, Cisco, etc. Why should you work for us?Orro is an exciting Australian technology company with a wealth of experience and expertise. We welcome and celebrate Diversity of perspectives, background, and experience. This is what leads us to be and employer of choice. We are a company that takes its Corporate Social Responsibility seriously and tries its best to positively impact the society and the environment in all possible ways. Here’s a glance of what we offer you: An opportunity to join a rapidly growing national organisation – we were named Fortinet’s APAC Partner of year for 2021. Orro was named in the Australian Financial Review’s “Fast 100 list”, a list that includes some of the fastest growing companies for 2021. An opportunity to work with a supportive and passionate team to change the way Australian businesses connect, collaborate and operate.An opportunity to drive a pivotal function within a growing business at an exciting point in its history.A competitive remuneration package.An opportunity for career advancement as our business expands further. Other employee benefits including public holiday swaps to support family responsibilities and diversity with religious holidays. Parental and caregiver leave policies, flexible working, Orro-wide mentoring program, and an emerging leader’s development program. We also give 3 x paid volunteer days, novated leasing, employee discounts, access to our wellbeing platform providing exercise programs and food tips to help you reach your health and fitness goals!

Name: Senior Salesforce Developer
Description:
We’re not your average water business. We’re pretty innovative and like to challenge ourselves and push boundaries. We’re extremely passionate about building a culture where our people feel empowered to make a difference and are curious and excited about what they do!
The role requires an experienced developer who adopts best practice software development practices and collaborates with business and ICT representatives, including User Experience, Product Management and Digital Marketing staff, to deliver visual design intent and maintainable solutions.
We are expanding our Salesforce capability throughout the business and we are looking for someone to be part of this journey, developing for larger projects and initiatives, as well as BAU continuous improvement.
Our Customer Experience Product Team is passionate about our internal and external customers. We are all about being “Easy to Deal with” and delivering sustainable and stable solutions to our stakeholders. We are a tight knit team looking for someone that wants to join us on this exciting journey!
About the role

Take responsibility for Salesforce development work undertaken and ensuring highly maintainable solutions to complex problems.
Participate in meetings with customers, third party vendors, internal stakeholders and the Digital Enablement team to define requirements and progress initiatives.
Translate business requirements into functional software.
Collaborate with others on technical design and architecture for products and services as required.
Adopt best practice software development practices ensuring that software documentation is created and maintained, including architectural and cybersecurity components, and quality assurance consistently applied.
Contribute to product backlogs ensuring alignment with the Queensland Urban Utilities Digital Strategy and the priorities identified.
Capture and report product analytics to enable performance monitoring and identify future innovation opportunities.
Keep on top of enhancements and new features introduced to the Salesforce platform, as well as Sales Cloud and Service Cloud products.
Champion the use of digital tools and agile solution delivery, encouraging the adoption of underpinning principles and practices.

Experience:

Extensive experience in Salesforce programming, including:



Apex classes and triggers
Experience in Aura Components / Visualforce
Lightning Web Components (desirable but not required)



Strong knowledge/understanding of Salesforce Service Cloud and Sales Cloud products
Experience supporting integrations via APIs, ETL tools
Provide technical support for Salesforce mobile app
Create and customise standard and custom objects including fields, page layouts, Lightning Pages, security rules, validation rules
Knowledge of declarative Salesforce development tools including Process Builder, workflow, approval processes, outbound messages
Identify, diagnose, and resolve Salesforce technical problems, escalate and track problems appropriately
Best practice understanding on coding standards, governance, deployment, security implementations

Skills and attributes:

Excellent communication and analytical skills
Ability to self-manage and deliver to agreed timelines, meet expectations and produce quality outcomes that provide value to Queensland Urban Utilities and its customers.
Strong problem-solving skills
Excellent attention to detail
Innovative and creative mind-set
Knowledge of and proven experience in Agile solution delivery
Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (Octopus, TeamCity, GitHub or similar tools)
Ability to provide detailed development documentations

Why join us?
We CARE. We're a team that show up for the moments that matter and have a strong influence in shaping the moments to come. It's an exciting time to join the Experience team and make a lasting impact across customer, community and people. We're passionate about building a culture where our people feel empowered to make a difference and are curious and excited about the work we do and where we are heading.
We offer genuine flexibility and remote working arrangements, generous leave provisions, a holistic well-being program and the opportunity to be part of a community, not just a company.
If you are genuinely passionate about delivering an outstanding people experience and ready to make a real change – then what are you waiting for? Apply now!
For more information on the role: 
 DI-CRM Product Engineer Specialist - E2536.1-20220217.pdf
For more information, please get in touch with the Talent Team at careers@urbanutilities.com.au

Name: Telecommunications Technical Specialists (Entry level)
Description:
About usAt Harvardbridge we specialise in diverse ICT and Telecommunications products and services covering areas of Networks & Systems,  Cybersecurity, Web & Software Developments, e-Learning solutions and education consultancy. You will have opportunities to work various projects and exciting teams. Diversity has been our strength and we look forward to adding to that through the strength you will bring in.

If that sounds like a place you want to work, feel free to send your details or inquiries to hr@harvardbridge.com.auQualifications & experienceThe right candidate must have completed an appropriate qualification in ICT/ telecommunications. The minimum acceptable qualification is an Advanced Diploma of Telecommunications Network Engineering or or its equivalent. 
A previous experience in similar roles will be a bonus.
These roles require the right candidates to natural problem solvers, forward thinking, customer service orientated and are motivated by working and contributing to a great team. 
The appropriate candidate will require great communications skills and attention to details on daily basis.Employer questions
Your application will include the following questions:
I understand and agree that I may be contacted about this role or other roles via email or SMS.

*Mobile Phone
*Residency Status
*Current Location -- State 
* Copy of your CV
*A cover letterThe successful candidates will be required to maintain an ongoing professional development portfolio; opportunities for this will be provided by our organisation.***ESSENTIALS:

Strong communication skills when working with customers to understand a problem statement and ability to deliver network solutions regardless of delivery model
Recognise the additional detail and clarity required for a solution design, and quickly work to close these gaps.
Be able to work within the constraints to define a detailed, complete, and implementable solution. This will breakdown the solution components, what each component does and how it does it.
Summarise your solution proposal including inputs, considerations, and recommendations concisely and accurately to obtain feedback, approvals and move into implementation.
Most importantly, a team playerTasks & responsibilitiesAs part of your role, you will develop, monitor and carry out technical support functions for telecommunications networks and install computer equipment, computer systems and microwave, telemetry, multiplexing, satellite and other radio and electromagnetic wave communication systems. 
Multiple roles available include Telecommunications Network planner, Telecommunications Technical officer and Telecommunications Field EngineerREQUIRED TRAINING: 
The successful candidates will be required to under all the required skills gab training on the job.
=============================

KEY TASKS and RESPONSIBILITIES:Generally your routine tasks will include:
installing, maintaining, repairing and diagnosing malfunctions of microwave, telemetry, multiplexing, satellite and other radio and electromagnetic wave communication systems
Configuring and integrating network and telecommunications technology with computer software, hardware, desktops, peripherals, databases and operating systems.
Developing and recording logs of the details, locations and status of inventories, parts, equipment and instruments and maintaining the documentation of communication policies, procedures, guidelines and regulations, and quality standards.
Providing technical advice and information, and monitoring the performance of complex telecommunications networks and equipment.
Providing technical advice and information, and monitoring the performance of complex telecommunications networks and equipment.
Planning the development of customer access telecommunications network infrastructure.
liaising with vendors, suppliers, service providers and external resources and monitoring contractual obligations and performance delivery.
Providing ongoing operational support in designing, optimising, troubleshooting, diagnosing, repairing and resolving of telecommunications network issues.BenefitsWhat we offer

- Flexible working hours
- Competitive salary
- Support from a collaborative and experienced team to reach out to. We don’t expect you to know everything!
A friendly, casual office environment. 
Opportunities to grow

Name: Platform Technical Delivery Manager - Salesforce
Description:
Could this be one of those rare moments to do the best work of your career? At Tabcorp, our story continues to evolve every day. It’s an exciting moment in our history - a new era of Tabcorp. We’re raising the game by creating the most engaging betting and entertainment experiences, and to lead in integrity. 
We’re here to create excitement everywhere – through our incredible people, unrivalled experiences and strong relationships. We're bringing industry leading products and services to our customers and breaking into new horizons.
Game to join us? 
What you’ll do
Your role will deliver technical engineering capabilities for business demands across the Customer and Marketing Salesforce platforms including technical and design decisions, tooling, productivity, ways of working, direction, delivery scope and collaborative issue resolution.
You will understand how to engineer Salesforce platforms and add value to ensuring technology is continually improved and of the highest quality on a global scale.
What you’ll bring 

Bachelor's Degree in either Computer Science, or Commerce or equivalent qualification.
Extensive experience in a delivery management capacity, including all aspects of development, execution and delivery.
Demonstrated experience in successful delivery of a large, complex program of work.
Demonstrated experience in agile ways of working and the ability to drive adoption within a team. Experience in delivery upon Salesforce strategies.
Experience in transitioning services delivered by projects to operations.
Proven experience in developing and maintaining strong relationships across business and technology teams.
Demonstrated experience in people management.
Solid understanding of relevant legislation and associated regulations.
Experienced in agile, lean, DevOps, and other best (and next) practice.
Previous experience managing vendors and working with a variety of supplier / resource models, including matrix, managed services, and multiple suppliers.
An extensive understanding of the Information and Technology industry, as well as technology trends and next practice.
Solid understanding of IT governance, cybersecurity, risk and compliance requirements in an ICT context (e.g. PCI-DSS, ISO 27001, ISO 9000).
Proven experience in developing and maintaining strong relationships across business and technology teams.
Experience in working in a competitive, fast paced industry.

What you’ll get 
Not only will you receive an awesome candidate experience from our caring Talent team, the perks of working with us are pretty good too!
The list is extensive but here are a few:

A “say yes” approach to flexible working to meet your individual needs
A multitude of leave types such as cultural leave, volunteer leave and 18 weeks’ parental leave for all new parents, regardless of gender
We’re committed to Inclusion & Diversity with a range of initiatives such as our annual Inclusion Month celebrations and our Gender Affirmation Statement of Support
We’re proud to have been named an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the federal government’s Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) for the seventh consecutive year
We offer a comprehensive (and free) health and wellbeing app called The Arena to support you and your family’s mental and physical health
We’re committed to your learning and development with a dedicated platform with helpful resources from leadership to technology to upskill and cross train

About Tabcorp  
We’re Australia’s leading gambling entertainment company. Together, we build on our 100+ year heritage by delivering Excitement with Integrity, every day. Each one of us is here to put our customers at the heart of everything we do by creating moments that engage, surprise and thrill. 
Our 3,000+ strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive homegrown world-class brands; TAB, Sky Racing and MAX. As an ASX listed company, we’re proud to shape our industry for the better. Because together, anything’s possible. 
Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au [link removed].
COVID 
Tabcorp is closely monitoring Department of Health guidelines to ensure we continue to provide a safe working environment. You may be required to present evidence of Covid vaccination in order to comply with Public Health directions and fulfil the requirements of this role.

Name: Security Architect
Description: Servian is an award-winning global tech consultancy with a rich heritage in Data, DevOps, Digital, Machine Learning and Cloud. We embrace innovation, change, and the positive impact it has for us and our clients. All roles at Servian involve personal and technical development pathways which aim to facilitate your career growth.Servian is looking for dynamic individuals to join our growing Cybersecurity practice. We are looking for people who want to use their strong engineering skills to solve security challenges.Security testingSecurity and Risk assessmentsImplementation of DevSecOps delivery modelsCompliance as code design and deliveryCISO-as-a-ServiceSecurity ArchitectureCloud security posture reviewsThe RoleA dynamic opportunity to identify, develop and deliver Security Architecture practices across our client base. We’re looking for people who can design and implement secure solutions, have experience across multiple technologies and have a desire to learn and mentor. This position will require you to:Lead assessment activities across a range of organisations and verticals to provide insight on current status and pathways to improvements.Lead security assessments of environment and application architecture to identify and articulate the security risk profile.Lead workshops and discussions to determine a secure solution that delivers the client’s expected outcomes.Work across on-prem and cloud environments.Deliver cloud assessment reviews to enable clients to understand their alignment to best practice, with recommendations on improvements.Maintain accreditations with one or more of our key cloud and technology partners.Deliver training workshops and labs to our staff and clients.Provide Pre-Sales Support and solution architecture to tendered offerings.Your Experience: Delivering a strong security architecture requires a breadth of experience, not all of it in the security space. We’re looking for both existing security architects, as well as those looking to move into an architecture role. We are looking for a breadth of knowledge across some of the areas outlined below:Practical experience in development, operations and/or systems engineering delivery.Experience in delivering solution, enterprise or security architectures.Strong communications and an ability to communicate issues and concerns with a range of audiences.Experience with Infrastructure as Code, configuration management and automated deployments.Business and commercial acumen, enabling a pragmatic, holistic, view of the security approach.A detailed understanding of the underlying technologies and platform building blocks of the environment.A drive for self-improvement and a passion for learning.A holistic approach encompassing the business goals and solution architecture whilst maintaining a secure operating posture.A dynamic approach to your work enabling you to meet the needs of changing environments.Whilst we are looking for a Security Architect, we value a breadth of skills and capabilities. If you have some experience in any of the following, it would be seen as advantageous:Experience with application development.Experience with cloud operations.Experience in source code security tools, e.g. Snyk, SourceClear, Black Duck, SonarQubeExperience with security build chain tooling, including SAST, DAST, RAST.Experience with compliance as code approaches.Experience building/managing continuous compliance monitoring solutions.Experience designing/maintaining SIEM solutions (ie. Splunk ES, Exabeam, Arcsight) .Experience with secret management design and implementation.Applicable security certifications, such as CISSP, SABSA, CISM etc.Why join Servian?Our career pathways are not a one-size fits all, we help you identify your personal and professional goals through our mentorship program. Helping you put together an action plan and keep you accountable.Growth through unlimited L&D and goal-based learning - free access to Udemy, you pass we pay model for courses and certifications, internal run boot camps and communities of practice (Machine Learning, DevOps, WebDev, Agile/Scrum Guilds)Flat Structure - No silos or departments; have the opportunity to work across various tech stacks, industries and projects. We value trust and transparency, that’s why we have an open-door policy across the business.Create your own destiny -  We support our consultant’s creativity. If you have an idea, turn it into an initiative!Flexible WFH policy - We value work-life balance, accountability and autonomy.Wellbeing & Benefits:We provide employees with Life Insurance, Income Protection Insurance and access to an Employee Assistance Program.Generous Parental leave.Substantial Referral fee. We value your opinion and want our employees to contribute to the success of Servian!Wellbeing and mental health initiatives - Yoga, Meditation, Steptember, Around the Bay.We are proud to have a sociable workplace that values diversity and celebrates achievements with quarterly company-wide events, social events and more. Think VR laser tag, wine tours and cooking classes.Monthly in-person team lunches/dinners so you can connect with your colleagues outside of work!Consultant-led initiatives to get everyone excited, which include social and tech clubs (gaming, IoT, badminton, wellbeing, whisky and wine, etc.), meetups, and cloud vendor hackathons.We hire for mindset! If you don’t possess all of the above skills we can teach you what’s missing. So if this role resonates with you then hit that apply button!

Name: Cyber Security Specialist
Description: The Opportunity:We are seeking an experienced Cyber Security Specialist to join an exciting new project for one of our Federal Government clients You will be responsible for:Conducting capability and concept development in context with technical security.Conducting security requirements analysis and development.Conducting security design and implementation.Conducting V&V.Supporting the security certification and accreditation process.Planning and delivering engineering services, regulatory compliance.Resource management and project outcomes.Conducting reviews of contract deliverables.Supporting and/or undertaking internal cyber security assessments of the Enterprise and associated environment.Implementing technical requirements for the certification and accreditation of systems within the Enterprise.Contributing to the development and maintenance of documentation to support cyber security.Developing and supporting the cyberspace worthiness of the Enterprise and associated systems.Reviewing, evaluating, and/or providing input into the various plans, procedures, technical documentation and system review materials identified above.Attending identified meetings and provide reporting and review input What will make you a good fit for the role:Minimum NV2 clearance requiredBe a qualified cybersecurity specialist with ability to support engineering and ICT staff in developing new and novel communications technologies. Be able to support cyber security governance activities within a blended workforce team of the Department, APS and contracted technical staffUnderstand Agile project management methodology as well as the Departments technical regulatory and cyber security requirements.  Join our global team and accelerate your career with us. Contact Alex Clark via email at for a confidential discussion today.  About us NTT Ltd. is a global ICT provider, employing more than 40,000 people in a diverse and dynamic workplace, and delivering services in over 200 countries and regions. NTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment.  E: au.act.digital.ocrcareers@global.ntt

Name: Cloud Developers (React.JS / Node.JS / C# / AWS)
Description:
Immersive is looking for talented cloud developers to join our growing full-stack cloud section. As part of the team, you will help us develop existing and new cloud products that augment the advanced training simulators we manufacture. We are the global mining industry leader in optimising human performance through simulation, and take pride in the quality and innovation our people imbue in our products.
Our current customer-facing cloud products include:
A data aggregation platform that ingests, transforms, organises and securely hosts data and diagnostics from our simulation productsA learning management system that integrates our various training offerings (e-learning, VR, interactive missions) together into common curriculums, using industry standard protocolsAn analytical system that looks at trends in customer production, training and maintenance data to draw insights about training and coaching opportunities for customer personnelA product update distribution system
Our team also builds and supports a variety of internal-facing analytical & support applications.
What we offer
Exciting opportunities for technical mastery in many different areas related to Cloud and Data technologiesCompetitive salaries and strong opportunities for career progression in a successful, industry-leading companyEmpowerment to plan and estimate your own work, and have your ideas genuinely listened toAgile methodologies, continuous integration and no 'crunch time'Opportunity to pursue personal passion projects that contribute to the company's success with a portion of your timeA chance to have a real positive impact on the safety and efficiency of mining equipment operatorsAn excellent work-life balance and flexible work hours (including allowance to work from home)A friendly, welcoming work environment with a great culture and many social events
What you’ll be doing
In this role you will be working with our experienced, full-stack team to enhance and expand our suite of internal and customer facing cloud products. We deploy on the AWS platform and use modern web technologies including React.JS, TypeScript, Node.js, C# .NET. Our team is responsible for the whole lifecycle, from the AWS infrastructure to the API design to the front-end and Ux, and so we have plenty of opportunities to give our developers variety but also foster mastery and passion in specific areas.
Some of the exciting things our teams are doing are:
Developing ongoing improvements to the User Experience of our various web applications, including pushing adoption of React.JS across our product rangeExpanding the data we collect from our and our customer's products, then bringing it together to produce unique and valuable insightsDeveloping a consolidated identity management service across our products, supporting social login, MFA and enterprise user directory integrationAdopting infrastructure-as-code (Hashicorp Terraform) to manage our AWS cloud infrastructure, following best-practice architecture and cybersecurity standards
About you
We’re looking for developers with commercial experience who can demonstrate the skills we need in one or more of the following areas. You will start in your area of expertise and then be supported to grow your full-stack skills.
Frontend Developers (React.JS)
Good working knowledge of modern JavaScript (ES6+) / TypeScript for front-end web developmentWe use React.JS extensively, so experience with this is preferred but not essential
Backend/API Developers (C# or Node.JS)
Solid development fundamentals including OO, algorithms, data structures and API principlesGood working knowledge of one of:Modern C# web development in ASP.NETModern JavaScript (ES6+) / TypeScript development in Node.JSModern C# application development in WPF or WinForms
Cloud DevOps or DevSecOps
Good working knowledge of core AWS infrastructureWorking knowledge of scripting in modern JavaScript (ES6+) / TypeScriptWorking knowledge of cloud deployment and security principles

If your skills or experience are a bit different from the above but you think you'd be great at the role, we're keen to hear from you to learn more.
Why Immersive?
Immersive Technologies is one of the world’s most successful companies in driving continuous improvement of human performance within the mining industry. We’re part of the global Komatsu Group of companies, and are the world’s largest supplier of mining equipment simulators and simulator training services, with our solutions deployed in over 50 different counties. We have a large, Perth-based engineering group with plenty of experience and a great development culture.
We have some of the most exciting and interesting development projects in Perth, and our products make a genuine difference in the safety and performance of operators.
Immersive is committed to recruiting and maintaining a diverse and inclusive team because we strongly believe we’re more effective with people from a wide range of backgrounds and identities. We offer both full-time and part-time positions with flexible working hours because we value the importance of work-life balance. We work both from home and in our central well-equipped office with its lake views and great coffee.
We have a great group of people who work together in a casual and friendly atmosphere where we can all learn from each other. We work in teams and embrace lightweight, industry best-practice processes with a focus to continually improve.
Let’s talk!
If you think we're a match then please apply via our website (https://www.immersivetechnologies.com/careers/index.htm)
We’ll need your resume, detailing your experience with the technologies we use.
Immersive Technologies provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants.
